Graue Riesenkängurus verfügen über die typischen muskulösen Hinterbeine, die ihnen weite Sprünge ermöglichen, und im Vergleich dazu nur relativ kurze Vorderbeine. Sie tragen ein dichtes, silbergraues Fell, das in der Helligkeit je nach Lebensraum variiert.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wie aus dem Namen schon zu ersehen ist, leben Östliche Graue Riesenkängurus im Osten und Südosten Australiens, aber auch auf der Insel Tasmanien. Sie bewohnen vor allem offene Wälder und Grasländer, aber auch bewaldete Gebirgsregionen. Die Tiere leben in kleinen Gruppen von 10 bis 30 Tieren zusammen, im Gegensatz zu Roten Riesenkängurus sind in diesen Gruppen meist mehrere Männchen und Weibchen mit ihrem Nachwuchs organisiert, wobei zwischen den Männchen eine Rangordnung besteht, die durch Kämpfe ausgefochten wird. Als dämmerungs- und nachtaktive Tiere dösen sie tagsüber meist im Schatten von Bäumen. Graue Riesenkängurus ernähren sich hauptsächlcih von Pflanzen, vorwiegend von Gräsern und Blättern. Bei der Nahrungssuche bewegen sie sich auf allen Vieren fort, auf der Flucht oder Wanderung hingegen typisch springend auf den Hinterbeinen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ausgewachsene Riesenkängurus haben kaum natürliche Feinde, da sie sich mit Tritten ihrer kräftigen Hinterbeine gut zur Wehr setzen und außerdem mit ihren schnellen Sprüngen leicht Raubtieren entkommen können. Sie haben die Ankunft der Europäer besser verkraftet als viele kleinere Känguruarten, trotzdem stellt ihre einzige ernstzunehmende Bedrohung der Mensch dar. Sie werden zwar wegen ihres Fleisches und manchmal auch wegen ihres Felles gejagt, die Jagd ist jedoch streng reglementiert.
TEXT.Polish: Kangur szary (Macropus fuliginosis, czasami pisane Macropus fuliginosus) duży torbacz z rodziny kangurowatych. Dorosłe samce osiągają wysokość w pozycji stojącej około dwóch metrów i wagę 65 kg. Zamieszkuje suche zarośla i lasy. Odżywia się głównie trawą i innymi roślinami zielnymi. Ciąża trwa zaledwie 36 dni, a młode pozostają w torbie przez 9 miesięcy. Żyje w dużych grupach, w których przeważają samice i młode. Wciąż jeszcze bardzo liczny w Australii, lecz rzadko eksponowany w europejskich kolekcjach.[PARAGRAPH:2]Chroniony od 1983 roku. Zezwolenia na eksport dopuszczalne jest tylko w stanach Australii Południowej i Nowej Południowej Walii. W 1978 roku gatunek liczył 295000 osobników.

TEXT.English: Red Kangaroo

German.Text: Rotes Riesenkänguru:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkänguru:Roten Riesenkänguru:Rote Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus:Roten Riesenkängurus

TEXT.English: The Red Kangaroo (Macropus rufus) is the largest of all kangaroos, the largest mammal native to Australia, and the largest surviving marsupial. It is found across mainland Australia, avoiding only the more fertile areas in the south, the east coast, and the northern rainforests.[PARAGRAPH:2]This species is a very large kangaroo with long, pointed ears and a squared-off muzzle. Males have short, red-brown fur, fading to pale buff below and on the limbs. Females are smaller than males and are blue-grey with a brown tinge, pale grey below, although arid zone females are coloured more like males. It has two forelimbs with small claws, two muscular hind-limbs, which are used for jumping, and a strong tail which is often used to create a tripod when standing upright.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo's legs work much like a rubber band. The males can leap over 9 metres (30 ft) in one leap.[PARAGRAPH:2]Males grow up to a body length of 3 metres (9.8 ft) long and weigh up to 135 kilograms (300 lb). Females reach a body length of up to 1.1 metres (3.6 ft) long and weigh up to 35 kilograms (77 lb). Tails can be from 0.9 to 1 metre (3.0 - 3.3 ft) long. The average Red Kangaroo stands approximately 1.5 metres (4.9 ft) tall. Accounts of sizes greater than this are not uncommon, with some large males reportedly reaching approximately 2 metres (6 ft 7 in).[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo maintains its internal temperature at a point of homeostasis about 36 °C (97 °F) using a variety of physical, physiological, and behavioural adaptations. These include having an insulating layer of fur, being less active and staying in the shade when temperatures are high, panting, sweating, and licking its forelimbs.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Red Kangaroo's range of vision is approximately 300°, due to the position of its eyes.
TEXT.German: Das Rote Riesenkänguru (Macropus rufus) ist mit einer Kopf-Rumpf-Länge von bis zu 1,6 m und einer Schwanzlänge von 1,2 m das größte lebende Beuteltier und das größte Säugetier Australiens. Es verfügt über kräftige Hinterbeine, mit denen es weite Sprünge ausführen kann, und einen ebenso kräftigen Schwanz, der allein, das komplette Körpergewicht tragen kann. Männliche Kängurus tragen das typische rötlich-braune Fell, während das der Weibchen eher blaugrau gefärbt ist. Außerdem sind die Männchen deutlich größer und schwerer als die Weibchen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Rote Riesenkängurus bewohnen die Steppen, Halbwüsten und Buschländer Australiens. Sie leben in lockeren, kleinen Gruppen von mehreren Weibchen und einem Männchen zusammen und verbringen bis zu 10 Stunden täglich mit dem Fressen. Hauptsächlich verzehren sie Gras, aber auch Blätter und Baumrinde stehen auf dem Speiseplan. Die heißeste Zeit des Tages verbringen sie ruhend im Schatten der Bäume, weswegen sie Habitate ohne jeglichen Baumbewuchs meiden. Bei der Nahrungssuche bewegen sie sich auf allen Vieren fort, auf der Flucht oder Wanderung hingegen typisch springend auf den Hinterbeinen. Rote Riesenkängurus können bis zu 9 m weit und 3 m hoch springen und Geschwindigkeiten von bis zu 60 km/h erreichen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ausgewachsene Riesenkängurus haben kaum natürliche Feinde, da sie sich mit Tritten ihrer kräftigen Hinterbeine gut zur Wehr setzen und außerdem mit ihren schnellen Sprüngen leicht Raubtieren entkommen können. Sie haben auch die Ankunft der Europäer besser verkraftet als viele kleinere Känguruarten. Sie werden nur noch selten wegen ihres Fleisches gejagt, ihr Bestand muss aber kontrolliert werden, da sie die größten Nahrungskonkurrenten für Rinder- und Schafherden sind.
TEXT.Polish: Kangur rudy, kangur czerwony (Macropus rufus) torbacz z rodziny kangurowatych. Duży ssak roślinożerny, największy z torbaczy. Występuje pospolicie w całej Australii z wyjątkiem części południowego i wschodniego wybrzeża oraz północnych lasów równikowych.[PARAGRAPH:2]Duży lub bardzo duży kangur o sierści od brązowo-rudawej barwy na grzbiecie do płowej na brzuchu i kończynach. Długie, spiczasto zakończone uszy, tępo zakończony pysk. Samice wyraźnie mniejsze, o sierści z większym udziałem koloru szarego.

TEXT.English: Kangxi

The Kangxi Emperor was the fourth emperor of the Qing dynasty, the first to be born on Chinese soil south of the Shanhai Pass near Beijing, and the second Qing emperor to rule over China proper, from 1661 to 1722. The Kangxi Emperor's reign of 61 years makes him the longest-reigning emperor in Chinese history (although his grandson, the Qianlong Emperor, had the longest period of de facto power) and one of the longest-reigning rulers in the world. However, since he ascended the throne at the age of seven, actual power was held for six years by four regents and his grandmother, the Grand Empress Dowager Xiaozhuang.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kangxi[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kanishka

Kanishka I was the emperor of the Kushan dynasty in the second century (c. AD 127-163). He is famous for his military, political, and spiritual achievements. A descendant of Kushan empire founder Kujula Kadphises, Kanishka came to rule an empire in Bactria extending from Turfan in the Tarim Basin to Pataliputra on the Gangetic plain. The main capital of his empire was located at Puruapura in Gandhara, with two other major capitals at Kapisa and Mathura.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kanishka[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Karai Pyhare

Pombero's original name in the Guaran language is Karai Pyhare, literally "The man of the Night", he is said to be a primarily nocturnal creature. In some parts of Argentina he is known primarily by the Spanish translation of his name, Señor de la noche.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karai Pyhare[COLOR_REVERT] is a Guarani unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karai Pyhare[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Guarani unique.

TEXT.English: Karawetari

Violence is one of the leading causes of Yanomami death. Up to half of all of Yanomami males die violent deaths in the constant conflict between neighboring communities over local resources. Often these confrontations lead to the Yanomami leaving their villages in search of new ones. Women are often victims of physical abuse and anger. Inter-village warfare is common, but does not too commonly affect women. When Yanomami tribes fight and raid nearby tribes, women are often raped, beaten, and brought back to the shabono to be adopted into the captor's community. Wives may be beaten frequently, so as to keep them docile and faithful to their husbands. Sexual jealousy causes much of the violence. Women are beaten with clubs, sticks, machetes, and other blunt or sharp objects. Burning with a branding stick occurs often, and symbolizes a male's strength or dominance over his wife.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karawetari[COLOR_REVERT] is a Yanomani unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karawetari[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Yanomani unique.

TEXT.English: Karikala Chola

Karikala Chola, the greatest among the early Chola kings of the Sangam age in South India, had been the son of Ilamcetcenni and ruled around 120 C.E. Karikala led the Chola empire successfully in campaigns to unify the three Dravidian kingdoms. His name meant "the man with the charred leg," an injury he received during a fight to escape capture from a scheming competitor for his throne. He had earned praise for the beauty of his war chariots. In the Battle of Venni, Karikala crushed the Pandya and Chera forces, leading to the unifying of the three kingdoms into one under Karikala's rule. His legendary campaign into northern India may have been royal hype, since no records exist of the campaign. In any case, his skill as a commander had been acclaimed. Karikala's Chola garnered great wealth in trade with the Roman empire. He used that wealth to fund his military campaigns and to build his cities. He is reputed to have decorated the capital city of Kanchipuram with gold. He earned lasting fame by building dikes along the banks of Kaveri. He built the Grand Anaicut, the oldest dam in the world, and irrigation canals as well as tanks. His innovations and projects with irrigation greatly aiding agriculture in his kingdom. He left a legacy as an able and just king, promoting commerce and administering justice. He appears to have been sincerely mourned by the people of Chola at his death.

The Chola national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karikala Chola[COLOR_REVERT], available in the ancient/classical era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Currency[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Chola est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karikala Chola[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'antiquité et l'ère classique. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marchand[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monnaie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional chola es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karikala Chola[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercader[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Moneda[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Ćolów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karikala Chola[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Handlarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pieniądza[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Karim Khan

Mohammad Karim Khan Zand was the founder of the Zand Dynasty, ruling from 1751 to 1779. He ruled all of Iran except for Khorasan. He also ruled over some Caucasian lands and occupied Basra for some years.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karim Khan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Karoliner

Caroleans (Swedish: karoliner) were the soldiers of the Swedish kings Charles XI and Charles XII whose notable tactics differed from that of Western Europe through a greater reliance upon pikes, bayonets, and the spirit of the offensive.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karoliner[COLOR_REVERT] is a Swedish unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karoliner[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Suédoise unique.

TEXT.English: Sulaiman Khan Karrani

Sulaiman Khan Karrani (reigned: 1566-1572) was a ruler of Bengal since the death of his elder brother Taj Khan Karrani. According to the Riyaz-us-Salatin, he shifted the seat of government from Gaur to Tanda.Sulaiman, his brother Taj and Sulaiman's sons Bayazid and Daud Khan Karrani ran a short-lived Afghan vassal state of Mughal emperor Akbar in Bengal. They dominated the area while Sulaiman paid homage to the Akbar. The Afghans defeated by Akbar began to flock under his flag. The Afghans were not technically the rulers of Bengal, the post was primarily nominal.
TEXT.Polish: Sulejman Wspaniały - sułtan osmański w latach 1520-1566. Był synem Selima I Groźnego i Ayse Hafsy (Hafizy). W czasach jego panowania Imperium Osmańskie osiągnęło szczyt swojej potęgi. Prowadził liczne wojny, w wyniku których rozszerzył jego terytorium (największy, jeśli chodzi o obszar przyłączonych ziem, zdobywca osmański). Przeprowadził reformę administracji, armii, finansów. Był mecenasem kultury oraz poetą (pisał pod pseudonimem Muhibbi).

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sulaiman Khan Karrani[COLOR_REVERT] was a "Hero".
Katara Warrior
Ceylonese Unique Culture Unit.
The Katara Warrior is the Unique unit for the Ceylonese. It destroys Melee units and can do OK against archers, a weakness of the basic Maceman.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier Katara est efficace contre les unité de combat rapproché, mais également contre les archers.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero Katara ottiene un grande bonus contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato, oltre a un bonus più piccolo contro gli arcieri.
TEXT.Polish: Katar - rodzaj broni białej, wywodzącej się z Indii, używanej do zadawania szybkich, niespodziewanych pchnięć. Cechą szczególną kataru jest poprzeczny uchwyt, który oddziela ostrze od dłoni użytkownika oraz proste i obustronnie zaostrzone ostrze. Była to zabójcza broń z powodu wygodnie usadzonej rękojeści, ułatwiającej zadawanie silniejszych i szybszych ciosów niż przy użyciu sztyletu.

TEXT.English: Katari Insurgents

Túpac Katari or Catari (also Túpaj Katari) (c. 1750-November 15, 1781), born Julian Apasa Nina, was an early leader of the independence activists in Bolivia and a leader of an indigenous rebellion against the Spanish Empire in the early 1780s. His wife was Bartolina Sisa. A member of the Aymara, Apasa took the name "Tupac Katari" to honor two earlier rebel leaders: Tomas Katari, and Túpac Amaru II. ("Katari" means "serpent, large snake" in Aymara; "Amaru" means the same in Quechua, the language of Tupac Amaru. "Tupac" means "brilliant, resplendent" in both languages.) He raised an army of some 40,000 and laid siege to the city of La Paz in 1781. Katari and his wife, Bartolina Sisa set up court in El Alto and maintained the siege for 184 days, from March to June and from August to October. Sisa was a commander of the siege, and played the crucial role following Katari's capture in April. The siege was broken by the Spanish colonial troops who advanced from Lima and Buenos Aires.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Katari Insurgents[COLOR_REVERT] is a Aymara unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Insurgé Katari[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Aymara unique.

TEXT.English: Katipunan Cavalry

The Katipunan (abbreviated to KKK) was a Philippine revolutionary society founded by anti-Spanish Filipinos in Manila in 1892, whose primary aim was to gain independence from Spain through revolution. The society was initiated by Filipino patriots Andrés Bonifacio, Teodoro Plata, Ladislao Diwa, and others on the night of July 7, when Filipino writer Jos Rizal was to be banished to Dapitan. Initially, the Katipunan was a secret organization until its discovery in 1896 that led to the outbreak of the Philippine Revolution.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Katipunan Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is a Tagalog unique unit.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalerie Katipunan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Tagalog unique.

TEXT.English: Kayak
Very Early Naval Unit.
TEXT.Spanish: Unidad naval primitiva.

TEXT.English: The Kayak is a very early naval exploration unit. It does better at exploring and getting Goody Islands, as well as moving faster than the Canoe.
TEXT.French: Le Kayak est une toute première unité d'exploration navale. Il est surtout utile pour explorer et obtenir les îles bonus, car il peut se déplacer plus rapidement que le canoë.
TEXT.Italian: Il Kayak è un'unità da esplorazione navale molto antica; riceve bonus dalle isole inesplorate e si muove più velocemente delle canoe.
TEXT.Spanish: El Kayak es una unidad de exploración naval muy antigua. Es muy buena en la exploración del terreno y de Islas inexploradas; a su vez se mueve más rápido que la Canoa.

TEXT.English: Ketabdar

So strong is the Persian aptitude for versifying everyday expressions that one can encounter poetry in almost every classical work, whether from Persian literature, science, or metaphysics. In short, the ability to write in verse form was a pre-requisite for any scholar. For example, almost half of Avicenna's medical writings are in verse.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ketabdar[COLOR_REVERT] is a Ghurid unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ketabdar[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Ghurid unique.

TEXT.English: Khaemwaset

Khaemwaset was the fourth son of Ramesses II, and the second son by his queen Isetnofret. He is by far the best known son of the king, and his contributions to Egyptian society were remembered for centuries after his death. Khaemwaset has been described as "the first Egyptologist" due to his efforts in identifying and restoring historic buildings, tombs and temples. Khaemwaset grew up with his brothers during a time of foreign conflict. He apparently was present at the Battle of Kadesh, at the siege of Qode (Naharin), the siege of Dapur in Syria and earlier in Nubia. After this initial period where Khaemwaset may have had some military training, or at least was present at the battlefield, he became a Sem-Priest of Ptah in Memphis. This appointment occurred in c. Year 16 of Ramesses II's reign. He would have initially been a deputy to the High Priest of Ptah in Memphis named Huy. Khaemwaset restored the monuments of earlier kings and nobles, such as Shepseskaf, Sahure and Nyuserre Ini. He also restored the pyramid of Unas at Saqqara. He seems to have undertaken these tasks during his later tenure as Sem-Priest and some of the inscriptions mention his title as 'Chief of the Artificers' or 'Chief of Crafts'. Hence, some of these restorations were undertaken after Khaemwaset's promotion as the High Priest of Ptah in Memphis about the 45th year of the reign of Ramesses II. Khaemwaset held the position of Crown Prince to the throne between Year 50 and Year 55 of his father's reign when he died. In later periods of Egyptian history, Khaemwaset was remembered as a wise man, and portrayed as the hero in a cycle of stories dating to Greco-Roman times. These stories often mix history with magic and fantasy, as in the case of one tale where the Prince goes into Nubia to duel with a Nubian sorcerer.
TEXT.Polish: Chaemuaset książę i następca tronu starożytnego Egiptu, syn Ramzesa II i królowej Isetnofret, odnowiciel zabytków memfickich. Był czwartym z kolei synem władcy i jego drugim ze związku z Isetnofret. Był również ulubionym synem Ramzesa, po śmierci starszego brata został przez ojca ustanowiony następcą tronu. Piastował godności Wielkiego Kapłana Ptaha i Wielkorządcy Memfis. Miał 5 lat, kiedy ojciec zabrał go na wyprawę wojenną do Nubii. Z kultem Ptaha związany był od ok. 15 roku panowania Ramzesa II, początkowo jako kapłan sem. Jako arcykapłan celebrował 9 pierwszych jubileuszy (świąt sed) swojego ojca. Niewątpliwie bardzo kochał swoją matkę, której wystawił wiele pomników w Memfis. Był "człowiekiem wielkiej kultury" (Grimal), studiował hieroglify papirusów teologicznych, annały i dzieje przodków oraz nauki tajemne, sprawdzał poprawność list władców, rekonstruował i uzupełniał inskrypcje. Wybudował w Memfis Serapeum ogromny, podziemny grobowiec dla mumii świętych byków, kolejnych wcieleń boga Apisa. Odnowił i ponownie ustawił monumenty wcześniejszych władców m.in. Kawaba, Szepseskafa, Sahure, Niuserre Ini. Dokonał również odnowy piramidy Unisa w Sakkara. Nazywany współcześnie "pierwszym archeologiem" ze względu na swoje zainteresowania i duży wkład w odkrywaniu pamiątek przeszłości oraz renowację zabytków staroegipskich. Zmarł jeszcze przed ojcem w 55 roku jego panowania w wieku ok. 55 lat.

TEXT.English: The Egyptian national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khaemwaset[COLOR_REVERT], available in the ancient/classical era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Priest[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Priesthood[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Egyptien est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khaemwaset[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'antiquité et l'ère classique. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prêtre[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Clergé[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional egipcio es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khaemweset[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sacerdote[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sacerdocio[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Egipcjan to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chaemuaset[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kapłana[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kapłaństwa[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Khagan Cavalry

Qaan is a title in the Mongolian language equal to the status of emperor and used to refer to someone who rules a khaganate or empire. The title was adopted by Ögedei Khan from the Turkic title kaan. It may also be translated as Khan of Khans, equivalent to King of Kings. In modern Mongolian, the title became Khaan with the 'g' sound becoming almost silent or non-existent (i.e. a very light voiceless velar fricative); the g in modern Turkish Kagan is also silent. Since the division of the Mongol Empire, emperors of the Yuan dynasty held the title of Khagan and their successors in Mongolia continued to have the title. Kagan and Kaan are common Turkish names in Turkey.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khagan Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is a Avars unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalerie Khagan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Avars unique.

TEXT.English: Khalid ibn al-Walid

Khalid ibn al-Walid was one of the most successful commanders in military history. He is noted for his military prowess, commanding the forces of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and those of his immediate successors of the Rashidun Caliphate; Abu Bakr and Umar (Umar ibn al-Khattab). He has the distinction of being undefeated in over a hundred battles, against the numerically superior forces of the Byzantine Roman Empire, Sassanid Persian Empire, and their allies. His strategic achievements include the conquest of the Persian Empire's Iraq and Roman Syria within three years from 633 to 636. He is also remembered for his decisive victories at Yamamah, Ullais and Yarmouk. Khaled ibn Walid was from the Meccan tribe of Quraysh, who initially opposed Muhammad. He played a vital role in Qurayshi victory at the Battle of Uhud. He converted to Islam, however, and joined Muhammad after the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah and participated in various expeditions for him, such as the Battle of Mu'tah. After Muhammad's death, he played a key role in commanding Medinan forces for Abu Bakr in the Ridda wars, the capture of the Sassanid Arab client Kingdom of Al-Hirah, and the defeat of the Sassanid Persian forces during his conquest of Iraq. He then crossed the desert to capture the Byzantine Arab client state of the Ghassanids during his conquest of Roman Syria. Even though Umar later relieved him of high command, he remained the effective leader of the forces arrayed against the Byzantines during the early stages of the ByzantineArab Wars. Under his command, Damascus was captured in 634 and the key Arab victory against the Roman Byzantine forces was achieved at the Battle of Yarmouk (636), which led to the conquest of the Bilad al-Sham (Levant).
TEXT.Polish: Chalid ibn al-Walid (592-642) dowódca wojsk muzułmańskich w czasie panowania pierwszego kalifa Abu Bakra. Wsławił się wieloma podbojami, z których najważniejsze to podbicie Persji. Na podbój Persji przeprowadził swoje wojska przez serce Pustyni Syryjskiej, czego dokonał dzięki znajomości lokalizacji wodopojów i wykorzystaniu wielbłądów jako źródła pożywienia i wody. Po przekroczeniu pustyni rozpoczął oblężenie Damaszku, którego mieszkańcy poddali się we wrześniu 635 roku. W roku 636 pokonał dwa razy większą armię cesarza bizantyjskiego Herakliusza w bitwie nad rzeką Jarmuk. Następnie został odwołany przez nowego kalifa Omara I.

TEXT.English: The Arabian military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khalid ibn al-Walid[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the medieval era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Theology[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Arabe est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khalid ibn al-Walid[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à l'ère médiévale, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Théologie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar árabe es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jalid ibn al-Walid[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Edad Media, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Teniente[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Teología[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Arabów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chalid ibn al-Walid[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Porucznika[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Teologii[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Khanung
Khanungese

The Semang are a Negrito ethnic group of the Malay Peninsula. They are found in Perak, Kedah and Pahang of Malaysia. During the colonial British administration, Orang Asli living in the northern Malay Peninsula were classified as Sakai. Lowland Semang tribes are also known as Sakai, although this term is considered to be derogatory by the Semang people. They have been recorded to have lived here since before the 3rd century. They are ethnologically described as nomadic hunter-gatherers. See also Bajaus and Aetas.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khanungese[COLOR_REVERT] is a Semang unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khanungese[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Semang unique.

TEXT.English: The Semangs live in caves or leaf-shelters that form between branches. A loincloth for the men, made of tree bark hammered out with a wooden mallet from the bark of the terap, a species of wild bread-fruit tree, and a short skirt of the same for the women, is the only dress worn; some go naked. In 1906 the Thai King Chulalongkorn adopted a Semang orphan boy named Khanung.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khanung[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kharavela

Kharavela was a king of Kalinga in present-day Odisha, India. The best known king of the Mahameghavahana dynasty, he ruled somewhere around first or second century BCE. His name is also transliterated as Kharabea. The main source of information about Kharavela is his rock-cut Hathigumpha inscription. The inscription is undated, and only 4 of its 17 lines are completely legible. Different scholars have interpreted it differently, leading to a number of speculations about Kharavela's reign. The inscription credits the king with several welfare activities, patronage of arts, repair works and military victories. Although it exaggerates his achievements, historians agree that Kharavela was one of the strongest rulers of Kalinga.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kharavela[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kharkhul

Kharkhul (English name:Khara Khula; died 1634) was a Choros-Oirat prince and tayishi of the Choros tribe. He is best known for forming and leading a coalition of the Four Oirats in battle against Ubasi Khun Tayishi, the Khalkha prince who ruled the Altan Khanate in present-day northwest Mongolia.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kharkhul[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Khingila Warriors

Khingila was the foundation king of the Hephthalite Empire, a contemporary of Khushnavaz (fl. 484) in Khwarezm. According to the Syrian compilation of Church Historian Zacharias Rhetor, bishop of Mytilene, the need for new grazing land to replace that lost to the Wusun led Khingila's "Uar-Chionites" to displace the Sabirs to the west, who in turn displaced the Saragur, Ugor and Onogur, who then asked for an alliance and land from Byzantium.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khingila Warriors[COLOR_REVERT] is a Transoxanian unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier Khingila[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Transoxanienne unique.

TEXT.English: Khitan Infantry

The Khitan people were a nomadic people originally from Mongolia, Manchuria (or Northeast China), and the Russian Far East from the 4th century that spoke a language distantly related to the Mongolic languages. As the Liao dynasty, they dominated a vast area north of and including parts of China, but left few relics that have survived until today.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khitan Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is a Khitan unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infanterie Khitan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité unique Khitan.

TEXT.English: Phak'ak

The Khmer Empire, was the powerful Khmer Hindu-Buddhist empire in Southeast Asia. The empire, which grew out of the former Kingdom of Funan and Chenla, at times ruled over and/or vassalized most of mainland Southeast Asia, parts of modern-day Laos, Thailand, and southern Vietnam. Its greatest legacy is Angkor, in present-day Cambodia, which was the site of the capital city during the empire's zenith.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Phak'ak[COLOR_REVERT] are Khmer culture unit. They are specialized to counter Elephant mounted units. Plus they are trained in jungle combat.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Phak'ak [COLOR_REVERT] sont les unités culturelles Khmer. Ils sont spécialisés pour contrer les unités montées sur éléphant. De plus, ils sont entraînés au combat dans la jungle.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Phak'ak[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Khoisan Runner

"Khoisan" is a unifying name for two groups of peoples of Southern Africa, who share physical and putative linguistic characteristics distinct from the Bantu majority of the region. Culturally, the Khoisan are divided into the foraging San, or Bushmen, and the pastoral Khoi, or more specifically Khoikhoi, previously known as Hottentots.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khoisan Runner[COLOR_REVERT] is a Nama unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coureur Khoisan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Nama unique.

TEXT.English: Khomeini

Grand Ayatollah Sayyid Ruhollah Musavi Khomeini was an Iranian Shia Muslim religious leader, revolutionary, politician, the founder of the Islamic Republic of Iran and the leader of the 1979 Iranian Revolution which saw the overthrow of the Pahlavi monarchy and Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the Shah of Iran. Following the revolution, Khomeini became the country's Supreme Leader, a position created in the constitution of the Islamic Republic as the highest-ranking political and religious authority of the nation, which he held until his death. He was succeeded by Ali Khamenei.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khomeini[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Khomvoum

Khonvoum is the supreme god and creator of the Bambuti Pygmy people in central Africa. He is the 'great hunter', god of the hunt, and carries a bow made of two snake which appears to mortals as a rainbow. He rulesthe heavens and when the sun sets, he gathers pieces of the stars and throws it at the sun so that it may rise the next day in its full splendor. He contacts people by means of the mythical elephant Gor (the thunderer) or through a chameleon. Khonvoum created black and white people from black and white clay, and the Pygmies from red clay. For them he also created the jungle with its lush vegetation and animal life.
TEXT.Polish: Khomvoum jest głównym bogiem plemienia pigmejów Bambuti w centralnej Afryce.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khomvoum[COLOR_REVERT] was a "Hero".
Khyan

Seuserenre Khyan, Khian or Khayan was a king of the Hyksos Fifteenth dynasty of Egypt. His royal name Seuserenre translates as "The one whom Re has caused to be strong." Khyan bears the titles of an Egyptian king, but also the title ruler of the foreign land (heqa-khaset). The later title is the typical designation of the Hyksos rulers. Khyan is one of the better attested kings from the Hyksos period, known from many seals and seal impressions. Remarkable are objects with his name found at Knossos and Hattusha indicating diplomatic contacts with Crete and the Hittites. A sphinx with his name was bought on the art market at Bagdad and might demonstrate diplomatic contacts to Babylon.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Khyan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kikkuli Chariot

Kikkuli was the Hurrian "master horse trainer" of the "land Mitanni" and author of a chariot horse training text written in the Hittite language, dating to the Hittite New Kingdom (around 1400 BC). The text is notable both for the information it provides about the development of Indo-European languages and for its content.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kikkuli Chariot[COLOR_REVERT] is a Mittanni unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Char équestre Kikkuli[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Mittanni unique.

TEXT.English: Klamath Rifleman

The Klamath tribes of northern California and Oregon were among the last of the Native American tribes to fight the American settlers trying to take their lands. Late in the 1800s, they fought a war in very difficult terrain, holding off a much superior force for many months. In this bitter struggle, the natives proved especially effective with their rifles.
TEXT.Spanish: El Fusilero klamath.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Klamath Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT] are Huron culture unit. With hidden nationality and "stealth" they are excelent strike units.
TEXT.Spanish: El Fusilero klamath.

TEXT.English: Knarr
A knarr is a type of Norse merchant ship used by the Vikings. The knarr (Old Norse: knorr, plural knerrir) was constructed using the same clinker-built method as longships, karves, and faerings.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knarr[COLOR_REVERT] is a Jutes unique unit.
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knarr[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Jutes unique.

TEXT.English: Knight
[ICON_BULLET]Knockback: %d1_Amount%% per round chance to force defenders to withdraw.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Ecrasement: %d1_Amount%% de chances par round de force le Défenseur à se retirer.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Sbaraglio: %d1_Amount%% di probabilità per turno di costringere i difensori a ritirarsi.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Odrzut: %d1_Amount%% szansy na rundę do zmuszenia obrońcy do ucieczki.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Beyond the first, unit attempts an additional %d1_Amount Knockback efforts when defending.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Après un premier essai, l'unité tente d'écraser %d1_Amount fois supplémentaire son adversaire en défendant.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Oltre al primo, l'unità ha un'ulteriore %d1_Amount di chance di Sbaraglio quando difende.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Poza pierwszym, jednostka próbuje wykonać dodatkowe %d1_Amount działań przy odrzucie przy obronie.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Knockback Retries: %d1_Amount
[ICON_BULLET]Knockback: Force defender to withdraw, %d1_Amount%% chance/round.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Ecrasement: Force le défenseur à se retirer, %d1_Amount%% chance/round.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Sbaraglio: forza il difensore a ritirarsi, %d1_Amount%% di chance per turno.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Knockback: %d1_Amount%% chance/rnd
[ICON_BULLET]%D1_Change%% Knockback vs. [LINK=s2_Type]%s3_TypeName[\LINK]
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]%D1_Change%% Knockback contra [LINK=s2_Type]%s3_TypeName[\LINK]

TEXT.English: Koa
Koala

The koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia, and the only extant representative of the family Phascolarctidae.[PARAGRAPH:2]The koala is found in coastal regions of eastern and southern Australia, from Adelaide to the southern part of Cape York Peninsula. Populations also extend for considerable distances inland in regions with enough moisture to support suitable woodlands. The koalas of South Australia were largely exterminated during the early part of the 20th century, but the state has since been repopulated with Victorian stock. The koala is not found in Tasmania or Western Australia.
TEXT.German: Der Koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) ist ein Säugetier, das ausschließlich in Australien lebt. Aufgrund seines Körperbaus sieht er dem Bären ähnlich, ist jedoch ein Beuteltier. Größe und Gewicht der Tiere unterscheiden sich je nach Region und Ernährungsangebot teilweise stark. Sie werden maximal 85 cm groß und 14 kg schwer. Das wollige Fell ist bräunlich bis silbergrau, wobei es bei Koalas der kälteren Regionen dichter und dunkler ist. Es lässt Regenwasser von der Oberfläche abperlen. Die Greifhände haben scharfe Krallen und zwei Daumen, mit denen sie gut in den Bäumen klettern können. An den Füßen sind zwei Zehen miteinander verwachsen. Mit den verschmolzenen Krallen können sie Zecken entfernen. Der Beutel des Koalaweibchens ist nach unten hin geöffnet. Des Weiteren hat der Koala keinen Bauchnabel, was auf die besondere Art von Trächtigkeit und Geburt zurückzuführen ist.[PARAGRAPH:2]Da Koalas nachtaktiv sind, können sie gut hören. Noch wichtiger ist der Geruchssinn, der u.a. bei der Nahrungssuche hilft. Koalas fressen neben Rinde und Früchten des Eukalyptusbaums vor allem die Blätter, doch manche enthalten zu viele Toxine, was die empfindliche Nase erkennt. Mit der Nase erspüren Koalas auch Feinde und können fremde Duftmarkierungen bestimmen. Meist halten sie sich in den Bäumen auf, wo sie bis zu 20 Stunden täglich schlafen, um Energie zu sparen. Am Boden laufen sie auf allen Vieren. Zur Kommunikation benutzen die Tiere unterschiedliche Laute, von Bellen und Grunzen bis zu Klicklauten oder Schnurren.[PARAGRAPH:2]Feinde der Koalas sind Dingos, Raubvögel, Warane und Pythons. Doch auch die zahlreichen Buschbrände sind eine Bedrohung. Durch den Menschen kommen weitere Gefahrenquellen wie Autos, Schwimmbecken oder der Einsatz von Pestiziden hinzu.
TEXT.Polish: Koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) gatunek torbacza z rodziny koalowatych, nadrzewne zwierzę roślinożerne, zamieszkujące wschodnią Australię. Koala schodzi na ziemię tylko po to, by przejść na kolejne drzewo. Żyje samotnie lub w niewielkich grupach złożonych z samca i kilku samic. Jest jedynym współcześnie żyjącym przedstawicielem rodzaju Phascolarctos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Koala występuje wzdłuż wybrzeża Queensland, Nowej Południowej Walii oraz Wiktorii. Większość swego życia spędza na najwyższych gałęziach drzew eukaliptusowych. Jest zwierzęciem aktywnym nocą.

TEXT.English: Warfare among tribal chieftains in Hawaii was common, with fierce battles raging frequently. By the 1780s, warfare was institutionalized, with formal rules and rituals. The chiefs built temples to pray, sacrifice, and perform ceremonies before launching campaigns. Warriors were known as koa, and gave their name to the koa tree, whose hard wood provided for many of their weapons. Hawaiian chieftains were practice of lua, a type of martial arts, and participated in annual festivals to test their abilities. The warrior code was brutal, and punishment was harsh and violent. An enemy captured in battle might have his entrails removed and every bone methodically broken while still alive.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors usually wore a loincloth and shaved and oiled their skin to prevent enemies from gripping them in combat. Nobles also wore a cape, as well as helmets made of wicker or gourds for protection. These warriors used a variety of weapons such as the ihe (short spear), pololu (long spear), pahoa (wooden dagger), and other weapons.
TEXT.French: La guerre entre les chefs tribaux à Hawaii était commun, avec féroces batailles font rage souvent. Par les années 1780, la guerre a été institutionnalisée, avec les règles formelles et les rites. Les chefs ont construit des temples pour prier, le sacrifice, et effectuer des cérémonies avant le lancement de campagnes. Guerriers étaient connus comme koa, et a donné son nom à l'arbre koa, dont les bois durs fournis pour beaucoup de leurs armes. Hawaiian chefs étaient pratique de la lua, un type d'arts martiaux, et participé à des festivals annuels de tester leurs capacités. Le guerrier code a été brutale, et de la répression est sévère et violent. Un ennemi capturé dans la bataille pourrait avoir enlevé ses entrailles et les os brisés méthodiquement tout encore en vie.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guerriers généralement portaient un pagne et rasé huilé leur peau et pour empêcher les ennemis de préhension eux dans le combat. Nobles portait aussi une cape, ainsi que les casques en osier ou gourdes pour la protection. Ces guerriers utilisé une variété d'armes telles que les ihe (lance courte), pololu (longue lance), pahoa (poignard en bois), et d'autres armes.
TEXT.German: Warfare unter den Stämmen Häuptlinge auf Hawaii war häufig mit heftigen Kämpfe wüteten häufig. Mit dem 1780er, Kriegsführung war institutionalisiert, mit formalen Regeln und Rituale. Die Häupter gebaut Tempel zu beten, opfern, und Zeremonien vor dem Start Kampagnen. Krieger wurden bekannt als koa, und gab ihr den Namen zu koa Baum, dessen hartem Holz, die für viele ihrer Waffen. Hawaiian Häuptlinge wurden Praxis der lua, eine Art von Kampfkunst, und nahm an jährlichen Festivals zu testen ihre Fähigkeiten. Der Krieger Code war brutal, und die Strafe war hart und gewalttätig. Ein Feind gefangen in der Schlacht hätte seine Eingeweide entfernt, und alle Knochen gebrochen, während methodisch noch am Leben.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors Regel trug einen Lendenschurz und rasiert und geölt ihre Haut, um zu verhindern, Feinde Greifen von ihnen im Kampf. Nobles trug einen Umhang, sowie Helme aus Rattan oder Kürbisse für den Schutz. Diese Krieger verwendet eine Vielzahl von Waffen wie die ihe (kurz Speer), pololu (lange Speer), pahoa (Holz Dolch), und andere Waffen.
TEXT.Italian: guerra tra i notabili tribali nelle Hawaii era comune, con una feroce battaglia infuria frequentemente. Per il 1780s, la guerra è stata istituzionalizzata, con regole formali e rituali. Capi costruito templi a pregare, di sacrificio, e di eseguire le cerimonie prima di lanciare campagne. Guerrieri erano conosciuti come koa, e ha dato il nome alla koa albero, il cui legno duro di molte delle loro armi. Hawaiian notabili erano pratica di lua, un tipo di arti marziali, e ha partecipato a festival annuale per verificare la loro capacità. Il codice è stato brutale guerriero, e la punizione fu duro e violento. Un nemico catturato in battaglia potrebbe avere rimosso il suo viscere e metodicamente ogni osso rotto, mentre ancora vivo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors solitamente indossava una loincloth e rasato e oleato loro pelle per evitare che i nemici da loro presa in combattimento. Nobili anche indossato un mantello, come pure i caschi di vimini o gourdes per la protezione. Questi guerrieri utilizzato una varietà di armi, come il ihe (breve lancia), pololu (lunga lancia), pahoa (pugnale di legno), e di altre armi.
TEXT.Spanish: La guerra entre los jefes tribales en Hawai era común, con feroces batallas azotan con frecuencia. Por los 1780s, la guerra fue institucionalizada, con reglas formales y rituales. Los jefes construido templos de oración, sacrificio, y realizar ceremonias antes de la iniciación de campañas. Warriors se conoce como koa, y dio su nombre a la koa árbol, cuya madera dura para siempre muchas de sus armas. Hawaiian eran jefes de lua práctica, un tipo de artes marciales, y ha participado en festivales anuales de poner a prueba sus habilidades. El código guerrero fue brutal, y el castigo era duro y violento. Un enemigo capturado en la batalla podría haber eliminado sus entrañas y metódicamente cada hueso roto mientras siguen vivos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Warriors generalmente llevaba una taparrabos y afeitado y su piel engrasada para evitar que los enemigos de prensión ellos en combate. Nobles también llevaba una capa, así como los cascos hechos de mimbre o calabazas para la protección. Estos guerreros utilizan una variedad de armas, como la ihe (lanza corta), pololu (lanza larga), pahoa (daga de madera), y otras armas.

TEXT.English: This powerful melee unit (the Polynesian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent against melee units and does not require Iron at the minor disadvantage of not gaining city attack bonus.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité de mêlée (le remplaçant polynésien du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spadassin[COLOR_REVERT]) est excellent contre les unités de mêlée.
TEXT.German: ieses leistungsfähige Handgemenge (die polynesische Ersatz für die[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) ist hervorragend gegen Handgemenge.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità da mischia (equivalente polinesiano del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerriero con spada[COLOR_REVERT]) è eccellente contro altre unità da mischia.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta potente unidad de cuerpo a cuerpo (sustituta polinesiana del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldado con espada[COLOR_REVERT]) es excelente contra otras unidades cuerpo a cuerpo sin requerir Hierro para su entrenamiento, con la pequeña desventaja de no obtener bonificación por atacar una ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Koa to potężna jednostka walki wręcz. Nie wymaga żelaza do budowy.

TEXT.English: Theodoros Kolokotronis

Theodoros Kolokotronis (3 April 1770 - 4 February 1843) was a Greek general and the pre-eminent leader of the Greek War of Independence against the Ottoman Empire. Kolokotronis' greatest success was the defeat of the Ottoman army under Mahmud Dramali Pasha at the Battle of Dervenakia in 1822. In 1825, he was appointed commander-in-chief of the Greek forces in the Peloponnese. Today, Kolokotronis ranks among the most revered of the protagonists of the War of Independence.
TEXT.Polish: Theodoros Kolokotronis (3 April 1770 - 4 February 1843) - grecki generał z czasów walki o niepodległość z Imperium Ottomańskim.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Theodoros Kolokotronis[COLOR_REVERT] was a "Hero".
Komodo Dragon
Kon-Tiki

The main body of the float was composed of nine balsa tree trunks up to 14 m (45 ft) long, 60 cm (2 ft) in diameter, lashed together with 30 mm (1.14 in) hemp ropes. Cross-pieces of balsa logs 5.5 m (18 ft) long and 30 cm (1 ft) in diameter were lashed across the logs at 91 cm (3 ft) intervals to give lateral support. Pine splashboards clad the bow, and lengths of pine 25 mm (1 in) thick and 60 cm (2 ft) wide were wedged between the balsa logs and used as centreboards.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kon Tiki[COLOR_REVERT] is a Caral Supe unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kon Tiki[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Caral Supe unique.

TEXT.English: Kookaburra

German.Text: Lachender Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachenden Hans:Lachende Hänse:Lachenden Hänse:Lachenden Hänsen:Lachenden Hänse

TEXT.English: Kookaburras (genus Dacelo) are terrestrial kingfishers native to Australia and New Guinea. They are large to very large, with a total length of 28 - 42 cm (11 - 17 in). The name is a loanword from Wiradjuri guuguubarra, and is onomatopoeic of its call. The single member of the genus Clytoceyx, though commonly referred to as the Shovel-billed Kookaburra, is not treated in this article.[PARAGRAPH:2]Kookaburras are best known for their unmistakable call, which sounds uncannily like loud, echoing human laughter good-natured, but rather hysterical, merriment in the case of the renowned Laughing Kookaburra (Dacelo novaeguineae); and maniacal cackling in the case of the slightly smaller Blue-winged Kookaburra (D. leachii). They are generally not closely associated with water, and can be found in habitats ranging from humid forest to arid savanna, but also in suburban and residential areas near running water and where food can be searched for easily.
TEXT.German: Der Jägerliest(Dacelo novaeguineae) ist ein Vogel aus der Familie der Eisvögel, der bei uns besser unter dem Namen Lachender Hans bekannt ist. Er kommt hauptsächlich im Osten und Südosten von Australien vor. Dort wird er Kookaburra genannt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Lachende Hans hat ein markantes weißes bis elfenbeinfarbenes Federkleid. Oberseite und Flügel sind dunkelbraun bis braun genau wie der Überaugenstreif, der ihn gegen das grelle Sonnenlicht schützt. Er verfügt über einen kräftigen Schnabel und scharfe Krallen. Während der Kopf im Vergleich zum Körper ziemlich groß ist, sind Flügel und Schwanz relativ kurz. Seinen Namen hat dem Lachenden Hans seine an lautes Gelächter erinnernde Stimme eingebracht, die besonders zur Revierverteidigung eingesetzt wird.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Vogel erfreut sich in Australien großer Beliebtheit, weil er Mäuse, Ratten und giftige Schlangen vertilgt. Der Lachende Hans ist aber auch als vorwitziger Dieb bekannt, der Campern dreist die mitgebrachten Speisen klaut. Da er sein Gelächter immer zu bestimmten Zeiten erschallen lässt, spielte der Lachende Hans auch schon in der Mythologie der Aborigines eine besondere Rolle.
TEXT.Polish: Kukabura (Dacelo novaeguineae), duży ptak z rodziny zimorodków, osiągający długość ciała do 43 cm. Występuje we wschodniej i południowej Australii. Zamieszkuje tereny o niezbyt gęstym zadrzewieniu. Ubarwienie ciała w tonacji białobrązowej, skrzydła i grzbiet ciemne, biało nakrapiane. Charakterystyczną cechą wyglądu jest potężny dziób, dolna część beżowa, górna ciemniejsza, niebieskawa. Odżywia się dużymi owadami, jaszczurkami i wężami. Wydaje donośny głos, przypominający histeryczny śmiech człowieka. Gnieździ się w dziuplach starych drzew.

TEXT.English: Kora

The Kora, Khora or Cora were one of the ten indigenous tribes of the Great Andamanese people, originally living on the eastern part of North Andaman Island in the Indian Ocean. The tribe is now extinct, although some of the remaining Great Andamanese on Strait Island claim to have Kora ancestors. The tribe spoke a distinctive Kora language, closely related to the other Great Andamanese languages. The native name for the language was Aka-Kora, also spelled Aka-Khora or Aka-Cora (Aka- being a prefix for "tongue"); and this name is often used for the tribe itself. They were divided between shore-dwellers (aryoto) and forest-dwellers (eremtaga) subtribes.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kora[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kriss Warrior

The kris is an asymmetrical dagger with distinctive blade-patterning achieved through alternating laminations of iron and nickelous iron (pamor). While most strongly associated with the culture of Indonesia the kris is also indigenous to Malaysia, Thailand, Brunei, Singapore and the southern Philippines where it is known as kalis with variants existing as a sword rather than a dagger. The kris is famous for its distinctive wavy blade, although many have straight blades as well.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kriss Warrior[COLOR_REVERT] is a Filipino unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier Kriss [COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Philipine unique.

TEXT.English: Krum

Krum the Fearsome was khan of Bulgaria from sometime after 796 but before 803 until his death in 814. During his reign the Bulgarian territory doubled in size, spreading from the middle Danube to the Dnieper and from Odrin to the Tatra Mountains. His able and energetic rule brought law and order to Bulgaria and developed the rudiments of state organization.
TEXT.Polish: Krum (Korum) Zwycięzca lub Straszny, (ur.?, zm. 814) - kolejny władca Bułgarii po chanie Kardamie oraz założyciel nowej dynastii. Jego ród prawdopodobnie wywodził się z Protobułgarów panońskich. Był pierwszym władcą noszącym tytuł Chan Subigi.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Krum[COLOR_REVERT] was a "Hero".
Kubrat

Kubrat was the Bulgars ruler credited with establishing the confederation of Old Great Bulgaria in c. 635 AD. In the Nominalia of the Bulgarian khans Kubrat is mentioned as Kvrt, and the descendant of the Dulo clan. Kubrat spent his early life at the Byzantine Empire imperial palace in Constantinople.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kubrat[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kuchum Khan

Kuchum Khan was the last khan (ruled 1563-1598) of the Khanate of Sibir. Kuchum Khan's attempt to spread Islam and his cross-border raids met with vigorous opposition from the Russian Tsar Ivan the Terrible (reigned 1547-1584), who sent a force of Cossacks to confront him head-on (ca. 1580). Kuchum is particularly noted for the vigorous resistance he offered to the Russian invaders.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kuchum Khan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kucumatz

Q'uq'umatz was a deity of the Postclassic K'iche' Maya. Q'uq'umatz was the Feathered Serpent divinity of the Popol Vuh who created humanity together with the god Tepeu. Q'uq'umatz is considered to be the rough equivalent of the Aztec god Quetzalcoatl, and also of Kukulkan of the Yucatec Maya tradition. It is likely that the feathered serpent deity was borrowed from one of these two peoples and blended with other deities to provide the god Q'uq'umatz that the K'iche' worshipped. Q'uq'umatz may have had his origin in the Valley of Mexico; some scholars have equated the deity with the Aztec deity Ehecatl-Quetzalcoatl, who was also a creator god. Q'uq'umatz may originally have been the same god as Tohil, the K'iche' sun god who also had attributes of the feathered serpent, but they later diverged and each deity came to have a separate priesthood.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kucumatz[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kujula Kadphises

Kujula Kadphises was a Kushan prince who united the Yuezhi confederation during the 1st century CE, and became the first Kushan emperor. According to the Rabatak inscription, he was the grandfather of the great Kushan king Kanishka I.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kujula Kadphises[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Kukulcan

Kukulkan is closely related to Gukumatz of the K'iche' Maya tradition and Quetzalcoatl of Aztec mythology. In Yucatn, references to the deity Kukulkan are confused by references to a named individual who bore the name of the god. Because of this, the distinction between the two has become blurred. Although heavily Mexicanised, Kukulkan has his origins among the Maya of the Classic Period, when he was known as Waxaklahun Ubah Kan, the War Serpent, and he has been identified as the Postclassic version of the Vision Serpent of Classic Maya art. The cult of Kukulkan/Quetzalcoatl was the first Mesoamerican religion to transcend the old Classic Period linguistic and ethnic divisions. Regardless, although Kukulkan was mentioned as a historical person by Maya writers of the 16th century, the earlier 9th century texts at Chichen Itza never identified him as human and artistic representations depicted him as a Vision Serpent entwined around the figures of nobles. At Chichen Itza, Kukulkan is also depicted presiding over sacrifice scenes. According to later Mesoamerican chroniclers, Kukulcan was a mysterious stranger with a craggy face. He was opposed to sacrified, and was considered to be something of a culture hero, for he taught people crafting, painting, and writing. However, jealous rivals caused several scandals to occur under Kukulcan's name, and Kukulcan in self-disgust traveled to the edge of the sea, where he departed in a raft of snakes. There are several other different versions of the figure of Kukulcan, some sympathetic, describing him as a culture hero and a benevolent leader, and others that describe him in a less positive light, saying that he was a warrior and military aggressor. Regardless, the figure of Kukulcan, or Quetzalcoatl, as he is known amongst the Nahua peoples, continues to this day to inspire even the descendants of the Nahua and Maya peoples.
TEXT.Polish: Kukulkan (Kukulcan, Tepeu Gucumatz) w kulturze Majów odpowiednik azteckiego boga Quetzalcoatla, a także inkaskiego Wirakoczy; Zielony Pierzasty Wąż, stworzyciel świata i krzewiciel cywilizacji - utożsamiany z twórcą kultury Majów Itzamną. Kukulkan jako bóg i władca czterech elementów: ziemi, wiatru, wody oraz ognia - reprezentowanych kolejno przez jego atrybuty czyli kukurydzę, sępa, rybę i jaszczurkę uznawany był także za bóstwo odrodzenia i zmartwychwstania, natomiast w kulturze Tolteków za podniesionego do rangi bóstwa założyciela cywilizacji, twórcę medycyny i pierwszego systemu kalendarzowego, nauczyciela rolnictwa i rybołówstwa. Niekiedy nazywany także "Bogiem B". Kukulkan według legend Majów odpłynął na wschód skąd powróci tuż przed końcem świata, przedstawiany jest zwykle jako postać z dużym nosem, czasami z atrybutami charakterystycznymi dla Itzamny czyli wężem i muszlami. Kukulkanowi poświęcona jest świątynia-piramida El Castillo w starożytnym mieście Majów Chichźn Itza.

TEXT.English: The Mayan national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kukulcan[COLOR_REVERT], available in the ancient/classical era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Priest[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Calendar[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Maya est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kukulcan[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'antiquité et l'ère classique. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prêtre[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Calendrier[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional maya es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kukulkán[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Clérigo[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Calendario[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Majów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kukulcan[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kapłana[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kalendarza[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Kuomintang

Originally a revolutionary league working for the overthrow of the Chinese monarchy, the Nationalists became a political party in the first year of the Chinese republic (1912). The party participated in the first Chinese parliament, which was soon dissolved by a coup d'état (1913). This defeat moved its leader, Sun Yat-sen, to organize it more tightly, first (1914) on the model of a Chinese secret society and, later (1923-24), under Soviet guidance, on that of the Bolshevik party. The Nationalist Party owed its early successes largely to Soviet aid and advice and to close collaboration with the Chinese communists (1924-27).
TEXT.Italian: Il Kuomintang è l'unità taiwanese che sostituisce la fanteria. Inizia con le promozioni Pattgulia I, Pattuglia II e Dedicazione.

TEXT.English: The Kuomintang is the unique Infantry unit of the Taiwanese culture. It starts with the promotions Patrol I and II and Dedication. It is thus an excellent city defender, with the added bonus of discouraging rebellion.
TEXT.Italian: Il Kuomintang è la fanteria unica della cultura taiwanes. Inizia con le promozioni Pattuglia I, Pattuglia II e Dedicazione; perciò è eccellente per difendere le città, con il bonus di scoraggiare le ribellioni.

TEXT.English: Kushan Rider

Some traces remain of the presence of the Kushans in the area of Bactria and Sogdiana. Archaeological structures are known in Takht-I-Sangin, Surkh Kotal (a monumental temple), and in the palace of Khalchayan. Various sculptures and friezes are known, representing horse-riding archers, and significantly men with artificially deformed skulls, such as the Kushan prince of Khalchayan (a practice well attested in nomadic Central Asia). The Chinese first referred to these people as the Yuezhi and said they established the Kushan Empire, although the relationship between the Yuezhi and the Kushans is still unclear. On the ruins of ancient Hellenistic cities such as Ai-Khanoum, the Kushans are known to have built fortresses. The earliest documented ruler, and the first one to proclaim himself as a Kushan ruler, was Heraios. He calls himself a "tyrant" on his coins, and also exhibits skull deformation. He may have been an ally of the Greeks, and he shared the same style of coinage. Heraios may have been the father of the first Kushan emperor Kujula Kadphises.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kushan Rider[COLOR_REVERT] is a Kushan unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalier Kushan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Kushan unique.

TEXT.English: Kushite Archer

Nubia was known as "Ta-Seti", or the Land of the Bow, by the Egyptians. The skills of the Nubian Archers were well known in the ancient world. In rise of Nations, these archers make up one line of unique units for the Nubians. The Kushite Archer, named after the first Nubian Kingdom of Kush, makes their appearance in the Classical Age, continuing to the Gunpowder Age with the Apedemak Archer, named after the Nubian God of War.
TEXT.Polish: Nubia - kraina historyczna znajdująca się w północno-wschodniej Afryce, w południowym Egipcie i północnym Sudanie. Zajmuje środkowy bieg Nilu pomiędzy Asuanem a Chartumem (między VI a I kataraktą). W starożytności zwana Kusz, zamieszkana była przez lud spokrewniony z Egipcjanami, który w połowie II tysiąclecia p.n.e. uległ wymieszaniu z napływającymi od południa plemionami.

TEXT.English: The Kushite Archer is the Nubian Culture unit. It is even better at defending cities than the Archer.
TEXT.French: L'archer Kushite est un excellent défenseur Nubien des Villes.
TEXT.Italian: L'arciere Kushite riceve ancora più bonus alla difesa in città rispetto ai normali arcieri.

TEXT.English: Kutama Infantry

The Fatimid military was based largely on the Kutama Berber tribesmen brought along on the march to Egypt, and they remained an important part of the military even after Tunisia began to break away. After their successful establishment in Egypt, local Egyptian forces were also incorporated into the army, so the Fatimid Army were reinforced by North African soldiers from Algeria to Egypt in the Eastern North. (and of succeeding dynasties as well).
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kutama Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is a Fatimid unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infanterie Kutama[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Fatimid unique.

TEXT.English: Kwame Nkrumah

Kwame Nkrumah PC (September 18 or 21, 1909 - 27 April 1972) led Ghana to independence from Britain in 1957 and served as its first prime minister and president. Nkrumah first gained power as leader of the colonial Gold Coast, and held it until he was deposed in 1966.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kwame Nkrumah[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Labarna

Labarna I was the traditional first King of the Hittites, the traditional founder of the Hittite Old Kingdom (fl. ca. 1600 1450 BC), though his existence is sometimes questioned by modern scholars. Labarna was not the first in line to the throne. PU-Sarruma designated Labarna as his successor after his own sons revolted against him. Upon PU-Sarruma's death, Labarna and Papahdilmah, one of PU-Sarruma's sons, contended for the throne, with Labarna emerging victorious. What little is known about him is culled mainly from the Edict of Telipinu, which states that he overwhelmed his enemies and "made them borders of the sea", a statement which may refer to conquests as far as the Mediterranean coast in the south, and the Black Sea in the north. He installed his sons as governors in several cities including Tuwanuwa, Hupisna, Landa, and Lusna (the identities of these cities are uncertain, but thought to perhaps be Tyana, Heraclea Cybistra, Laranda, and Lystra). Through his conquests, he was responsible for laying the groundwork for the Hittite empire that was to come.
TEXT.Polish: Labarna I znany jako Hattusili I z Kussary (właściwie Labarna lub Tabarnas) król hetycki w okresie 1650-1620 p.n.e. Podczas swojego panowania podbił Anatolię i północną Syrię. Przeniósł stolicę z Nesy do Hattusy i najprawdopodobniej wtedy przyjął imię Hattusili. Państwo Hattusili od południa sąsiadowało z Kizzuwatna i królestwem Arzawa, od północnego zachodu z Troją, od północy z azjanickimi plemionami Kaska, od wschodu z Hurytami, a od południowego wschodu z Amorytami. Hattusili I skierował ekspansję terytorialną państwa hetyckiego przede wszystkim na tereny północnej Syrii i północnej Mezopotamii (w czasie jednej z wypraw przekroczył nawet Eufrat). Na terytorium Syrii poprowadził kilka wypraw wojennych, zdobywając i łupiąc liczne miasta: Zaruna, Hassu, Hahhu i Zippasna. Jego najwytrwalszym syryjskim przeciwnikiem było leżące w krainie Jamchad bogate miasto Halab (Aleppo), które występowało jako sojusznik innych miast atakowanych przez Hetytów. Hattusilis wyznaczył na króla swego adoptowanego syna Mursili.

TEXT.English: The Hittite national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Labarna[COLOR_REVERT], available in the ancient/classical era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Messenger[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pottery[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Hittite est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Labarna[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'antiquité et l'ère classique. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Messager[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Poterie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional hitita es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Labarna[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mensajero[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alfarería[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Hetytów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Labarna[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Posłańca[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Garncarstwa[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Lamboga

The earliest identified Nigerian culture is the Nok culture that thrived between 1500 BC and 200 AD on the Jos Plateau in northeastern Nigeria. Information is lacking from the first millennium BC following the Nok ascendancy, but by the 2nd millennium BC there was active trade from Ancient Egypt via Nubia through the Sahara to the forest with the savanna people acting as intermediaries in exchanges of various goods.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lamboga[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Lancer

The lance had been used for centuries by mounted troops but was rediscovered by light cavalry units during the 18th century. Firearms caused armor to be abandoned, so lancer units generally had no armor at all, increasing their speed and mobility. Lancer units used their lances for the charge, then switched to sabres or firearms at close quarters. The most famous lancers were the Polish Uhlan units, first raised in the 1720's. The lance was eventually dropped as a weapon given the decreasing use of horse cavalry in the face of powerful firearms and cavalry units were replaced by armored vehicles.
TEXT.Italian: La lancia era stata usata per secoli dalle truppe a cavallo, ma fu riscoperta dalle unità di cavalleria leggera durante il 18° secolo. Le armi da fuoco resero le armature inutili; per questo motivo i lancieri non portavano armature, rendenoli più leggeri e veloci. I lancieri a cavallo usavano le loro lance per le cariche, quindi passavano a sciacole ed armi da fuoco per i combattimenti ravvicinati. I lancieri più famosi erano gli Ulani polacchi, creati introno al 1720. La lancia divenne obsoleta quando la cavalleria iniziò a perdere importanza, lasciando il posto ai veicoli corazzati a motore.
TEXT.Polish: Lansjerzy w dawnych armiach lekka kawaleria uzbrojona w lance. W wojsku polskim odpowiednikiem lansjerów byli ułani. W XVII wieku jazda europejska z wyjątkiem polskiej i hiszpańskiej zarzuciła używanie lanc, jednak w XVIII wieku broń ta znów zdobyła popularność. W XIX wieku pułki uzbrojone w lance zwano zwykle ułanami - jedynie Francja i Anglia zachowały nazwę lansjerów.

TEXT.English: Build Lancers to counter enemy cavalry units.
TEXT.French: Recrutez des Lanciers à cheval pour contrer les unités de cavalerie ennemies.
TEXT.Italian: Quest'unità è ottima per contrastare le altre unità di cavalleria
TEXT.Spanish: Crea Lanceros para contrarrestar a la caballería enemiga.
TEXT.Polish: Lansjer - ta jednostka świętnie się nadaje do walki z innymi jednostkami kawalerii.

TEXT.English: Landing Ship Tank

Landing Ship, Tank was the military designation for naval vessels created during World War II to support amphibious operations by carrying significant quantities of vehicles, cargo, and landing troops directly onto an unimproved shore.
TEXT.Polish: Pomocnicza jednostka pływająca marynarki wojennej, służąca do zaopatrywania okrętów lub transportu wojsk i uzbrojenia. Może to być statek noszący banderę handlową, doraźnie wcielony pod rozkazy marynarki wojennej, statek handlowy pod banderą wojenną albo okręt specjalnie zbudowany lub przystosowany do celów zaopatrzenia.

TEXT.English: The Landing Ship Tank is a cargo ship. It can carry up to 5 units but is vulnerable to planes and modern warships.
TEXT.French: Le Char amphibie est un Transporteur de troupes. Il peut transporter jusqu'à 5 unités mais est vulnérable aux avions et aux navires de guerre modernes.
TEXT.Spanish: El Buque-blindado de desembarco es un navío de transporte. Puede llevar hasta a 5 unidades, pero es vulnerable a los aviones y buques de guerra modernos.
TEXT.Polish: Transportowiec Desantowy to jednostka desantowa mogąca pomieścic do 5 jednostek lądowych na swoim pokładzie.

TEXT.English: Lapu Lapu

Lapu-Lapu (fl. 1521) was a ruler of Mactan in Visayas. Modern Philippine society regards him as the first Filipino hero because he was the first native to resist Spanish colonization. He is best known for the Battle of Mactan that happened at dawn on April 27, 1521, and where he slayed Ferdinand Magellan. The battle halted the Magellan expedition and delayed Spanish occupation of the islands by over forty years until the expedition of Miguel López de Legazpi in 1564. Monuments to Lapu-Lapu have been built in Manila and Cebu while the Philippine National Police and the Bureau of Fire Protection use his image.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lapu Lapu[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Lars Porsena

Lars Porsena (Etruscan: Pursenas; sometimes spelled Lars Porsenna) was an Etruscan king known for his war against the city of Rome. He ruled over the city of Clusium (Etruscan: Clevsin). There are no established dates for his rule, but Roman sources often place the war at around 508 BC.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lars Porsena[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Litigate[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Take legal action and drive all corporations from the city.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mettre en litige[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Prendre des mesures juridiques et conduire toutes les entreprises de la ville au procès.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Denuncia[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Prendi azioni legali e rimuovi tutte le corporazioni dalla città.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Puede tomar acciones legales
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zaskarż[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE]Legalnym sposobem wypędź wszystkie korporacje ze swojego miasta.

TEXT.English: La Plata Mosquetero

The Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata was the last to be organized and the one with the shortest life of the Viceroyalty of the Spanish Empire in the Americas. The Viceroyalty was established in 1776 from several former Viceroyalty of Perdependencies that mainly extended over the Río de la Plata Basin, roughly the present-day territories of Argentina, Bolivia, Paraguay and Uruguay, extending inland from the Atlantic Coast. Buenos Aires, located on the western shore of the Río de la Plata estuary flowing into the Atlantic Ocean, opposite the Portuguese outpost of Colonia del Sacramento, was chosen as the capital. Usually considered one of the late Bourbon Reforms, the organization of this viceroyalty was motivated on both commercial grounds (Buenos Aires was by then a major spot for illegal trade), as well as on security concerns brought about by the growing interest of competing foreign powers in the area. The Spanish Crown wanted to protect its territory against Great Britain and the Kingdom of Portugal.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]La Plata Mosquetero[COLOR_REVERT] is a La Plata unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mousquetaire de La Plata[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité de La Plata unique.

TEXT.English: Leidang

The Leidang is an Icelandic unique unit, a replacement for the Heavy Axeman. Because of the Norse specialization in seaborne raids, it starts with the Amphibious promotion. Its other starting promotion, City Raider I, is for much the same reason. Thus it makes an ideal "Marine" for the Medieval and Renaissance eras.
TEXT.Italian: Il Leidang è l'unità unica islandese che sostituisce il guerriero con ascia corazzato. Le sue promozioni, Anfibio e Razziatore I, derivano dal fatto che i popoli norreni di discendenza vichinga erano specializzati nei raid dal mare contro le città nemiche. Per questo motivo il Leidang è un perfetto "Marine" per le età medievali e rinascimentali.

TEXT.English: The Leidang is the unique Heavy Axeman of the Icelandic culture. Like the Axeman line in general, it has a hefty 50% bonus against all melee units. It starts with the Amphibious and City Raider I promotions.
TEXT.Italian: Il Leidang sostituisce il guerriero con ascia corazzato nella cultura islandese; come tutti i guerrieri con ascia, ha un bonus del 50% contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato. Inizia con le promozioni Anfibio e Razziatore I.

TEXT.English: Leonidas

Leonidas was a Spartan king whose stand against the invading Persian army at the pass of Thermopylae in central Greece is one of the enduring tales of Greek heroism, invoked throughout Western history as the epitome of bravery exhibited against overwhelming odds. A member of the Agiad house, Leonidas succeeded his half brother, Cleomenes I, as king, probably in 490. He was married to Cleomenes' daughter, Gorgo, and may have supported Cleomenes' aggressions against other Greek cities. In 480 Leonidas commanded the small Greek force that resisted the advance through Thermopylae of the vast army of the Persian king Xerxes. For two days Leonidas withstood Persian attacks, and it is quite possible the Greek army, defending a narrow pass, could have won. However, a Greek turncoat showed the Persians a way around the pass; once Leonidas knew the battle was lost, he then ordered most of his troops to retreat, and he and his 300-member royal guard fought to the last man. This episode made a deep impression on the Greek imagination and gave rise to the legend that Spartans never surrendered.
TEXT.Polish: Leonidas od około 490 p.n.e. król Sparty, syn Anaksandridasa II i jego pierwszej żony. Poślubił Gorgo - córkę swojego przybranego brata Kleomenesa I z którą miał syna Pleistarchusa. W 480 p.n.e. dowodził obroną przesmyku termopilskiego, stojąc na czele 300 Spartan i kilku tysięcy żołnierzy z innych greckich państw. Przez trzy dni odpierał ataki wielotysięcznej armii króla Persji, Kserksesa, która nie mogła w wąskim przejściu wykorzystać swojej liczebnej przewagi. W wyniku zdrady pasterza Efialtesa, wrogie oddziały zaszły od tyłu greckich żołnierzy. Leonidas odesłał wtedy wojska państw sprzymierzonych i wraz z trzystoma Spartanami, tyluż Helotami oraz siedmioma setkami Tespijczyków bronił wąwozu do końca. Poświęcenie Leonidasa i jego wojowników dało czas reszcie żołnierzy na wycofanie się.

TEXT.English: The Greek military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Leonidas[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the ancient/classical era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bodyguard[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarchy[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Grec est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Léonidas[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible dès l'antiquité et l'ère classique, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Garde du corps[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarchie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar griego es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Leónidas[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guardia real[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarquía[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Greków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Leonidas[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ochroniarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarchii[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Leopold I
Leopold II

Leopold II was the second King of the Belgians, and is chiefly remembered for the founding and exploitation of the Congo Free State. Born in Brussels the second (but eldest surviving) son of Leopold I and Louise of Orléans, he succeeded his father to the throne on 17 December 1865, reigning for 44 years until his death, the longest of any Belgian monarch.
TEXT.Polish: Leopold II, właśc. Leopold Ludwik Filip Maria Wiktor (ur. 9 kwietnia 1835 w Brukseli, zm. 17 grudnia 1909 w Laeken) - król Belgów w latach 1865-1909, z dynastii Koburgów. Tron belgijski objął po swoim ojcu Leopoldzie I. W 1885 został władcą Wolnego Państwa Konga, kolonii w środkowej Afryce (obecnie Demokratyczna Republika Konga). Przez wiele lat była to jego prywatna własność, w której panowało niewolnictwo, a Leopold II prowadził rabunkową gospodarkę pozyskując kauczuk i kość słoniową. Leopold był jednym z największych zbrodniarzy w historii, przyczyniając się do śmierci od kilku do kilkunastu milionów ludzi.
