Rozpoczął likwidację niezależnych księstw powstałych w czasach panowania dynastii Arsacydów osadzając w nich swoich krewnych jako namiestników. W roku 241 rozpoczął wojnę z Cesarstwem rzymskim podbijając prowincję Mezopotamia i Syrię. W 243 Rzymianie zdołali odzyskać część utraconego terytorium. Po roku 253 wojska Szapura podbijają Antiochię oraz część Kapadocji. W 256 podbija Armenię. W wygranej bitwie pod Edessą Szapur I pojmał cesarza Waleriana I, jedynego cesarza rzymskiego, który dostał się do niewoli i w niej zmarł. Jako niewolnik Walerian służył Szapurowi za stopień, gdy ten wsiadał na konia. W czasie swego panowania zbudował wiele miast. Za jego czasów działał w Persji prorok Mani.

TEXT.English: The Persian military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shapur I[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the ancient/classical era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Minister[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Code of Laws[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Perse est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shapur I[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible dès l'antiquité et l'ère classique, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministre[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Livre des lois[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar persa es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sapor I[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministro[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Legislación[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Persów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Szapur I[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministra[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kodeksu Prawnego[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Sharktooth Archer

Seminole culture is largely derived from Creek culture. Most Seminoles speak the Mikasuki language, with some (such as those living on the Brighton Seminole Reservation) speaking Creek; English is also prevalent today. The most important ceremony is the Green Corn Dance, which is celebrated largely as it is among the Creeks; other notable Creek-derived traditions include use of the black drink and ritual smoking of tobacco. As the Seminole adapted to the Florida environment, they developed their own local traditions, such as the construction of open air thatched-roof houses known as chickees.
Sharpshooter

is a person who is skilled in precision shooting, using projectile weapons, such as with a rifle but most commonly with a sniper rifle, to shoot at long range targets. The main difference between a sharpshooter and a normal sniper is that a sharpshooter is usually considered an organic part of a team of soldiers, whereas regular snipers tend to work alone or with other snipers. In the military, marksmen are sometimes attached to an infantry squad where they take accurate long-range shots at valuable targets as needed, thus extending the reach of the squad.
TEXT.Polish: Strzelec wyborowy to żołnierz lub członek innej uzbrojonej formacji wyszkolony w precyzyjnym strzelaniu na dużą odległość, obserwacji i maskowaniu. Uzbrojenie strzelca wyborowego stanowi karabin wyborowy, specjalnie wyselekcjonowana broń wyposażona w celownik optyczny, noktowizor lub inny celownik umożliwiający celne strzelanie na duże odległości. Zadaniem strzelca wyborowego na polu walki jest eliminowanie ważnych celów pojawiających się w krótkim czasie. Mogą nimi być strzelcy wyborowi wroga, łącznicy, obsługa broni ciężkiej, załogi pojazdów pancernych uszkodzonych na polu walki, dowódcy.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sharpshooter[COLOR_REVERT]which was used in the early 19th Century. It is derived from the German word Scharfschütze. An equally-likely etymology is that the word "sharpshooters" is a contraction of "Sharps shooters" which would refer to Union Army snipers who employed Sharps rifles in the Civil War.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tireur d'élite[COLOR_REVERT], appelé aussi sniper, est une personne apte à réaliser des tirs de précision à l'aide d'un matériel adapté tel que le fusil de précision.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tiradores de primera[COLOR_REVERT] (denominación original: "sharpshooters") fueron utilizados a principios del siglo XIX. Su nombre original deriva del alemán "Scharfschütze". Una etimología igualmente probable es que la palabra "sharpshooters" es una contracción de "Sharps shooters", expresión referida a los francotiradores del Ejército de la Unión que portaban rifles Shark en la Guerra Civil Estadounidense.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Strzelec Wyborowy[COLOR_REVERT] był w użyciu już od początków XIX wieku. Służy do eliminacji ważnych jednostek wroga.

TEXT.English: Shaybani

Muhammad Shaybani Khan also known as Abul-Fath Shaybani Khan or Shayabak Khan or Shahi Beg Khan (c. 1451 - 2 December 1510), was an Uzbek leader who consolidated various Uzbek tribes and laid the foundations for their ascendance in Transoxiana and the establishment of the Khanate of Bukhara. He was a descendant of Shiban (or Shayban), the fifth son of Jochi, Genghis Khan's eldest son.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shaybani[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Sha-Co-Pay

Sha-cpay, whose name in the Dakota language means "The Six", was painted from life by George Catlin. Catlin traveled throughout Western North America and painted Indians at a time when the only contact with Whites was from explorers and traders. The chief of that part of the Ojibbeway tribe who inhabit these northern regions. is a man of huge size; with dignity of manner, and pride and vanity, just about in proportion to his bulk. He sat for his portrait in a most beautiful dress, fringed with scalp locks in profusion; which he had snatched, in his early life from his enemies' heads, and now wears as proud trophies and proofs of what his arm has accomplished in battles with his enemies. His shirt of buckskin is beautifully embroidered and painted in curious hieroglyphics, the history of his battles and charts of his life.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sha-Co-Pay[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Sheba Elites

The process of both iron smelting and forging was introduced to Sub-Saharan Africa from the north, thus many African swords were of Egyptian derivation. Among some communities, swords were restricted to royalty or tribal leaders. Forms vary from one area to another, such as the billao of Somalia, boomerang-sword in Niger or the single-edge swords of the Gold Coast. The Abyssinian shotel took the form of a large sickle, like the Egyptian khopesh, with a small 4 inch wooden handle. The edge was on the inside of the blade, which has a mid-rib running along its entire length. Double-edge swords similar to those of Europe and ancient Arabia occurred in some areas such as the takoba and kaskara. Two types of sword existed in Zanzibar: the foot-long shortsword and the standard sword with a blade measuring 3-3.5 feet and a cylindrical pommel. The latter weapon was wielded with both hands like a quarterstaff.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sheba Elites[COLOR_REVERT] is a Zimbabwe unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Elite Sheba[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Zimbabwe unique.

TEXT.English: Shehe Mvita

The founding of Mombasa is associated with two rulers: Mwana Mkisi (female) and Shehe Mvita. According to oral history and medieval commentaries, Shehe Mvita superseded the dynasty of Mwana Mkisi and established his own town on Mombasa Island. Shehe Mvita is remembered as a Muslim of great learning and so is connected more directly with the present ideals of Swahili culture that people identify with Mombasa. The ancient history associated with Shehe Mvita and the founding of an urban settlement on Mombasa Island is still linked to present-day peoples living in Mombasa. The Thenashara Taifa (or Twelve Nations) Swahili lineages recount this ancient history today and are the keepers of local Swahili traditions. Even though today Mombasa is a very heterogeneous cultural mix, families associated with the Twelve Nations are still considered the original inhabitants of the city.

The Swahili national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shehe Mvita[COLOR_REVERT], available in the medieval era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Civil Service[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Swahili est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shehe Mvita[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'ère médiévale. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marchand[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Administration[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional swahili es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shehe Mvita[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Edad Media. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercader[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Administración pública[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Suahilczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shehe Mvita[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Handlarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Handlu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Shengjun

The Hemudu culture was one of the earliest cultures to cultivate rice. Recent excavations at the Hemudu period site of Tianluoshan has demonstrated rice was undergoing evolutionary changes recognized as domestication. Most of the artifacts discovered at Hemudu consist of animal bones, exemplified by hoes made of shoulder bones used for cultivating rice. In the early Hemudu period is the maternal clan phase. Descent is said to be matrilineal and the social status of children and women is comparatively high. In the later periods, they gradually transitioned into patrilineal clans. During this period, the social status of men rose and descent is passed through the male line.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shengjun[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Shepherd

The first people to tend to animals and begin learning how their health needs may at times differ from humans were the humble Shepherds. They mastered these skills to the point that when animals were brought to the battlefield it was the shepherds of the community that were called upon to tend to the injured.
TEXT.Polish: Pasterstwo - rodzaj hodowli stadnych zwierząt domowych, prowadzonej na obszarach nienadających się do uprawy roli, ale będących w stanie wyżywić stada zwierząt, np. góry, stepy, tundra. Gatunki pasterskie to głównie owce, kozy, lamy, renifery, bydło, trzoda chlewna, wielbłądy, konie i jaki. Dla ludzi trudniących się pasterstwem wiąże się z koczowniczym, ewentualnie półkoczowniczym, trybem życia. W Polsce prowadzi się sezonowy wypas owiec na halach górskich między innymi tak zwany wypas kulturowy.

TEXT.English: Primarily used for healing animals, Shepherds can also be useful as a cheap form of general human healthcare. While they don't bring much base people healing and disease control, with promotions a player can exploit their reduced upkeep costs to heal and control disease for the community in a pinch. Nevertheless, they are unparalleled at caring for the animals in a nation's military and are only valuable for healing people if no standard healers are available to fill the rile, such as if a large stack is widely injured, stressing the ability of the primary people healers to keep up with the demand. While a nation could probably get away without their use, if you go to war with mounted and other animal units, you'll need these guys if you want to keep your forces recovering quickly.
TEXT.French: Principalement utilisé pour les soins aux animaux, les bergers peuvent également être utiles comme forme bon marché de soins pour les humains. Bien qu'ils n'apportent pas beaucoup de soins de base aux personnes et au contrôle des maladies, avec des promotions, un joueur peut exploiter leurs coûts d'entretien réduits pour guérir et contrôler les maladies pour la communauté en un rien de temps. Néanmoins, ils sont inégalés pour prendre soin des animaux dans l'armée d'un pays et ne sont utiles pour guérir les gens que si aucun guérisseur standard n'est disponible pour remplir le rile, comme si une grande pile est largement blessée, ce qui souligne la capacité des guérisseurs primaires. pour répondre à la demande. Alors qu'une nation pourrait probablement s'en tirer sans leur utilisation, si vous partez en guerre avec des unités montées et d'autres unités animales, vous aurez besoin de ces gars-là si vous voulez que vos forces se rétablissent rapidement.
TEXT.Polish: Pasterz głównie zajmuje się opiekowanie i leczeniem jednostek zwierzęcych, ale w sytuacjach krytycznych może zająć się też leczeniem ludzi.

TEXT.English: Sheriff

The sheriff is most often an elected county official, and serves as the arm of the county or parish court; but some cities, such as those in the Commonwealth of Virginia, also have a sheriff's office that serves as the arm of the city court and jail. The sheriff performs court duties. These may include such functions as administering the county or city jail, providing courtroom security and prisoner transportation, serving warrants and serving process. In urban areas, a sheriff may be restricted to those duties. Many other sheriffs and their deputies may serve as the principal police force.
TEXT.Polish: Szeryf? urząd w systemie prawodawstwa angielskiego, szkockiego i Stanów Zjednoczonych, także stanowisko osoby piastującej ten urząd. Tytuł szeryfa wywodzi się ze średniowiecznej Anglii, gdzie oznaczał urzędnika królewskiego na terenie hrabstwa. W Stanach Zjednoczonych szeryf jest zazwyczaj? wybieralnym przez mieszkańców na okres od roku do czterech lat? funkcjonariuszem sił porządkowych na terenie hrabstwa lub miejscowości. Biuro szeryfa znajduje się przeważnie w stolicy danego hrabstwa. Większość szeryfów nadzoruje także więzienia (County Jail), w których mogą być przetrzymywani aresztowani np. oczekujący na rozprawę sądową.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sheriff[COLOR_REVERT] is industrial-era police unit which help to lower crime ratio in cities and combat with cirminal units.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sheriff[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Szeryf[COLOR_REVERT] typowa jednostka obronna, bardziej się przydaje do uśmierzania niepokojów i zapobiegania przestępczości.

TEXT.English: Sher Ali Khan

Sher Ali Khan was Amir of Afghanistan from 1863 to 1866 and from 1868 until his death in 1879. He was the third son of Dost Mohammed Khan, founder of the Barakzai Dynasty in Afghanistan. Sher Ali Khan initially seized power when his father died, but was quickly ousted by his older brother, Mohammad Afzal Khan. Internecine warfare followed until Sher Ali defeated his brother and regained the title of Emir. His rule was hindered by pressure from both Britain and Russia, though Sher Ali attempted to keep Afghanistan neutral during their conflict. In 1878, the neutrality fell apart and the Second Anglo-Afghan War erupted. As British forces marched on Kabul, Sher Ali Khan decided to leave Kabul to seek political asylum in Russia. He died in Mazar-e Sharif, leaving the throne to his son Mohammad Yaqub Khan.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sher Ali Khan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sher Ali Khan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité héroïque.

TEXT.English: Ship of the Line

Italian.Text: Nave da prima linea:Navi da prima linea

TEXT.English: Shockwave APC
TEXT.French: Blindé APC à ondes de choc

TEXT.English: Now that the Internal Shockwave Engine has largely superseded internal combustion, it is only natural that an armoured personnel carrier has been developed using the new technology.
This is the Armoured Personnel Carrier upgraded to Shockwave propulsion - thus it does not require oil-based fuel. It is also somewhat stronger than its predecessor.
[ICON_BULLET]Short Range Support: +%d1_Amount%%
[ICON_BULLET]Current Short Range Support: %d1_Amount%% of this unit's Strength
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Soutien de Courte Portée actuel: %d1_Amount%% de la Puissance de l'Unité
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Supporto attuale a corto raggio: %d1_Amount%% della forza di quest'unità
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Aktualna Pomoc Strzelnicza (Bliska): %d1_Amount%% z Siły tej jednostki

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Current Short Range Support: %d1_Amount%%
Shoshenq I

Hedjkheperre Setepenre Shoshenq I, (reigned c.943-922 BCE) - was a pharaoh of ancient Egypt and the founder of the Twenty-second Dynasty. Of ancient Libyan (Meshwesh-Berber) ancestry, Shoshenq I was the son of Nimlot A, Great Chief of the Ma, and his wife Tentshepeh A, a daughter of a Great Chief of the Ma herself. He is presumed to be the Shishaq mentioned in the Hebrew Bible, and his exploits are carved on the Bubastite Portal at Karnak.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shoshenq I[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Shuttarna II

Shuttarna II (or Suttarna) was a king of the Hurrian kingdom of Mitanni in the early 14th century BC. Shuttarna was a descendant and probably a son of the great Mitannian king Artatama I. He was an ally of the Egyptian Pharaoh Amenhotep III and the diplomatic dealings of the kings are briefly recorded in the Amarna letters. Shuttarna's daughter Kilu-Hepa (sometimes spelled Gilukhepa) was given to Amenhotep III in marriage to seal the alliance between the two royal houses in the Pharaoh's 10th regnal year, taking with her a great dowry.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Shuttarna II[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Battle Elephant

War elephants were important, although not widespread, weapons in ancient military history. Their main use was in charges, to trample the enemy and/or break their ranks. War elephants were exclusively male animals, because they were faster, more aggressive, and the females had a tendency to run away from other females.[PARAGRAPH:1]Elephant taming began in the Indus valley around 4,000 years ago. Taming is not used here as a synonym of domestication. Domesticated animals, such as cows or dogs, are born in captivity and eventually subjected to selective breeding. Elephants, probably due to their bad temper, expensive feeding and slow growth rate (15 years to adulthood), were, with very few exceptions, always caught in the wild and subsequently tamed for several purposes. The first species to be tamed was thus the Asian elephant, for agricultural ends. The first military application of elephants dates from around 1100 BC and is mentioned in several Sanskrit hymns.
TEXT.Polish: Słoń bojowy? słoń wykorzystywany w działaniach wojennych, przede wszystkim w starożytności. Głównym przeznaczeniem słoni bojowych były szarże, mające na celu wzniecenie paniki w szeregach wroga lub przerwanie jego szyków. Diadochowie używali tych zwierząt także do ochrony własnych wojsk przed atakami jazdy nieprzyjaciela. Oddziały słoni uczestniczyły między innymi w bitwach nad rzeką Hydaspes (326 p.n.e.), Herakleą (280 p.n.e.) i Tapsus (46 p.n.e.).[PARAGRAPH:1]Słonie nie były efektywnym środkiem walki, gdyż stosunkowo łatwo się płoszyły i przestawały reagować na komendy kornaków. Nadejście epoki broni palnej oznaczało kres posługiwania się tymi zwierzętami w celach wojskowych. Ostatnie bitwy z wykorzystaniem słoni stoczono w XVIII wieku.

TEXT.English: This powerful early mounted combat unit (the Siamese replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Elephant[COLOR_REVERT]) is a more powerful counter to units like the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT]. It is slightly more powerful than the standard unit and can move one extra space per turn.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité de combat montée primitive (le remplacement siamois du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Eléphant de guerre[COLOR_REVERT]) est plus puissante contre des unités comme l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer monté[COLOR_REVERT]. Il est légèrement plus puissant que l'unité standard et peut se déplacer d'une case supplémentaire par tour.
TEXT.German: Diese mächtige frühe berittene Kampfeinheit (der siamesische Ersatz für [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kriegselefant[COLOR_REVERT]) ist eine stärkerer Gegner für Einheiten wie den[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berittenen Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT]. Er ist etwas stärker als die Standardeinheit und pro Durchgang eine weitere Bewegung zurücklegen.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad montada primitiva (sustituta siamesa del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Elefante de guerra[COLOR_REVERT]) es poderosa contra unidades como el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero a caballo[COLOR_REVERT]. Es ligeramente más fuerte que la unidad a la que sustituye, y cuenta con un movimiento más por turno.
TEXT.Polish: Ta potężna jednostka(Syjamski odpowiednik[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Słońia Bojowego[COLOR_REVERT]) jest potężniejsza nawet od jednostek[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Konny łucznik[COLOR_REVERT]. Jest ona bardziej potęzna niż standardowa jednostka i otrzymuje dodatkowe punkty ruchu do akcji Odwrót.

TEXT.English: Siberian Tiger
Siberian Tracker

Italian.Text: Cercatore di tracce Siberiano:Cercatori di tracce Siberiani

TEXT.English: The Siberian Tracker is a unique unit of the Siberian culture, equivalent to the Warden. It starts with the Arctic Combat promotions I, II and III, as well as the standard Warden's Hunting Sight I and II.
TEXT.Italian: Il cercatore di tracce siberiano è l'equivalente siberiano del guardiacaccia; come tale, ottiene le abilità del guardiacaccia e le promozioni per combattere nei terreni artici.

TEXT.English: The Siberian Tracker is the Siberian culture's version of the Warden. Completely at home no matter how low the temperature, it starts with the promotions Arctic Combat I, II and III, as well as Hunting Sight I and II. The ideal hunter for extreme latitudes. Useful also in battle, but not against cities, where it gets a large penalty.
TEXT.Italian: Il cercatore di tracce Siberiano è la versione Siberiana del guardiacaccia. Si trova a su agio con temperature estremamente basse, perciò inizia con le promozioni Combattente artico I, Combattente artico II e Combattente artico III, oltre a Occhio del cacciatore I e Occhio del cacciatore II. È il cacciatore ideale delle alte latitudini; è utile anche in battaglia ma non per assaltare le città, dove riceve delle gravi penalità.

TEXT.English: Siege Droid

The BAF-999 Prototype Siege Droid was a prototype battle droid produced by Balmorran Arms during the Cold War. BAF-999 Siege Droids among the forces used by the Earth Republic during their retreat from the Balmorran Arms Factory.
TEXT.Polish: Droid - to określenie większości bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposażonych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Droid[COLOR_REVERT] its powerful version of Assault Droid, unit which is specialized in siege. Can bombard cities and cause collateral damage.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Droïde de Siège[COLOR_REVERT] est une puissante version du Droïde d'Assaut, unité spécialisée dans le siège. Peut bombarder des villes et causer des dommages collatéraux.

TEXT.English: Siege Elephant

With the advent of gunpowder warfare in the late 15th century, the balance of advantage for war elephants on the battlefield began to change. While muskets had limited impact on elephants, which could withstand numerous volleys, cannon fire was a different matter entirely-an animal could easily be knocked down by a single shot. With elephants still being used to carry commanders on the battlefield, they became even more tempting targets for enemy artillery.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Elephant[COLOR_REVERT] is a Mughal unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Eléphant de Siège[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Moghol unique.

TEXT.English: Siege Engineer

With the advent of more complex machinery, particularly in use as powerful wall-busting weapons of war, the need for intelligent, mathematically educated engineers on the battlefield to assist and repair these new gatecrashers became apparent. For its age, this would've been some of the grandest expressions of human technology and these were the folks who understood all which was not immediately obvious about these powerful forces.
TEXT.Polish: Narodziny sztuki oblężniczej wiążą się bezpośrednio z powstaniem i stopniowym udoskonalaniem umiejętności wznoszenia stałych fortyfikacji, broniących dostępu do osad o charakterze miejskim, istniejących już w późnym neolicie. Ponieważ stałe umocnienia mające charakter szczelnego kręgu murów, skutecznie broniły wydzielonego terytorium przed jakimkolwiek atakiem z zewnątrz, napastnicy musieli postarać się o to, aby znaleźć skuteczne sposoby na neutralizację ich wpływu na pole walki.

TEXT.English: The build costs of a Siege Engineer are much more reasonable than that of the Cartwright that precedes them. Though they still lack for much more effectiveness than to enhance the speed of advancing forces by being present to repair the large scale siege weapons, the need for such support has certainly grown by this time and very few other sources exist to assist with these labors in the field, where the siege weapons tend to take the most damage.
TEXT.French: Les coûts de construction d'un ingénieur de siège sont beaucoup plus raisonnables que ceux du charpentier qui les précède. Bien qu'ils manquent encore beaucoup plus d'efficacité que d'augmenter la vitesse d'avancement des forces en étant présents pour réparer les armes de siège à grande échelle, le besoin d'un tel soutien s'est certainement accru à ce moment-là et très peu d'autres sources existent pour aider avec ces travaux dans sur le terrain, où les armes de siège ont tendance à subir le plus de dégâts.
TEXT.Polish: Inżynier Oblężniczy zajmuje się naprawianiem maszyn oblężniczych.

TEXT.English: Siege Onager

The onager was a Roman siege engine that is a type of catapult that uses a torsional force, generally from twisted rope, to store energy for the shot. The onager consisted of a large frame placed on the ground to whose front end a vertical frame of solid timber was rigidly fixed. A vertical spoke that passed through a rope bundle fastened to the frame had a sling attached which contained a projectile. To fire it, the spoke or arm was forced down, against the tension of twisted ropes or other springs, by a windlass, and then suddenly released. As the sling swung outwards, one end would release, as with a staff-sling, and the projectile would be hurled forward. The arm would then be caught by a padded beam or bed, when it could be winched back again.

[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Onager[COLOR_REVERT] is especially effective when assaulting cities, can bombard enemy city fortifications, and has a chance to withdraw from combat when losing. When attacking another unit, they cause collateral damage to other enemy units sharing the target's space.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Balliste Onager[COLOR_REVERT] est particulièrement efficace lors de l'assaut de villes, peut bombarder les fortifications de villes ennemies et a une chance de se retirer du combat en cas de perte. Lorsqu'elles attaquent une autre unité, elles causent des dégâts collatéraux aux autres unités ennemies partageant l'espace de la cible.

TEXT.English: Siege Ram

A Siege ram is a siege engine originating in ancient times to break open fortification walls or doors. In its simplest form, a battering ram is just a large, heavy log carried by several people and propelled with force against an obstacle; the ram would be sufficient to damage the target if the log were massive enough and/or it were moved quickly enough, and if it had enough momentum. In a more sophisticated design, a battering ram was slung from a wheeled support frame by ropes or chains so that it could be much more massive and also more easily swung against its target. Sometimes the ram's attacking point would be reinforced with a metal head and vulnerable parts of the ram might be bound with metal bands. Many battering rams had protective roofs and side-screens covered in materials, usually fresh wet hides, presumably from the animals eaten by the besiegers, to prevent the ram being set on fire, as well as to protect the operators of the ram from enemies firing arrows down on them by allowing them to seek shelter within the battering ram structure. The image of the Assyrian battering ram shows how sophisticated attacks and defences had become by the 9th century BC. The defenders are trying to set the ram alight with torches and have also put a chain under the ram. The attackers are trying to pull on the chain to free the ram, while the aforementioned wet hides would protect against the fire. The first confirmed use in the Occident was when the Spartans attacked Platea. The first use in the Mediterranean Sea with siege towers was in the 409 BC with the Selinus siege.
TEXT.Polish: Taran - dawna machina oblężnicza lub sprzęt oblężniczy służący do rozbijania i wyważania bram i murów zamków i innych obleganych umocnień, używana w starożytności i średniowieczu. Jako machina oblężnicza, taran miał formę rusztowania, pod którym była wahadłowo zawieszona ciężka belka. Zwykle machina wyposażona była w koła do przemieszczania i zadaszenie w celu osłony żołnierzy przed pociskami wroga.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege ram[COLOR_REVERT] is an early siege unit in your arsenal.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bélier de Siège[COLOR_REVERT] est une arme de siège des premier temps.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ariete de asedio[COLOR_REVERT] es una de las primeras armas de asedio para tu arsenal.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Taran Oblężniczy[COLOR_REVERT] to wczesna jednostka oblężnicza, jest szczytowym osiągnięciem jeśli chodzi o same tarany.

TEXT.English: Siege Tower

Siege Tower is a specialized siege engine, constructed to protect assailants and ladders while approaching the defensive walls of a fortification. The tower was often rectangular with four wheels with its height roughly equal to that of the wall or sometimes higher to allow archers to stand on top of the tower and shoot into the fortification. Because the towers were wooden and thus flammable, they had to have some non-flammable covering of iron or fresh animal skins. The siege tower was mainly made from wood but sometimes had metal parts.
TEXT.Polish: Wieża oblężnicza to rodzaj machiny oblężniczej wynalezionej w starożytności, mająca formę zazwyczaj drewnianej wieży z możliwością jej przemieszczania na kołach czy płozach.Używana była do szturmowania murów obronnych.Początkowo do tego celu używano drabin, niekiedy dodawano do nich koła.Rozwinięciem takiej drabiny była wieża oblężnicza wynaleziona w VII wieku p.n.e przez Asyryjczyków.Taka oto wieża chroniona była przed ogniem wilgotnymi skórami, które były naciągnięte na deski.Czasem wieża była wyposażona w taran. Na górze wieży stali łucznicy lub kusznicy oraz piechota, która gdy maszyna znalazła się przy murach zwalniała klape która spadała na mury umożliwiając piechocie przejście na mury.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Tower[COLOR_REVERT] The siege tower sometimes housed pikemen, swordsmen, or crossbowmen who shot quarrels at the defenders. Because of the size of the tower it would often be the first target of large stone catapults but it had its own projectiles with which to retaliate.[PARAGRAPH:2]Siege towers were used to get troops over an enemy wall. When a siege tower was near a wall, it would drop a gangplank between it and the wall. Troops could then rush onto the walls and into the castle or city.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tour de Siège[COLOR_REVERT] La tour de siège, abritant des spadassins, piquiers ou arbalétriers qui tirent sur les défenseurs. En raison de la taille de la tour, il sera souvent la première cible des grosses pierres des catapultes. mais ces tours avaient leurs propres projectiles.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Torre de asedio[COLOR_REVERT] alojaba ocasionalmente a piqueros, espadachines o ballesteros que disparaban virotes a los defensores. Debido al tamaño de la torre, será normalmente el primer objetivo de las grandes catapultas de piedra, pero poseía sus propios proyectiles con los que responder. Las torres de asedio eran utilizadas para enviar tropas por encima de una muralla enemiga. Cuando una torre de asedio se encontraba cerca de una muralla, tiraría un pasarela entre ella y la muralla. Entonces las tropas podrían realizar un asalto sobre las murallas al castillo o a la ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Wieża Oblężnicza pomaga bezpiecznie dostać się na mury miasta.

TEXT.English: Siege Wagon
The Siege Wagon is essentially an armored chariot with a heavily armored roof to protect against arrows and a ram.
TEXT.Italian: Il vagone da assedio è un carro corazzato con un tetto pesantemente ocrazzato, per difendersi dalle frecce, e un ariete.
TEXT.Spanish: El Vagón de guerra es, básicamente, un carruaje acorazado con un techo fuertemente blindado, para proteger de las flechas y los arietes.
TEXT.Polish: Wóz Oblężniczy świetnie sobie radzi z piechotą wroga, ale jest wrażliwy na ataki łuczników lub walki w lasach.

TEXT.English: The Siege Wagon is a wheeled unit. It has tremendous bonuses against melee units, but is killed by archers or forests.
TEXT.French: Le Chariot de Siège est une unité à roues. Il a d'énormes bonus contre les unités de mêlée, mais peut être tué par des archers ou si attaqué dans les forêts.
TEXT.Italian: Il vagone da assedio è un'unità su ruote; ha molti bonus contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato, ma è più debole contro gli arcieri o nelle foreste
TEXT.Spanish: El Vagón de asedio es una unidad sobre ruedas. Posee una bonificación formidable frente a unidades de combare cuerpo a cuerpo, pero languidece frente a Arqueros o bosques.
TEXT.Polish: Wóz Oblężniczy świetnie sobie radzi z piechotą wroga, ale jest wrażliwy na ataki łuczników lub walki w lasach.

TEXT.English: Fighting arts in the Malay Archipelago and Indonesian arose out of hunting methods and military training by the region's native inhabitants. The descendents of former headhunters still perform ancient wardances which are considered the precursor of the freestyle form in silat. While these aborigines retained their tribal way of life, the Indo-Malay diaspora instead based their culture on India and China. By adopting the Indian faiths of Hinduism and Buddhism, their social structure became more organised. Evidence shows that silat was influenced by both Indian and Chinese martial arts. Many of the region's medicinal practices and weapons originated in either India or China, and silat's thigh-slapping actions are reminiscent of Hindu wrestling. The martial arts practiced by the Chinese community of Southeast Asia are referred to as kuntao.
TEXT.Polish: Pencak silat - zbiorcze określenie na wszystkie tradycyjne sztuki walki, wywodzące się z obszaru dzisiejszej Indonezji. Termin ten obejmuje wiele regionalnych stylów. Obecnie, dzięki emigrantom z Indonezji, tradycje te cieszą się popularnością również na Zachodzie, zwłaszcza w Holandii.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Silat[COLOR_REVERT] are Indonesian culture unit. They are similar to[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT] plus they start with Shock and March promotions.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Silat[COLOR_REVERT] est l'unité culturelle Indonésienne. Ils sont similaires au [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piquier[COLOR_REVERT] en plus, ils commencent par les promotions Choc et Marche.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Silat[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Silat[COLOR_REVERT] to indonezyjski odpowiednik [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikiniera[COLOR_REVERT]. Różni się tym, że rozpoczyna z promocjami dającymi bonusy do walki jednostkami walczącymi wręcz i pomagającymi w leczeniu.

TEXT.English: Simeon I

Simeon I ruled over Bulgaria from 893 to 927, during the First Bulgarian Empire. Simeon's successful campaigns against the Byzantines, Magyars and Serbs led Bulgaria to its greatest territorial expansion ever,making it the most powerful state in contemporary Eastern Europe. His reign was also a period of unmatched cultural prosperity and enlightenment later deemed the Golden Age of Bulgarian culture.
TEXT.Polish: Władca Bułgarii w latach 893-927, car bułgarski od 913, trzeci z synów Borysa I Michała i jego żony Marii. Najwybitniejszy przedstawiciel dynastii Kruma. Podczas swego panowania Symeon odniósł szereg zwycięstw nad Bizantyńczykami, Madziarami i Serbami, co pozwoliło mu znacznie poszerzyć terytorium bułgarskie czyniąc z Bułgarii najpotężniejsze państwo we wschodniej Europie. Bułgaria Symeona rozciągała się między morzami: Egejskim, Czarnym, a Adriatykiem, a nowa stolica Presław rywalizowała o pierwszeństwo z Konstantynopolem. Czasy jego panowania są również okresem niezwykłego rozkwitu kulturalnego Bułgarii i są nazywane złotym wiekiem kultury bułgarskiej.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Simeon I[COLOR_REVERT] was a "Hero".
Sinbad the Sailor

Sinbad the Sailor is a hero of The Thousand and One Nights who recounts his adventures on seven voyages. He is not to be confused with Sindbad the Wise, hero of the frame story of the Seven Wise Masters. Sinbad, the hero of the stories, is a sailor from Basrah, living during the Abbasid Caliphate. The stories themselves are based partly on real experiences of sailors around the Indian Ocean, partly on ancient poetry (including Homer's Odyssey and Vishnu Sarma's Panchatantra), and partly upon Arab, Indian and Persian collections of tales. They recount the fantastic adventures of Sinbad during his voyages throughout the seas east of Africa and south of Asia.
TEXT.Polish: Sindbad Żeglarz? bohater cyklu historii pochodzenia perskiego o żeglarzu z Bagdadu i jego pełnych przygód podróżach po morzach wschodniego wybrzeża Afryki i południu Azji. Cykl ten jest 133. opowieścią w 6. tomie Baśni z tysiąca i jednej nocy. Historie oparte są częściowo na prawdziwych przygodach żeglarzy pływających po Oceanie Indyjskim, częściowo na starożytnych dziełach poetyckich, a częściowo na perskiej i południowoazjatyckiej mitologii i baśniach. Sindbad był synem kupca z Badgadu żyjącym za panowania Haruna ar-Raszida. Po roztrwonieniu odziedziczonego majątku, z konieczności sam został kupcem. Odbył siedem wypraw kupieckich, w czasie których zdobył i pomnożył ogromny majątek oraz znalazł żonę. Jego podróże handlowe początkowo były koniecznoscią, potem stały się jego pasją. Przeżył podczas nich wiele przygód, a jego życie wielokrotnie było zagrożone. Zawsze jednak wychodził cało z opresji. W trudnych chwilach przetrwać pomagała mu jego głęboka religijność i wiara w Allaha. Po zakończeniu siódmej podroży, podjął decyzję o zaprzestaniu tego typu wypraw, które są zbyt niebezpieczne. W życiu prywatnym Sindbad był człowiekiem gościnnym, przyjacielskim i hojnym. Otaczał go zawsze tłum przyjaciół. Był też lojalnym poddanym kalifa i głebokim patriotą. Był też bardzo religijnym muzułmaninem. Do jego wad można zaliczyć rozrzutność.

TEXT.English: The Swahili military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sinbad the Sailor[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the renaissance era, he starts off with an [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Adventurer[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optics[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Swahili est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sinbad le Marin[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à la Renaissance, il commence avec unn [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Aventurier[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optique[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar swahili es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Simbad el Marino[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir del Renacimiento, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Aventurero[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Educación[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Óptica[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Suahilczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sindbad Żeglarz[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Podróżnika[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Edukacji[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optyki[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Sintashta Chariot

The earliest fully developed spoke-wheeled horse chariots are from the chariot burials of the Andronovo (Timber-Grave) sites of the Sintashta-Petrovka Proto-Indo-Iranian culture in modern Russia and Kazakhstan from around 2000 BC. This culture is at least partially derived from the earlier Yamna culture. It built heavily fortified settlements, engaged in bronze metallurgy on an industrial scale and practiced complex burial rituals reminiscent of Hindu rituals known from the Rigveda and the Avesta.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sintashta Chariot[COLOR_REVERT] is a Sintashta unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Char équestre Sintashta[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Sintashta unique.

TEXT.English: Sipahi

Sipahi were two types of Ottoman cavalry corps, including the fief-holding provincial timarli sipahi, which constituted most of the army, and the regular kapikulu sipahi, palace troops. Other types of cavalry which were not regarded sipahi were the irregular akinci ("raiders"). The sipahi formed their own distinctive social classes, and were notably in rivalry with the Janissaries, the elite corps of the Sultan.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sipahi[COLOR_REVERT] is a Seljuks unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sipahi[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Seljuks unique.

TEXT.English: Siyu Warrior

Swahili culture is the culture of the Swahili people inhabiting the Swahili Coast. This littoral area encompasses Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda and Mozambique, as well as the adjacent islands of Zanzibar and Comoros and some parts of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Malawi. They speak Swahili as their native language, which belongs to the Niger-Congo family. Swahili culture is the product of the history of the coastal part of the African Great Lakes region, an area that has been influenced by Middle Eastern, Indian, Persian and Portuguese cultures. As with the Swahili language, Swahili culture has a Bantu core that has been modified by those foreign influences.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siyu Warrior[COLOR_REVERT] is a Swahili rifleman, stronger than its generic counterpart.
TEXT.Italian: Il Siyu è un fuciliere Swahili, molto più forte dell'unità base.
TEXT.Polish: Wojownik Siyu to silniejsza, kulturowa wersja Strzelca.

TEXT.English: Si Warrior
The Si Warrior is a unique unit of the Moche culture, equivalent to the Maceman. It starts with the promotions Shock I and II, and additional bonuses in city attack and against melee.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero Si è l'equivalente Moche del guerriero con mazza. Inizia con le promozioni Shock I e Shock II, oltre ai bonus all'attacco contro le città e contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato.

TEXT.English: The Si Warrior is the Moche culture's equivalent of the Maceman. It starts with the promotions Shock I and II, in addition to its bonuses in city attack and against melee units. Thus it is likely to be your best unit against melee opposition, and as good as any before the Light Swordsman against cities.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero Si è l'equivalente Moche del guerriero con mazza. Inizia con le promozioni Shock I e Shock II, oltre ai bonus all'attacco contro le città e contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato. Perciò è l'unità ideale per attaccare le città prima degli spadaccini leggeri.

TEXT.English: Skanderbeg

George Castriot, commonly known as Skanderbeg (from Turkish: Iskender Bey; Albanian: Skënderbej or Gjergj Kastrioti Skënderbeu; 1405 - 17 January 1468), was a 15th-century Albanian warrior and nobleman. Skanderbeg was born in 1405 to the noble Kastrioti (or Castriota) family. Sultan Murad II took him hostage at a young age and he served the Ottoman Empire during the next twenty years. He was appointed as sanjakbey of the Sanjak of Dibra by the Ottomans in 1440. In 1443, he deserted the Ottomans during the Battle of Nis and became the ruler of Kruj? Svetigrad, and Modric. In 1444, he was appointed as a commander of the short-lived League of Lezh? which proclaimed him "Chief of the League of the Albanian people". He was admired for defending the region of Albania against the Ottoman Empire for 25 years. Despite his military valor he was not able to do more than to hold his own possessions within the very small area in northern Albania where almost all of his victories against the Ottomans took place. Skanderbeg's rebellion was not a general uprising of Albanians, due to the fact that he did not gain support in the Ottoman-controlled south of Albania or Venetian-controlled north of Albania. His followers, along with Albanians, included Slavs, Vlachs, and Greeks. For 25 years, from 1443 to 1468, Skanderbeg's 10,000 man army marched through Ottoman territory winning against consistently larger and better supplied Ottoman forces.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Skanderbeg[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Skirmisher

Many armies of the Middle Ages used lightly armored skirmishers in support of the main fighting force of armored fighting men. They could be difficult to control and of little value on the battlefield, but some armies used them effectively. Skirmishers were deployed in front of the main battle line and engaged the enemy with bows, slings, and javelins. The intent was to disrupt the enemy force and cause casualties before the main battle lines clashed. The skirmishers would retire to the side of the main battle and harass the enemy as practical. They could also be useful in pursuit of a beaten enemy because they could move more quickly than men wearing armor. If caught in battle against men-at-arms, however, they could not stand and routed quickly
TEXT.Spanish: Los hostigadores tiran lanzas a sus enemigos.
TEXT.Polish: Harcownik miota włóczniami w swoich wrogów.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Skirmisher[COLOR_REVERT] is a ranged unit. It fills the upgrade gap between Javelineers and Musketeers.
TEXT.French: Une unité de tir à distance, entre les lanceurs de javelot et les mousquetaires.
TEXT.Spanish: El Hostigador es una unidad de ataque a distancia, entre los Lanzadores de jabalinas y los Soldados con mosquete.
TEXT.Polish: Harcownik jest jednostką miotającą. Wypełnia lukę między Oszczepnikami i Muszkieterami.

TEXT.English: Ski Patrol
Ski warfare, the use of ski-equipped troops in war.
TEXT.Polish: Oddział wojskowy wykorzystujący narty do poruszania się.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ski Patrol[COLOR_REVERT] The speed and distance that ski troops are able to cover is comparable to that of light cavalry.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chasseur alpin[COLOR_REVERT] La vitesse et la distance que les troupes de ski sont en mesure de couvrir est comparable à celle de la cavalerie légère.
TEXT.Spanish: La velocidad y la distancia que las [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Patrullas alpinas[COLOR_REVERT] son capaces de cubrir es comparable a la de la caballería ligera.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Patrol Alpejski[COLOR_REVERT] prędkość poruszania się i dystans, jaki ta jednostka może przebyć jest porównywalny do lekkiej kawalerii.

TEXT.English: Skunk

Skunks (in the United States, occasionally called polecats) are mammals best known for their ability to secrete a liquid with a strong, foul odor. General appearance varies from species to species, from black-and-white to brown or cream colored. Skunks, together with their closest living relatives, the stink badgers, belong to the "skunk family", the "Mephitidae" and to the order Carnivora. There are twelve species of Mephistids, which are divided into four genera: Mephitis, the (hooded and striped skunks, two species), Spilogale the (spotted skunks, four species), the Mydaus or stink badgers, two species), and Conepatus, the (hog-nosed skunks, four species). The two stink badgers in the Mydaus genus inhabit Indonesia and the Philippines; while all skunks inhabit the Americas from Canada to central South America. All other known Mephistids are extinct and known only through fossils, many in Eurasia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Skunks had been classified as a subfamily within the Mustelidae, or "weasel family", which includes ferrets, weasels, otters and badgers. However, recent genetic evidence suggests that skunks are not as closely related to the mustelids as previously thought; they are now classified in their own family. The stink badgers had until recently been classified on the basis of physical examination been placed with the other badgers, but genetic testing has proven correct those who believed stink badgers to share a more recent common ancestor with skunks than they do with the weasel family, and so the stink badgers have been transferred from the badger family to the skunk family.
TEXT.German: Das Stinktier (der fachsprachliche Terminus ist Skunk) ist ein Raubtier aus der Überfamilie der Hundeartigen, das vorrangig auf dem amerikanischen Kontinent heimisch ist. Die einzelnen Arten variieren stark in der Größe: während die kleineren gerade einmal so groß wie Eichhörnchen sind, erreichen die größeren Körperlängen wie eine kleine Hauskatze. Alle Skunks haben ein markantes schwarzes oder dunkelbraunes Fell mit weißen Streifen oder Flecken. Sie verfügen über ausgeprägte, paarige Analdrüsen, mit denen sie ein streng riechendes Sekret versprühen können, dass potenzielle Angreifer durch starke Tränenproduktion blendet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bei Stinktieren handelt es sich um größtenteils dämmerungs- und nachtaktive Tiere, die sich tagsüber in die unterschiedlichsten Verstecke zurück (selbstgegrabene oder übernommene Baue anderer Tiere, Felsspalten, hohle Baumstümpfe oder sogar Gebäude). Manche Skunks halten dort sogar eine mehrwöchige Winterruhe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Stinktiere werden aus den verschiedensten Gründen verfolgt. Zum einen war ihr Fell lange Zeit in Mode, so dass sie zeitweilig sogar in Pelztierfarmen gehalten wurden, zum anderen sind sie aber als Überträger der Tollwut gefürchtet. Sie sind dennoch weit verbreitet und gehören nicht zu den gefährdeten Tierarten.
TEXT.Polish: Skunks (Mephitis)? gatunek ssaka z rodziny skunksowatych, wcześniej zaliczane do łasicowatych, słynne z powodu cuchnącej wydzieliny, której używa do odstraszania napastników. Występuje na Wielkich Równinach w Ameryce Północnej. Zamieszkuje lasy i tereny otwarte. Jego sierść jest gęsta i puszysta w czarnym kolorze w białe paski. Skunksy to zwierzęta małej lub średniej wielkości o charakterystycznym ubarwieniu ostrzegawczym, w którym dominuje kolor czarny i biały (rzadziej brązowy i biały). Tułów jest krępy o krótkich nogach i długim, puszystym ogonie, pysk wydłużony. Mocne pazury są przystosowane do kopania w ziemi. Waga skunksów waha się od 200 g do 4,5 kg. Wszystkie gatunki mają silnie rozwinięte gruczoły przyodbytowe. Cuchnąca wydzielina tych gruczołów może być, przez skurcz mięśni otaczających torebkę gruczołową, wytryskiwana na odległość 1 m w przypadku teledu, do nawet 6 m u skunksa zwyczajnego. Zagrożony skunks ostrzega napastnika uniesieniem ogona, tupaniem w ziemię, pozorowaniem ataku, a jeśli to nie pomaga odwraca się tyłem i wytryskuje śmierdzącą ciecz na intruza celując w jego oczy, które są szczególnie na nią wrażliwe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Skunksy są w głównej mierze mięsożercami. Żywią się owadami, małymi płazami i gadami, jajami oraz drobnymi gryzoniami. Dieta jest też uzupełniana pokarmem roślinnym. Prowadzą nocny tryb życia, dzień spędzają w norach lub kryjówkach skalnych. Niektóre potrafią wspinać się na drzewa. Głównym zagrożeniem dla skunksów są większe od nich ssaki drapieżne oraz duże ptaki. Puchacz wirginijski jest znany z tego, że poluje na skunksy. Człowiek zabija skunksy jako potencjalnych nosicieli wścieklizny. Wiele osobników ginie na drogach, pod kołami pojazdów.

TEXT.English: Sleeper Cell

This is a unit that acts like a spy. The sleeper cell can move invisibily through enemy territory and explore. If it settles in a city, it can monitor production and attempt to sabotage it for a cost.
TEXT.French: Cette unité se comporte comme un espion. La cellule dormante peut se déplacer à travers le territoire ennemi de manière furtive. Une fois installé dans une ville, elle peut surveiller la production, et essayer de la saboter contre un peu d'or.
TEXT.Polish: To jest jednostka, która zachowuje si podobnie do szpiegów. Może poruszać si po terenie wroga niezauważona. Kiedy osiądzie w mieście ma możliwość sabotowania jego produkcji.

TEXT.English: Slinger

A sling is a projectile weapon typically used to throw a blunt projectile such as a stone. It is also known as the shepherd's sling. The sling is an ancient weapon. It is certain that slings were known to Neolithic peoples around the Mediterranean, but it seems likely that the sling is much older. It is quite possible that the sling was invented during the Upper Paleolithic at a time when new technologies, such as the atlatl and the bow and arrow, were emerging. With the exception of Australia, where spear throwing technology such as the woomera predominated, the sling became common all over the world, although it is not clear whether this occurred because of cultural diffusion or independent invention.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slinger[COLOR_REVERT] is an excellent early defender for your cities.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier avec fronde[COLOR_REVERT] est un excellent défenseur primitif pour vos villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hondero[COLOR_REVERT] es un excelente defensor primitivo para tus ciudades.

TEXT.English: Sloop
Sloop of War

In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship, with a single gun deck that carried up to eighteen guns. In the first half of the 18th century, most naval sloops were two-masted vessels. The first three-masted sloops appeared during the 1740s, and from the mid-1750s most new sloops were built with a three-masted (ship) rig. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and was (by virtue of having too few guns) outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". sloops were small warships intended for colonial "gunboat diplomacy" deployments, surveying duties and to act during wartime as convoy escorts. As they were not intended to deploy with the fleet, sloops had a maximum speed of less than 20 knots (37 km/h). USS Constellation constructed in 1854 is a sloop-of-war and the second United States Navy ship to carry this famous name. USS Constellation is one of the last sail-only warship designed and built by the U.S. Navy. Constellation spent much of the war as a deterrent to Confederate cruisers and commerce raiders in the Mediterranean Sea. The sloop of War is a pirate hunter in this naval mod for CIV4.
TEXT.Polish: Klasa niewielkich okrętów, początkowo żaglowych, później o napędzie śrubowym, obecnie nieistniejąca. W okresie obu wojen światowych slupy stanowiły klasę okrętów eskortowych średniej wielkości. Nazwa tej klasy funkcjonowała głównie w krajach anglosaskich.

TEXT.English: Use the Sloop of War to counter enemy Barbary Corsair attacks against your merchant ships.
TEXT.French: Utilisez la Corvette de guerre pour contrer les attaques ennemies du Corsaire Barbare contre vos navires marchands.

TEXT.English: A fast wooden ship strong againt Galleons and able to enter Ocean Squares.
TEXT.French: Un bateau en bois rapide et efficace contre les Galions et capable d'entrer dans les cases d'océan.
TEXT.Spanish: Un rápido navío de madera, poderoso frente a los Galeones, y capaz de atravesar las casillas de Océano.

TEXT.English: Sloth Bear

The sloth bear (Ursus ursinus =Melursus ursinus), also known as the labiated bear, is a nocturnal insectivorous species of bear found wild within the Indian subcontinent. The sloth bear evolved from ancestral brown bears during the Pleistocene and shares features found in insect-eating mammals through convergent evolution. The population isolated in Sri Lanka is considered as a subspecies. Unlike brown and black bears, sloth bears have lankier builds, long shaggy coats that form a mane around the face, long sickle shaped claws, and a specially adapted lower lip and palate used for sucking insects. Sloth bears breed during spring and early summer and give birth near the beginning of winter. They feed on termites, honeybee colonies and fruits. Sloth bears sometimes attack humans that encroach on their territory. Historically, humans have drastically reduced their habitat and diminished their population by hunting them for food and products such as their baculum and claws. These bears have been used as performing pets due to their tameable nature.
Sniper
Snipers and their modern and high tech equivalents, are elite shooters choosen from soldiers for their skill to shoot difficult and far away targets.
TEXT.Polish: Snajperzy i ich nowocześni odpowiednicy, są elitarnymi strzelcami, wybranymi spośród żołnierzy ze względu na swoje umiejętności strzeleckie.

TEXT.English: Snipers and their modern and high tech equivalents, are weak if you compare them to normal troops, but they have one very strong point: they target first any recon units in a stack and soot from tiles away, so those annoying medics and surgeons healing enemy troops are in great danger now.
TEXT.French: Les tireurs d'élite et de leurs équivalents modernes et de haute technologie, sont faibles si on les compare aux troupes normales, mais ils ont un point très fort: ils ciblent d'abord toutes les unités de reconnaissance dans une pile et peuvent les décimer depuis plusieurs cases.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Francotiradores (y sus equivalentes modernos y de alta tecnología) son débiles comparados con las tropas normales, pero tienen una gran ventaja: apuntarán primero a cualquier unidad de reconocimiento del grupo, y disparan desde varias casillas de distancia; así, esos molestos médicos y cirujanos que curan a las tropas enemigas están ahora en grave peligro.
TEXT.Polish: Snajper jest to strzelec wyborowy, który działa poza polem walki, by eliminować z góry określone cele. Poza precyzyjnym strzelaniem snajper musi posiadać odpowiednie cechy psychofizyczne, predysponujące go do długotrwałego oczekiwania na możliwość wykonania misji.

TEXT.English: Snow Leopard

The snow leopard (Panthera uncia or Uncia uncia) is a moderately large cat native to the mountain ranges of Central Asia. The classification of this species has been subject to change and is still classified as Uncia uncia by MSW3 as of 2000 and CITES Appendix I. However with more recent genetic studies, the snow leopard is now generally considered as Panthera uncia and classified as such by IUCN. Classically, two subspecies have been attributed but genetic differences between the two have not been settled. The snow leopard remains on the endangered species list classified as C1.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards occupy alpine and subalpine areas generally 3,350 and 6,700 metres (10,990 and 22,000 ft) above sea level in Central Asia. The Snow Leopard Survival Strategy (McCarthy et al. 2003, Table II) compiled national snow leopard population estimates, updating the work of Fox (1994). Many of the estimates are acknowledged to be rough and out of date, but the total estimated population is 4,080 - 6,590. However, the global snow leopard effective population size (those likely to reproduce) is suspected to be fewer than 2,500 (50% of the total population, or 2,040 - 3,295).[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards are slightly smaller than the other big cats but, like them, exhibit a range of sizes, generally weighing between 27 and 55 kg (60 and 120 lb), with an occasional large male reaching 75 kg (170 lb) and small female of under 25 kg (55 lb). They have a relatively short body, measuring in length from the head to the base of the tail 75 to 130 centimetres (30 to 50 in). However, the tail is quite long, at 80 to 100 cm (31 to 39 in), with only the house cat-sized Marbled Cat being relatively longer tailed. They are stocky and short-legged big cats, standing about 60 cm (24 in) at the shoulder.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards have long thick fur, and their base colour varies from smoky gray to yellowish tan, with whitish underparts. They have dark grey to black open rosettes on their body with small spots of the same color on their heads and larger spots on their legs and tail. Unusually among cats, their eyes are pale green or grey in colour.[PARAGRAPH:2]Snow leopards show several adaptations for living in a cold mountainous environment. Their bodies are stocky, their fur is thick, and their ears are small and rounded, all of which help to minimize heat loss. Their paws are wide, which distributes their weight better for walking on snow, and have fur on their undersides to increase their grip on steep and unstable surfaces; it also helps to minimize heat loss. Snow leopards' tails are long and flexible, helping them to maintain their balance, which is very important in the rocky terrain they inhabit. Their tails are also very thick due to storage of fats and are very thickly covered with fur which allows them to be used like a blanket to protect their faces when asleep.[PARAGRAPH:2]The snow leopard has a short muzzle and domed forehead, containing unusually large nasal cavities that help the animal breathe the thin, cold air of their mountainous environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]The snow leopard cannot roar, despite possessing partial ossification of the hyoid bone. This partial ossification was previously thought to be essential for allowing the big cats to roar, but new studies show that the ability to roar is due to other morphological features, especially of the larynx, which are absent in the snow leopard. Snow leopard vocalizations include hisses, chuffing, mews, growls, and wailing.
Software Developer

Once data storage and microprocessors have achieved significant enhancements, Software Devopers ermerge to replace the Programmers whom have defined the core of computer science. They bring with them advancements in programming technology, new and improved computer languages that convert more easily written code into base processing language. Practices become established for this coding so that one developer can more easily read and interpret the works of another and even quickly edit or resolve issues. These skillsets, along with new plug and play hardware methods represent a highly enhanced mechanism by which technologies may be recovered and repaired.
TEXT.Polish: Mianem programistów określa się czasami projektantów oprogramowania, inżynierów oprogramowania czy analityków systemowych. Jest to jednak pewne uproszczenie, ponieważ zawody te wymagają wielu innych umiejętności, oprócz samego programowania. O ile podział ten jest dobrze zarysowany za granicą, w Polsce panuje większa swoboda w wyborze nazw zawodu.

TEXT.English: Software Developers are truly the best units for healing Tech units. They also significantly enhance the Education levels in a city with their Educational Software applications among other ways they help to use programming to automate various tasks to take place in the most efficient manners possible, having the proxy effect of representing an enhanced education level among the people.
TEXT.French: Les Développeurs de Logicielssont vraiment les meilleures unités pour entretenir et réparer les unités Tech. Ils améliorent également de manière significative les niveaux d'éducation dans une ville avec leurs applications de logiciels éducatifs, entre autres, ils aident à utiliser la programmation pour automatiser diverses tâches à effectuer de la manière la plus efficace possible, ce qui a pour effet indirect de représenter un niveau d'éducation amélioré parmi la population.
TEXT.Polish: Deweloper Oprogramowania zajmuje się naprawianiem ultranowoczesnych jednostek.

TEXT.English: Solomon

King Solomon (flourished 10th century BC) was the son and successor of David. Nearly all that is known about him comes from the Bible (1 Kings 1 11 and 2 Chronicles 1 9). Through the efforts of his mother, Bathsheba, and the prophet Nathan, Solomon was anointed king while David was still alive. On accession to the throne, he liquidated his opponents ruthlessly and installed friends in key posts. He established Israelite colonies outside his kingdom's borders, cooperating with such friendly rulers as the Queen of Sheba to increase commerce. Fortification of his far-flung empire necessitated a vast building program, the crowning achievement of which was the Temple of Jerusalem. He reorganized the nation into 12 tribes with 12 administrative districts. He is said to have had a harem of 700 wives and 300 concubines. After the ascension to the throne of his son Rehoboam, the northern tribes seceded and formed their own kingdom of Israel, bringing an end to Solomon's empire. His legendary wisdom is recorded in the Book of Proverbs, and he is traditionally named as the author of the biblical Song of Solomon. He was regarded as the greatest king of Israel.
TEXT.Polish: Salomon (? - ok. 930 p.n.e.), król żydowski panujący od ok. 970 p.n.e. Młodszy syn Dawida. Uzyskał tron przed starszym bratem Adoniaszem dzięki wpływowi swej matki Betszeby. Popierany przez proroka Natana i kapłana Sadoka zwyciężył koalicję próbującą osadzić na tronie Adoniasza. Państwo za panowania Salomona wzrastało w siłę dzięki przyjaznym stosunkom z ościennymi krajami. Salomon przeprowadził podział kraju na prowincje, zreorganizował armię na wzór egipski. Zasłynął jako wielki budowniczy (świątynia w Jerozolimie, wznoszona przy pomocy rzemieślników z Fenicji i Egiptu, pałac królewski w Jerozolimie, wielkie stajnie w Megiddo). Poddał kontroli szlaki karawanowe (port Esjon-Geber nad Morzem Czerwonym, wyprawy do Ofiru). Salomon zyskał opinię wyjątkowo mądrego władcy. Jego dwór był ośrodkiem sztuki i przede wszystkim literatury. Przypisuje się Salomonowi autorstwo wielu powiedzeń, niektórych pieśni i ksiąg biblijnych: Pieśni nad Pieśniami, Księgi Mądrości, Księgi Przysłów, części psalmów i inne. W Starym Testamencie panowanie Salomona przedstawia się jako złoty wiek historii Izraela - wywodzi się z niego bogata żydowska i europejska tradycja literacka rozwijająca się aż do czasów wczesnego renesansu. W tradycji arabskiej Salomon, występujący pod imieniem Sulejman ibn Daud, to jeden z proroków, wielki znawca kobiet, czarodziej i władca demonów.

TEXT.English: The Israelite national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Solomon[COLOR_REVERT], available in the ancient/classical era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Minister[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarchy[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Israélite est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Salomon[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'antiquité et l'ère classique. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministre[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecriture[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarchie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional israelí es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Salomón[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Antigüedad/Época clásica. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministro[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monarquía[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Izraelczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Salomon[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ministra[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pisma[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Monoteizmu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Somali Pirate

Piracy in Somalia has been a threat to international shipping since the second phase of the Somali Civil War in the early 21st century. Since 2005, many international organizations have expressed concern over the rise in acts of piracy. Piracy impeded the delivery of shipments and increased shipping expenses, costing an estimated $6.6 to $6.9 billion a year in global trade in 2011 according to Oceans Beyond Piracy (OBP). According to the German Institute for Economic Research (DIW), a veritable industry of profiteers also arose around the piracy. Insurance companies significantly increased their profits from the pirate attacks, as the firms hiked rate premiums in response.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Somali Pirate[COLOR_REVERT] an Somalian Unit. It is a modern successor to the pirates of old.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pirates Somalien[COLOR_REVERT] sont les successeurs modernes des corsaires.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pirata Somalo[COLOR_REVERT] è un moderno successore dei pirati.
TEXT.Polish: Somalijscy Piraci to somalijska odmiana nowoczesnych piratów.

TEXT.English: Soninke Swordsman

The Soninke (also called Sarakole, Seraculeh, or Serahuli) are a Mand people who descend from the Bafour and are closely related to the Imraguen of Mauritania. They speak the Soninke language, a Mande language. They were the founders of the ancient empire of Ghana c. 750-1240 CE. Subgroups of Soninke include the Maraka and Wangara.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soninke Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT] is a Ghanian unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spadassin Soninke[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Ghanian unique.

TEXT.Spanish: Bombardeo

TEXT.Spanish: Daños colaterales
