TEXT.English: Sotaroas

Celtic archers, Sotaroas (Sow-tah-rows, "Bow Soldiers"), while not great or exceptional, are good. They are well trained, disciplined, and can put a fair deal of range behind their attacks. While their arrows aren't too notable, their ability to swiftly pepper an enemy with arrows is always of use. They are not really meant to defeat an enemy force, or even truly damage one, so much as they are meant to irritate and draw attention away from a main force, so it can position itself for flanking. As such, they are good runners, who fire a few volleys as a distraction, and then withdraw to a safe position to hide. If caught in a melee, they would be slaughtered for sure.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sotaroas[COLOR_REVERT] is a Galatian unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sotaroas[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Galatienne unique.

TEXT.English: EMP SAM Infantry
TBD

EMP SAM Infantry is future age rocket infantry unit that should be used against enemies with many wheeled, armored, helicopter and siege units. It has also a very good chance of intercepting enemy aircraft.
TEXT.French: L'Infanterie EMP SAM est une unité d'infanterie lance-roquette qui devrait être utilisée contre les ennemis de typre très divers, comme les unités roulantes, blindées, hélicoptères et de siège. Elle a également de très bonnes chances d'intercepter des avions ennemis.
TEXT.Spanish: La Infantería SAM con EMP es una unidad de infantería lanzamisiles futurista que se debe utilizar contra enemigos con multitud de unidades sobre ruedas y blindadas, helicópteros y armas de asedio. También posee una alta probabilidad de interceptar aeronaves enemigas.

TEXT.English: Conquistador

This powerful mounted combat unit (the Spanish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a bonus when attacking melee units and gets terrain defense bonuses, unlike other mounted units.
TEXT.French: Cette puissante unité montée (l'unité espagnole qui vient remplacer le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT]) bénéficie d'un bonus contre les unités de combat rapproché et d'un bonus de terrain en défense, contrairement aux autres unités montées.
TEXT.German: eignet sich als [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Spezialeinheit der Spanier[COLOR_REVERT] besser als einfache Kürassiere besonders zum [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Einsatz gegen Nahkampfeinheiten[COLOR_REVERT], besitzt eine Chance, sich bei drohenden Niederlagen zurückzuziehen, kann im Gegensatz zu anderen berittenen Einheiten einen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Verteidigungsbonus[COLOR_REVERT] erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: Questa potente unità da mischia (l'equivalente spagnolo del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corazziere[COLOR_REVERT]) ha un bonus quando attacca le altre unità da mischia e ottiene bonus di difesa dal terreno, a differenza di altre unità montate.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta poderosa unidad montada (que reemplaza al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coracero[COLOR_REVERT] en la civilización española) recibe una bonificación cuando ataca a unidades de cuerpo a cuerpo y también bonificaciones defensivas por terreno, al contrario que otras unidades montadas.
TEXT.Polish: Konkwistador to jedna z nielicznych jednostek kawaleryjskich otrzymująca bonusy do obrony wynikające z terenu.

TEXT.English: Spartacus
[ICON_BULLET]Spartacus Recruit Gladiator (25% Chance) after Combat Victory
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Spartacus recrute des Gladiaturs (25% des Chances) après une victoire
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Spartaco[COLOR_REVERT] recluta gladiatori (25% Chance) dopo ogni vittoria in combattimento
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Recluta Gladiadores después de una victoria (probabilidad del 25%)
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Spartakus[COLOR_REVERT] werbuje Gladiatora (25% szans) po zwycięstwie w walce.

TEXT.English: Spartacus (c. 109 BC-71 BC), according to Roman historians, was a slave and gladiator who became the leader (or possibly one of several leaders) in the somewhat successful slave uprising against the Roman Republic known as the Third Servile War. Little is known about Spartacus beyond the events of the war, and surviving historical accounts are inaccurate and often contradictory.[NEWLINE]Spartacus's struggle, often seen as the fight of an oppressed people fighting for their freedom against a slave-owning aristocracy, has found new meaning for modern writers since the 19th century. The rebellion of Spartacus has proven inspirational to many modern literary and political writers, making Spartacus a folk hero among cultures both ancient and modern.
TEXT.Italian: Spartaco (109-71 a.C.) fu uno schiavo e gladiatore che diventò il leader (o uno di molti leader) nella rivolta degli schiavi contro la Repubblica Romana conosciuta come Terza guerra servile. Si sa poco di Spartaco al di fuori degli eventi della guerra dato che i resoconti storici sono inaccurati e spesso contraddittori.[NEWLINE]Lo scopo di Spartaco, spesso visto come la lotta di un popolo oppresso che combatte per la libertà contro un'aristocrazia basata sullo schiavismo, ha trovato nuovi significati per gli scrittori moderni sin dal 19° secolo. La ribellione di Spartaco è stata ispiratrice per molti scrittori moderni, rendendo Spartaco un eroe popolare anche per i popoli moderni.
TEXT.Polish: Spartakus (zm. 71 p.n.e.) - niewolnik, gladiator rzymski, z pochodzenia prawdopodobnie Trak. Przywódca największego i najgroźniejszego w historii Rzymu powstania niewolników.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spartacus[COLOR_REVERT] has a 25% chance "recruits" a new [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gladiator[COLOR_REVERT] after every combat victory.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spartacus[COLOR_REVERT] a 25% de chances de "recruter" un nouveau [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gladiateur[COLOR_REVERT] après chaque victoire.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spartaco[COLOR_REVERT] ha il 25% di chance di recrutare un nuovo [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gladiatore[COLOR_REVERT] dopo ogni vittoria in combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espartaco[COLOR_REVERT] tiene una probabilidad del 25% de reclutar un nuevo [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gladiador[COLOR_REVERT] después de cada combate victorioso.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spartakus[COLOR_REVERT] ma 25% szans "zwerbować" nowego [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gladiatora[COLOR_REVERT] po każdym zwycięstwie w walce.

TEXT.English: Spartan Warrior

The Spartan army stood at the centre of the Spartan state, whose male and female citizen' were trained in the discipline and honor of the warrior society. Subject to military drill from early manhood, the Spartans were one of the most feared military forces in the Greek world. At the height of Sparta's power - between the 6th and 4th centuries BC - it was commonly accepted that, "one Spartan was worth several men of any other state." According to Thucydides, the famous moment of Spartan surrender at the island of Sphacteria off of Pylos was highly unexpected. He said that 'it was the common perception at the time that Spartans would never lay down their weapons for any reason, be it hunger, or danger.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spartan Warrior[COLOR_REVERT] is a Swordsman with the Heroic promotion, allowing it to access better promotions when it levels up.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier Sparte[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité de guerrier avec épée, avec la promotion Héroïque, lui permettant d'accéder à de meilleures promotions lorsqu'il monte de niveau.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]guerrriero spartano[COLOR_REVERT] è uno spadaccino con accesso alla promozione Eroico.
TEXT.Polish: Sparta - starożytne miasto oraz terytorium polis w południowej Grecji, na półwyspie Peloponez, główny ośrodek miejski Lakonii. Od siódmego roku życia spartańskich chłopców poddawano rygorystycznym ćwiczeniom fizycznym i wojskowym (agoge), które miały z nich uczynić wybornych wojowników (hoplitów). Spartanie nie mieszkali w swych posiadłościach ziemskich, lecz wiedli wspólnotowe życie w mieście Sparta, gdzie toczyło się życie polityczne oraz wojskowe. Istotnym elementem życia Spartiaty były wspólne posiłki - syssitia.

TEXT.English: This unit is a "Hero".
Spearman
Special Agent

Use the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Special Agents[COLOR_REVERT] to explore enemy territory and perform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Espionage Missions[COLOR_REVERT]. This spy unit start with better promotion then normal Agent.
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Agents Spéciaux[COLOR_REVERT] pour explorer le territoire ennemi et effectuer des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missions d'espionnage [COLOR_REVERT]. Cette unité d'espionnage commence avec une meilleure promotion que l'agent normal.

TEXT.English: Special Forces

In most countries special forces (SF) is a generic term for highly-trained military units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, and counter-terrorism actions. Some special forces operations, such as counter-terrorism actions, may be carried out domestically under certain circumstances. Special forces units are typically composed of relatively small groups of highly-trained personnel equipped with specialist equipment and armament, operating under principles of self-sufficiency, stealth, speed, and close teamwork, often transported by helicopter, small boats or submarines, parachuting from aircraft, or stealthy infiltration by land. Special forces are sometimes considered a force multiplier, as when they train indigenous forces to fight guerrilla warfare. Special forces have played an important role throughout the history of warfare when the aim has been to achieve disruption by "hit and run" and sabotage, rather than more traditional face-to-face combat. Other significant roles lay in reconnaissance, providing essential intelligence from close to or among the enemy, and increasingly in combating terrorists, their infrastructure and activities.
TEXT.Polish: Siły specjalne, jednostki specjalne, to elitarne formacje wojskowe lub policyjne. Takie jednostki wojskowe przystosowane, zadaniowane są do wykonywania zadań niekonwencjonalnych, nadzwyczaj trudnych, w czasie pokoju, kryzysu, wojny: kontrterrorystycznych, rozpoznawczych (głównie rozpoznanie głębokie, bądź rozpoznanie specjalne), akcja zbrojna specjalna itp. Zwykle składają się z małych wyselekcjonowanych grup żołnierzy. Wysoce specjalistycznie, świetnie wyszkolonych i nadzwyczajnie wytrzymałych psycho-fizycznie. Tacy żołnierze są nazywani komandosami lub operatorami. JW o charakterze specjalnym używają wyspecjalizowanego uzbrojenia i wyposażenia. Potrafią także zrobić śmiertelną broń z ogólnodostępnych przedmiotów, materiałów w danym terenie. Działają na lądzie, wodzie i z powietrza.

TEXT.English: Special Forces are national units capable of moving fast through enemy lands and capable of causing first strikes against cities and siege units. They can also plant explosives to destroy city defenses.
TEXT.French: Les Commandos des Forces Spéciales sont des unités nationales capables de se déplacer rapidement à travers les terres ennemies et capables de provoquer des premières frappes contre les villes et les unités de siège. Ils peuvent également implanter des explosifs pour détruire les défenses de la ville.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Fuerzas especiales son unidades nacionales capaces de movilizarse rápidamente a través del territorio enemigo y de realizar ataques de iniciativa contra ciudades y armas de asedio. También pueden colocar explosivos para destruir las defensas de una ciudad.

TEXT.English: Special Infantry

Special Infantry, are the elite special forces units of the future battlefield. Trained from their youth by the Schola Progenium in the arts of war, Special Infantry Troopers are, perhaps, the finest soldiers ever to serve in the Human History. Armed with their trademark Hellguns and Hellpistols, these soldiers take combat to the heart of the enemy with blinding speed and deadly precision
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Special Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is a future age infantry unit and it can see Hi-Tech stealth units. Has a movement rate of 2 and can attack twice per turn.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]L'Infanterie Spécialisée[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité d'infanterie de l'ère future. Elle peut détecter les unités furtives, peut se déplacer et attaquer 2 fois par tour.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantería especializada[COLOR_REVERT] es una unidad de infantería futurista, que puede ver a las unidades de alta tecnología invisibles. Dispone de 2 puntos de movimiento, y puede atacar dos veces en cada turno.
TEXT.Polish: Special Infantry is a future age infantry unit and it can see Hi-Tech stealth units. Has a movement rate of 2 and can attack twice per turn.

TEXT.English: Spectacled Bear

The spectacled bear (Tremarctos ornatus), also known as the Andean bear and locally as ukuko, jukumari or ucumari, is the last remaining short-faced bear (subfamily Tremarctinae) and the closest living relative to the Florida spectacled bear and short-faced bears of the Middle Pleistocene to Late Pleistocene age.[PARAGRAPH:2]The spectacled bear is a mid-sized species of bear native to South America. It has black fur with a distinctive beige-coloured marking across its face and upper chest, though not all Andean bears have "spectacle" markings. Males are a third larger than females in dimensions and sometimes twice their weight. Males can weigh 100 - 200 kilograms (220 - 440 lb), and females 35-82 kilograms (77- 181 lb). Length can range from 120 to 200 cm (47-79 in) long and shoulder height from 60 to 90 cm (24-30 in).They are found in several areas of northern and western South America, including eastern Panama, western Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, western Bolivia, and northwestern Argentina. Spectacled bears are the only surviving species of bear native to South America, and the only surviving member of the subfamily Tremarctinae. Their survival has depended mostly on their ability to climb even the tallest trees of the Andes.
Spiked Clubman
The Spiked Clubman is superior to the Clubman for it's sharp stone spikes on the club.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con clava appuntita è superiore al normale guerriero con clava, principalmente per l'arma che usa.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con garrote apuntillado es superior al Guerrero con garrote normal, por los clavos puntiagudos de su garrote.
TEXT.Polish: W mitologii greckiej maczuga była atrybutem herosa Heraklesa. Plemiona Indian zamieszkujących do początków XIX wieku lesiste obszary Ameryki Północnej używały maczug bojowych, które białym przybyszom przypominały kształtem drewniane łoża broni palnej, stąd anglojęzyczna ich nazwa gunstock clubs.

TEXT.English: The Spiked Clubman is a melee unit. It will later merge into the Axeman unit line.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec gourdin à pointes est une unité de combat rapproché. Il sera plus tard possible de l'équipe avec une hache.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con clava appuntita è un'unità da combattimento ravvicinato; fa parte della linea di unità dei guerrieri con ascia.
TEXT.Spanish: El guerrero con garrote apuntillado es una unidad de combate cuerpo a cuerpo. Forma parte de la cadena de mejora de los Soldados con hacha.
TEXT.Polish: Wojownik z Maczugą jest ulepszoną wersją zwykłego wojownika.

TEXT.English: Spirit Walker

Spirit Walkers were warriors imbued with native spirituality, and were feared and respected by the rival tribes in the region. All the Four Corners tribes greatly respected the Spirit Walkers as a threat, and even the Apache (famed desert warriors themselves) were careful not to underestimate them.
TEXT.Italian: Gli spiriti camminatori erano guerrieri intrisi di spiritualità, che erano temuti e rispettati dalle tribù rivali nella regione. Tutte le tribù dei quattro angoli (un'area nel sudovest degli Stati Uniti, caratterizzata dal confine tra quattro diversi stati) rispettavano gli spiriti camminatori come una minaccia, e anche gli Apache (loro stessi guerrieri del deserto di fama) erano attenti a non sottovalutarli.

TEXT.English: The Spirit Walker replaces the Spearman for the Anasazi culture. They start with a Desert Combat promotion, and double movement. Thus they are great for defence or attack on desert maps/regions, especially against mounted units.
TEXT.Italian: Lo spirito camminatore sostituisce il lanciere per la cultura Anasazi; inizia con la promozione Combattente del deserto I e con un movimento doppio rispetto ai normali lancieri. Perciò, sono ottimi per attaccare e difendere nelle regioni desertiche, specialmente contro le unità montate.

TEXT.English: Spy
Use the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spy[COLOR_REVERT] to explore enemy territory and perform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Espionage Missions[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espion[COLOR_REVERT] pour explorer les territoires ennemis et effectuer des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]missions d'espionnage[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: kann als quasi [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]unsichtbare Einheit[COLOR_REVERT] das Territorium anderer Zivilisationen erforschen und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Geheimdienstmissionen[COLOR_REVERT] durchführen.
TEXT.Italian: Usa la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spia[COLOR_REVERT] per esplorare il territorio nemico ed effettuare [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Missioni di spionaggio.
TEXT.Spanish: Se puede usar al [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espía[COLOR_REVERT] para explorar territorio enemigo y realizar [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]misiones de espionaje[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Użyj [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Szpiega[COLOR_REVERT] aby penetrować obce terytoria oraz wykonywać [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Misje Szpiegowskie[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Hypersonic Recon Plane

The Lockheed SR-71 is an advanced, long-range, Mach 3 strategic reconnaissance aircraft developed from the Lockheed YF-12A and A-12 aircraft by the Lockheed Skunk Works. The SR-71 was unofficially named the Blackbird, and called the Habu by its crews. Clarence "Kelly" Johnson was responsible for many of the design's advanced concepts. A defensive feature of the aircraft was its high speed and operating altitude, whereby, if a surface-to-air missile launch were detected, standard evasive action was simply to accelerate. The SR-71 line was in service from 1964 to 1998, with 12 of the 32 aircraft being destroyed in accidents, though none were lost to enemy action.
TEXT.Polish: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird? samolot dalekiego zwiadu strategicznego. Zaprojektowany na przełomie lat 50. i 60. XX wieku na zamówienie CIA, eksploatowany przez CIA, NASA oraz USAF. Dwusilnikowy odrzutowy średniopłat w układzie delta, osiągający prędkość Mach 3 oraz pułap 24-28 km, dzięki temu był nieosiągalny dla ówczesnych systemów obronnych. SR-71 był samolotem nieuzbrojonym, dwumiejscowym, w drugiej kabinie za pilotem znajdował się operator RSO, czyli operator elektronicznej aparatury zwiadowczej. Jej zasięg pozwalał na głęboką penetrację terenu przeciwnika bez konieczności przekraczania granic i naruszania obszaru powietrznego wroga.

TEXT.English: SR-71 is a fast spyplane with good evasion rate. With hidden nationality and the lack of attack abilities, this national unit is perfect for scouting enemy territory.
TEXT.French: SR-71 est un avion espion rapide avec un bon taux d'évasion. Avec une nationalité cachée et le manque de capacités d'attaque, cette unité nationale est parfaite pour repérer le territoire ennemi.
TEXT.Spanish: El SR-71 es un veloz avión espía con una gran capacidad de evasión. Debido a que oculta su nacionalidad y a la falta de capacidades ofensivas, esta unidad nacional es perfecta para explorar el territorio enemigo.

TEXT.English: SS-18
SS-20
SSG

The Special Services Group (SSG) is the main special operations force of the Pakistan Army. The SSG is a regiment sized group, and is headquartered at Tarbela. It is headed by a Major-General and divided into ten battalions. Each battalion consists of 700 men in four companies, with each company split into platoons and then into 10-man teams. Battalions are commanded by Lieutenant Colonels.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SSG[COLOR_REVERT] is a Pakistan unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SSG Pakistanais[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Pakistan unique.

TEXT.English: Stalkers

The tactics of ambushing have become a more refined and studied procedure at this stage. The cause for the Stalker's expanse in power and strength is enhanced weaponry and tactics developed by more civilized minds whom have taken time to study and apply more examples of tactics from previous military campaigns and observations of the natural world. It's no longer just enough to jump out of the bushes and attack... now we're setting traps and picking where to stage our attacks with great care. And using bows with poisoned arrows over blowguns does help as well.
Stalkers are the Ambusher upgrade.They are extremely dangerous when attacking but are best to stay hidden until the time is perfect to strike.
TEXT.French: Les harceleurs sont la mise à niveau embusquée de Chasseur.Ils sont extrêmement dangereux lors de l'attaque, mais il vaut mieux rester caché jusqu'à ce que le moment soit venu de frapper.

TEXT.English: Staman

The Batek do not consider this sharing of resources to be an act of kindness, they believe that all food items belong to the forest, so that the person who happens to be in possession of food has a moral obligation to share it. Since the dwellings are open, it is impossible to hoard food without others knowing about it, since selfishness is prohibited, it would not be considered stealing for another member of the camp to take food away from someone who was hoarding, if the taker was hungry.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Staman[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
[ICON_BULLET]Stampede: Will continue attacking until all defenders in the attacked plot are dead.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Suicidaire: Continue d'attaque jusqu'à ce que tous les défenseurs de la case soient morts.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Suicidio: continuerà ad attaccare fino alla morte di tutti i difensori della casella attaccata.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Popłoch: Kontynuuje atak dopóki wszyscy obrońcy na atakowanym polu nie będą martwi.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Stampede: Continues attacking until victory or death.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Suicidaire: Continue d'attaquer jusqu'à la victoire ou la mort.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Suicidio: continua ad attaccare, fino alla vittoria o alla morte.
TEXT.Polish: [ICON_BULLET]Pęd: Kontynuuje atak do wygranej lub śmierci.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Stampede: Fights to the death
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Stampede: Fights to the death.

TEXT.English: TBD
Stealth Armor

Ground vehicles using stealth technology have come to fruition at various times in history. The Challenger 2 features a redesigned hull and turret offering lower radar observability over its predecessor. More recently, the joint U.S./British Future Scout Cavalry System concept was experimented with and appeared in prototype form before being canceled. Other vehicles, particularly unmanned ground vehicles, may unintentionally have an undetectably low radar signature due to their small size. Various coatings and radar absorbing layers of material are available for combat vehicles.
TEXT.Polish: Stealth - techniki mające na celu zmniejszenie możliwości wykrycia obiektu znanymi metodami obserwacji: począwszy od ludzkiego wzroku, na metodach stricte technicznych kończąc. Obecnie dotyczy ona głównie samolotów, okrętów oraz pojazdów lądowych. Jest wiele technik umożliwiających stworzenie obiektu typu stealth, np.: wykorzystanie materiałów pochłaniających w części promieniowanie radarowe, kamuflaż obiektu, zmniejszenie śladu termicznego i turbulencji za obiektem (np. w lotnictwie), zmniejszenie hałasu z napędu obiektu (bardzo istotne w marynarce ze względu na możliwość wykrycia przez sonar) i wiele innych. Najważniejsze jest jednak odbicie fal radarowych pod kątem innym niż nadeszły, stąd właśnie płaskie i pochylone powierzchnie. Aparat matematyczny do analizy propagacji fal radarowych, odbijających się od samolotu, stworzył w 1962 radziecki fizyk i matematyk Piotr Ufimcew.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stealth Armor[COLOR_REVERT] - An early dreadnought unit with stealth capability. In-short - invisible tank.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Char Furtif[COLOR_REVERT] - Une première unité de blindée avec une capacité furtive. En bref - un char invisible.

TEXT.English: Stealth Bomber
Stealth Destroyer

The F-117 Nighthawk is a stealth ground attack aircraft formerly operated by the United States Air Force. The F-117A's first flight was in 1981, and it achieved Initial Operational Capability status in October 1983. The F-117A came out of secrecy and was revealed to the world in November 1988. The F-117A is equipped with sophisticated navigation and attack systems integrated into a digital avionics suite. It carries no radar, which lowers emissions and cross-section. It navigates primarily by GPS and high-accuracy inertial navigation. Missions are coordinated by an automated planning system that can automatically perform all aspects of a strike mission, including weapons release. Targets are acquired by a thermal imaging infrared system, slaved to a laser that finds the range and designates targets for laser-guided bombs.
TEXT.Polish: F-117 Nighthawk amerykański odrzutowy samolot bombowy wykonany w technologii stealth, produkowany przez firmę Lockheed. Służył w United States Air Force od 1983 do 2008. Pomimo oznaczenia "F", stosowanego w lotnictwie USA do klasyfikacji myśliwców, F-117 był taktycznym bombowcem, przeznaczonym do wykonywania precyzyjnych ataków na cele naziemne.

TEXT.English: TBD
Stealth Gunship
The Stealth Gunship is the gunship for the early Transhuman era. Your old gunships are great against armour and vehicles, but this one is just that much better.
TEXT.French: L'Hélicoptère Furtif est l'hélicoptère de combat du début de l'ère transhumaine. Vos anciens hélicoptères de combat sont déjà excellents contre les blindés et les véhicules, mais celui-ci est bien meilleur.
TEXT.Spanish: El Helicóptero furtivo es el helicóptero de combate de la Época transhumana temprana. Tus viejos helicópteros son excelentes frente a blindados y vehículos, pero este es simplemente mucho mejor.
TEXT.Polish: Niewykrywalny Śmigłowiec to śmigłowiec z obniżoną wykrywalnością przez radary.

TEXT.English: Stealth Submarine

Stealth submarine features diesel propulsion and an additional air-independent propulsion (AIP) system using proton exchange membrane (PEM) hydrogen fuel cells. The submarine can operate at high speed on diesel power or switch to the AIP system for silent slow cruising, staying submerged for up to three weeks without surfacing and with no exhaust heat. The system is also said to be vibration-free, extremely quiet and virtually undetectable.
TEXT.Polish: Zgodnie z zasadą nie możesz trafić tego czego nie widzisz, ale to czego nie widzisz, może trafić Ciebie, podstawą zwalczania okrętów podwodnych od zarania dziejów tej klasy jednostek jest ich wykrywanie. Z tego względu, wszyscy konstruktorzy nowoczesnych okrętów podwodnych kładą bardzo duży nacisk na zmniejszenie możliwości ich wykrycia. W dotychczasowej praktyce wojny morskiej, największe znaczenie miało zmniejszanie możliwości wykrycia optycznego i radarowego w erze okrętów nawodnych z możliwością nurkowania, szybko jednak podstawowym aspektem stealth dla okrętów podwodnych stała się kwestia wyciszenia okrętów celem zmniejszenia możliwości wykrycia za pomocą metod akustycznych. Marynarka wojenna Stanów Zjednoczonych dla przykładu, szybko utraciła w trakcie zimnej wojny swoją wynikającą z wprowadzenia napędu nuklearnego i programu albacore przewagę w zakresie prędkości oraz dopuszczalnej głębokości zanurzenia okrętów podwodnych. Przez cały jednak czas priorytetem US Navy były jak najwyższy stopień wyciszenia jednostek, a prymatu w tej dziedzinie nigdy ostatecznie nie utraciła. Dowództwo US Navy wychodziło z założenia, iż torpeda zawsze wyprzedzi okręt podwodny, zawsze też będzie w stanie zejść w ataku głębiej niż jej cel. Nie będzie jednak w stanie zniszczyć go, jeśli nie będzie w stanie go zlokalizować. Wyciszenie daje okrętowi podwodnemu podwójną korzyść? jest trudniejszy do wykrycia, podczas gdy jego własne sensory akustyczne działają lepiej przy redukcji hałasów własnych okrętu. Wyciszenie współczesnych okrętów podwodnych jest dziś tak daleko posunięte, ze według admirała Bruce'a DeMarsa, amerykańskie jednostki myśliwskie typu Seawolf przy prędkości 20 węzłów są cichsze niż okręty typu Los Angeles stojące przy nabrzeżu. Według stwierdzenia tegoż admirała, dyrektora amerykańskiego programu napędu jądrowego, Seawolf emitują do otoczenia energię akustyczną mniejszą niż kilka wat energii niezbędnej do zaświecenia żarówki. Nie mniejszą rolę w redukcji możliwości wykrycia okrętu podwodnego pełnią również inne, nieakustyczne aspekty stealth.

TEXT.English: Stealth submarines are invisible to most units. They can carry missiles and explore enemy territory. Stealth abilities grant first strike abilities against enemy destroyers and submarines
TEXT.French: Les sous-marins furtifs sont invisibles pour la plupart des unités. Ils peuvent transporter des missiles et explorer le territoire ennemi. Les capacités furtives confèrent des capacités de première frappe contre les contre-torpilleurs et les sous-marins ennemis
TEXT.Spanish: Los Submarinos furtivos son invisibles para la mayoría de las unidades. Pueden llevar misiles y explorar el territorio enemigo. Las técnicas de furtividad proporcionan ataques de iniciativa frente a los Destructores y submarinos enemigos.
TEXT.Polish: Okręt Podwodny Stealth jest niewidoczny dla wiekszości jednostek. Może przewozić pociski jądrowe oraz odkrywać wrogie terytoria. Zdolność maskowania się powoduje, ze mają szanse na pierwsze uderzenie przeciwko wrogim Niszczycielom oraz Okrętom Podwodnym

TEXT.English: Advanced Ironclad
TEXT.French: Cuirassé à coque en fer avancé

TEXT.English: Early Destroyer is good warship agaisnt wooden ships. It can perform ranged attacks and bombard city defenses. It also has low chance of intercepting enemy aircraft.
TEXT.French: Le Contre-torpilleur basique est un bon navire de guerre contre des navires en bois. Il peut effectuer des attaques à distance et bombarder les défenses de la ville. Il a également de faibles chances d'intercepter des avions ennemis.
TEXT.Spanish: El Destructor antiguo es un navío de guerra adecuado contra navíos de madera. Puede realizar cañoneo a distancia y bombardear las defensas de las ciudades. También posee una pequeña probabilidad de interceptar aeronaves enemigas.

TEXT.English: Stefan Razvan

Stefan Razvan (died December 1595) was a Voivode (Prince) of Moldavia (between 24 April 1595 and August 1595) of Romani descent from the historical Romanian state of Wallachia. The father of Stefan Razvan was a Muslim Roma from the Ottoman Empire who emigrated north of Danube, in Wallachia, while his mother was a Romanian peasant from the new country of settlement. At that time, all the Romani people living in the Romanian states of Wallachia and Moldavia were slaves. The rule was applied also to any Romani immigrants, excepting the Ottoman citizens. Benefiting of this exception, the father and later the son could remain free and become an active part in the local society.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stefan Razvan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Stephen Austin

Stephen Fuller Austin (November 3, 1793 - December 27, 1836) was an American empresario born in Virginia and raised in southeastern Missouri. Known as the Father of Texas, he led the second, and ultimately successful, colonization of the region by bringing 300 families from the United States to the region in 1825. In addition, he worked with the Mexican government to support immigration from the United States.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stephen Austin[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Stephen I

Stephen I was the first king of Hungary, who is considered to be the founder of the Hungarian state and one of the most renowned figures in Hungarian history. Stephen was a member of the Arpad dynasty and son of the supreme Magyar chieftain Geza. He was born a pagan but was baptized and reared as a Christian, and in 996 he married Gisela, daughter of Duke Henry II of Bavaria. After the death of his father (997), Stephen combated an insurrection led by his older cousin, Koppany, who claimed the throne in accordance with Arpad succession rules. Stephen defeated Koppany at Veszprém (998) and had him executed as a pagan. On Christmas Day, AD 1000, Stephen was anointed king of Hungary. According to tradition, he received from Pope Sylvester II a crown that is now held as a national treasure in Hungary. His coronation signified Hungary's entry into the family of European Christian nations. With the exception of an invasion by the Holy Roman emperor Conrad II in 1030 and minor disputes with Poland and Bulgaria, Stephen's reign was peaceful. Stephen organized his kingdom on German models. He founded bishoprics and abbeys, made the building of churches mandatory, and established the practice of tithing. He promoted agriculture, safeguarded private property with strict laws, and organized a standing army. While a ruling class was created, the institution of slavery was left virtually untouched. Stephen also opened the country to strong foreign influences, while saving it from German conquest. He treated the church as the principal pillar of his authority, dispatching missionaries throughout his realm. Stephen is Hungary's patron saint. Although his feast day is August 16, Hungarians celebrate the translation of his relics to Buda on August 20.
TEXT.Polish: Stefan I Święty (ok. 975-1038), władca Węgier z dynastii Arpadów panujący od 997, pierwszy koronowany król Węgier 1001. Syn księcia Gejzy. Jego panowanie stworzyło faktyczne podstawy państwa węgierskiego. Zreformował prawo, armię i administrację (utworzył m.in. istniejące do XX w. komitaty). Aby zapewnić państwu wewnętrzną spoistość, ok. 1000 umocnił chrześcijaństwo, zakładając w Ostrzyhomiu arcybiskupstwo. Kanonizowany w 1083, patron Węgier.

TEXT.English: The Hungarian national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stephen I[COLOR_REVERT], available in the medieval era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Priest[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Theology[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Hongrois est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stephen I[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'ère médiévale. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prêtre[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Théologie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional húngaro es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Esteban I[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Edad Media. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Clérigo[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Teología[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Węgrów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stefan I[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kapłana[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Teologii[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Stephen Uros IV Dusan

Stefan Uros IV Dusan was the King of Serbia from 8 September 1331 and Emperor of the Serbs and Greeks from 16 April 1346 until his death. Dusan conquered a large part of southeast Europe, becoming one of the most powerful monarchs of the era. He enacted the constitution of the Serbian Empire, known as Dusan's Code, perhaps the most important literary work of medieval Serbia.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stephen Uros IV Dusan[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stephen Uros IV Dusan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité héroïque.

TEXT.English: Steppe Rider

Raids between tribes were prevalent throughout the region's history. This is connected to the ease with which a defeated enemy's flocks can be driven away, which makes raiding profitable. In relation to sedentary societies, the horse gave the nomads the supreme advantage of mobility. Horsemen can raid a village and be gone with their loot before a land army can be gathered. When confronted with superior infantry, horsemen can simply ride away and regroup where there are no soldiers. Outside of Europe and parts of the Middle East, agrarian societies had difficulty raising a sufficient number of war horses and often had to buy them from their nomadic enemies. Nomads could not easily be pursued onto the steppe since the steppe could not easily support a land army. If the Chinese sent an army into Mongolia, the nomads would flee and come back when the Chinese ran out of supplies. But the steppe nomads were relatively few and their rulers had difficulty holding together enough clans and tribes to field a large army. If they conquered an agricultural area they often lacked the skills to administer it. If they tried to hold agrarian land they gradually absorbed the civilization of their subjects, lost their nomadic skills and were either absorbed by their subjects or driven out.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Steppe Rider[COLOR_REVERT] is a Massagetae unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalier des Steppes[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Massagète unique.

TEXT.English: Stiletto Boat

Stiletto is a prototype naval ship. It is notable for its hull design and carbon fiber construction, as well as its networked architecture. The 88-foot (27 m) long vessel has a notable hull design, an M-shaped hull that provides a stable yet fast platform for mounting electronic surveillance equipment or weapons, or for conducting special operations. The hull design does not require foils or lifting devices to achieve a smooth ride at high speeds in rough conditions. Its shallow draft means the M80 Stiletto can operate in littoral and riverine environments and potentially allows for beach landings. It has a topside flight deck for launching and retrieving UAVs and a rear ramp that can launch and recover an 11-meter rigid-hull inflatable boat (RIB) or Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV).[PARAGRAPH:1]Historically, ships have evolved to become narrower and deeper to achieve speed and stability. The M Hull represents a true breakthrough because its distinctively wide hull captures the vessels bow wave and redirects the energy under the hull. The Stiletto's double-M hull enables the craft to achieve an unequaled ride in rough seas at high speed, which is critical for the Navy SEALS and other Special Operations Forces, because it reduces the G-forces and related injuries these personnel are subjected to during training and on missions.
TEXT.Polish: Stiletto jest prototypowym statkiem. Warto zauważyć, na projekt i konstrukcji kadłuba z włókna węglowego, jak również jego architekturę sieci.88 stóp (27 m) długości statku ma istotny kształt kadłuba, który zapewnia stabilną szybką platformę do montażu sprzętu elektronicznego, nadzoru lub broni.

TEXT.English: Stiletto Boat is a stealth vessel which can carry up to 3 troops.
TEXT.French: Le Navire 'Stiletto' est un vaisseau furtif qui peut transporter jusqu'à 3 soldats.
TEXT.Spanish: El Torpedero Stiletto es un buque furtivo que tiene capacidad para llevar hasta a 3 unidades.
TEXT.Polish: Okret M80 Stiletto jest okrętem niewidocznym dla innych jednostek oraz może przewozić 3 oddziały.

TEXT.English: Stonewall Brigade

The Stonewall Brigade of the Confederate Army during the American Civil War, was a famous combat unit in United States military history. It was trained and first led by General Thomas J. "Stonewall" Jackson, a professor from Virginia Military Institute (VMI). His severe training program and ascetic standards of military discipline turned enthusiastic but raw recruits into an effective military organization, which distinguished itself from the First Battle of Bull Run (First Manassas) in 1861 to Spotsylvania Court House in 1864.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stonewall Brigade[COLOR_REVERT] is a Rifleman. It will hold fast like a stone wall wtih Drill and Morale, killing any enemies who attack on foot or horse.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigade 'Stonewall'[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité de fusillier. Il tiendra fermement comme un mur de pierre avec Exercice et Moral, tuant tous les ennemis qui attaquent à pied ou à cheval.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigata Stonewall[COLOR_REVERT] è un fuciliere con le promozioni Addestramento I e Morale, uccidendo ogni attaccante.
TEXT.Polish: Brygada Stonewall to konfederacka odmiana strzelców. Posiada wysokie morale i wyszkolenie.

TEXT.English: Stone Axeman

Initially axes were probably not hafted. The first true hafted axes are known from the Mesolithic period (ca. 6000 BC). Axes made from ground stone are known since the Neolithic. Few wooden hafts have been found from this period, but it seems that the axe was normally hafted by wedging. Birch-tar and raw-hide lashings were used to fix the blade. Sometimes a short section of deer antler (an "antler sleeve") was used, which prevented the splitting of the haft and softened the impact on the stone blade itself, helping absorb the impact of each axe blow and lessening the chances of breaking the handle. The antler was hollowed out at one end to create a socket for the axehead. The antler sheath was then either perforated and a handle inserted into it or set in a hole made in the handle instead.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Axeman[COLOR_REVERT] is excellent against melee units.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier avec hache de pierre[COLOR_REVERT] est excellent contre les unités de mêlée.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrero con hacha de piedra[COLOR_REVERT] es excelente frente a unidades cuerpo a cuerpo.

TEXT.English: Stone Maceman
The Stone Maceman is a warrior wielding a stick topped with a stone ball.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con mazza in pietra usa come arma un'asta con in cima una pietra.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con maza de piedra es un luchador que lleva un palo con una bola de piedra en su parte superior.
TEXT.Polish: Kamienne maczugi i pałki to poprostu kawałki kamienia przymocowane do drewnianego lub kościanego sztyliska.

TEXT.English: The Stone Maceman is a melee unit. It, and the Maceman line in general, has bonuses against Melee, as well as in assaulting cities.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec masse de pierre est une unité de combat rapproché, ayant un bonus contre les autres unités du même type ainsi que pour l'assaut des villes.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con mazza in pietra è un'unità da combattimento ravvicinato; ottiene bonus contro le unità da combattimento ravvicinato e attaccando le città.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con maza de piedra es una unidad de combate cuerpo a cuerpo. Al igual que el grupo de los luchadores con maza, obtiene bonificaciones contra otras unidades de combate cuerpo a cuerpo, así como al asaltar ciudades.
TEXT.Polish: Kamienny Pałkarz to pierwsza uniwersalna jednostka piechoty wyposażona w broń obuchową.

TEXT.English: Stone Spearman

Archeological evidence documents that wooden spears were used for hunting at least 400,000 years ago. However, wood does not preserve well. Craig Stanford, a primatologist and professor of anthropology at the University of Southern California, has suggested that the discovery of spear use by chimpanzees probably means that early humans used wooden spears as well, perhaps five million years ago.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Spearman[COLOR_REVERT] is great against animals.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier avec lance en pierre[COLOR_REVERT] est efficace contre les animaux.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrero con lanza de piedra[COLOR_REVERT] es excelente frente a animales.

TEXT.English: Stone Thrower

Throwing is the launching of a ballistic projectile by hand. This action is only possible for animals with the ability to grasp objects with their hands (mainly primates). Humans, being bipedal, have a wide variety of throwing techniques and abilities. These have been employed in warfare - first through rock-throwing, then refined weapon-throwing (e.g. spear, throwing axe), and into modern day with hand grenades and tear gas canisters. Throwing is used in many sports and games, particularly ball games, and in throwing sports the action is the main determiner of the outcome. These serve as forms of recreation and exercise in society.
TEXT.German: Improvisierte Wurfgeschosse sind die primitivste Möglichkeit, Gegner aus der Ferne anzugreifen oder auf Distanz zu halten. Selbst Tiere mit Greifhänden, wie Primaten, sind schon in der Lage, sich mit aufgelesenen Steinen, Stöcken und Früchten zu verteidigen. Der Mensch wirft durch den aufrechten Gang so treffsicher wie kein anderes Lebewesen und entwickelte darüber hinaus im Laufe der Zeit immer neue Wurfwaffen und -techniken. Weil sie sehr leicht überall zu finden waren und trotzdem bei entsprechender Größe einen immensen Schaden anrichten konnten, stellten Steine die ersten echten Wurfwaffen dar, die von Urmenschen sowohl bei der Jagd als auch im Kampf mit feindlichen Sippen angewendet wurden.
TEXT.Polish: Miotacz kamieni to najwcześniejsza jednostka dystansowa. Nie jest to zbyt silna jednostka, ale stosując je w dużej ilości można poradzić sobie z wrogiem.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Thrower[COLOR_REVERT] - One of the first units in-game. They are at their most effective when defending cities and hills.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanceur de Pierres[COLOR_REVERT]. Les pierres étaient probablement les première armes des humains avec ses mains, ses dents et ses pieds. De grosses pierres ont été utilisées pour tuer des gens et des animaux de grande taille, tandis que de petites pierres ont été lancées sur l'ennemi au cours d'affrontements le champ de bataille à l'ère paléolithique. Les néandertaliens utilisaient de grosses pierres pour tuer des mammouths laineux et d'autres grands herbivores pour l'alimentation, tandis que les Cro-Magnons utilisé de petites pierres pour tuer des gens et des animaux à distance.
TEXT.German: Eine der ersten Einheiten im Spiel. Am effektivsten sind [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Steinewerfer[COLOR_REVERT] in der Verteidigung von Hügeln und Städten.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanzador de piedras[COLOR_REVERT]: Las piedras fueron probablemente la primera arma de la humanidad, aparte de sus manos, piernas y dientes. Se usaban grandes piedras para matar personas y animales grandes, mientras que las pequeñas eran lanzadas al enemigo durante los pequeños enfrentamientos en el campo de batalla en el Paleolítico. Los neandertales usaban grandes piedras para matar a lanudos mamuts y otros grandes herbívoros en busca de alimento, mientras que los cromañones usaban piedras pequeñas para matar personas y animales a distancia.
TEXT.Polish: Kamienie były prawdopodobnie pierwszą bronią człowieka.

TEXT.English: Street Gang

Most gang members have identifying characteristics unique to their specific clique or gang. The Bloods, for instance, wear red bandanas, the Crips blue, allowing these gangs to "represent" their affiliation. Any disrespect of a gang member's color by an unaffiliated individual is regarded as grounds for violent retaliation, often by multiple members of the offended gang. Tattoos are also common identifiers, such as an '18' above the eyebrow to identify a member of the 18th Street gang. Tattoos help a gang member gain respect within their group, and mark them as members for life. They can be burned on as well as inked. Some gangs make use of more than one identifier, like the Nortenos, who wear red bandanas and have "14", "XIV", "x4", and "Norte" tattoos. Also, many male gang members wear earrings or other types of body jewelry, or simply have pierced ears to depict gang membership, unlike females, who usually wear jewelry for appearance.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gangs often establish distinctive, characteristic identifiers including graffiti tags colors, hand signals, clothing (for example, the gangsta rap-type hoodies), jewelry, hair styles, fingernails, slogans, signs (such as the noose and the burning cross as the symbols of the Klan), flags secret greetings, slurs, or code words and other group-specific symbols associated with the gang's common beliefs, rituals, and mythologies to define and differentiate themselves from other groups and gangs.[PARAGRAPH:2]As an alternative language, hand-signals, symbols, and slurs in speech, graffiti, print, music, or other mediums communicate specific informational cues used to threaten, disparage, taunt, harass, intimidate, alarm, influence, or exact specific responses including obedience, submission, fear, or terror. One study focused on terrorism and symbols states that "symbolism is important because it plays a part in impelling the terrorist to act and then in defining the targets of their actions." Displaying a gang sign, such as the noose, as a symbolic act can be construed as "a threat to commit violence communicated with the intent to terrorize another, to cause evacuation of a building, or to cause serious public inconvenience, in reckless disregard of the risk of causing such terror or inconvenience. an offense against property or involving danger to another person that may include but is not limited to recklessly endangering another person, harassment, stalking, ethnic intimidation, and criminal mischief."

Though many of them wouldn't realize it, the top echelons of street gangs often serve the will of extremely secretive black operations divisions in the government, affording these gangs a degree of political immunity for their crimes that exceeds all others. However, while stronger and often more heavily armed as a result of these agreements, the members recruited from inner city impoverished regions are personally driven by greed and social status in the gang and are rarely quite as sophisticated a breed of criminal and can act in an extremely reckless and spontaneously violent manner. They also tend to display their affiliations publicly, arousing suspicons from the law. So despit the fact that they have governmental sources pulling for them, they still often get caught and prosecuted. Street Gangs are so far the strongest and most crime spreading criminal units in their time, but they are penalized on espionage derivation and insidiousness.
TEXT.French: Bien que beaucoup d'entre eux ne le réalisent pas, les échelons supérieurs des gangs de rue servent souvent la volonté des divisions d'opérations noires extrêmement secrètes au sein du gouvernement, accordant à ces gangs un degré d'immunité politique pour leurs crimes qui dépasse tous les autres. Cependant, bien que plus forts et souvent plus lourdement armés grâce à ces accords, les membres recrutés dans les régions pauvres du centre-ville sont personnellement motivés par la cupidité et le statut social dans le gang et sont rarement aussi sophistiqués qu'une race de criminels et peuvent agir dans un manière extrêmement téméraire et spontanément violente. Ils ont également tendance à afficher publiquement leurs affiliations, suscitant des soupçons de la loi. Donc, malgré le fait qu'ils ont des sources gouvernementales qui les recherchent, ils sont encore souvent pris et poursuivis. Les gangs de rue sont jusqu'à présent les unités criminelles les plus fortes et les plus répandues de la criminalité de leur temps, mais ils sont pénalisés pour dérivation d'espionnage et insidiosité.

TEXT.English: Modern Interceptor

A strike fighter is a fighter aircraft which is also capable of attacking surface targets, including ships. It differs from an attack aircraft in that the aircraft remains a capable fighter. Previously, an airstrike on a ground target would usually involve bombers, defended by fighters. Strike-fighters can attack targets unaided, while remaining maneuverable and well-equipped enough to defend themselves.
TEXT.Polish: Samolot myśliwsko-bombowy (myśliwiec bombardujący lub myśliwsko-szturmowy) to rodzaj samolotu wojskowego łączący cechy samolotów myśliwskich i bombowych. Obecnie są częściowo wypierane są przez myśliwce wielozadaniowe. Samoloty myśliwsko-bombowe różniły się konstrukcyjnie tylko w niewielkim stopniu, lub nie różniły się w ogóle od standardowych myśliwców wyposażonych w zaczepy bombowe, natomiast ich podział był oparty w głównej mierze na przeznaczeniu. Pod tym kątem też szkolono ich załogi. Na ogół były to jednosilnikowe jednomiejscowe samoloty napędzane silnikiem śmigłowym, uzbrojone w karabiny maszynowe lub działka lotnicze, rzadziej dwusilnikowe wielomiejscowe. Po zrzuceniu bomb, samolot myśliwsko-bombowy stawał się "czystym" myśliwcem, mogącym skutecznie odpierać ataki innych samolotów. Przez to, że standardowe myśliwce, zwłaszcza końcowego okresu wojny, często korzystały z możliwości zabierania bomb, nawet o stosunkowo sporym ładunku (jak np. P-47 Thunderbolt i Supermarine Spitfire), rozgraniczenie między myśliwcami i myśliwco-bombowcami jest nieprecyzyjne i w dużym stopniu zatarte. Od lat 80. i 90. XX wieku osobne kategorie samolotów myśliwsko-bombowych, bombowców taktycznych i samolotów myśliwskich zaczęły być ponownie zastępowane przez jedną kategorię myśliwców wielozadaniowych, posiadających na skutek rozwoju techniki rozbudowane elektroniczne systemy kierowania uzbrojeniem zarówno przeciw celom powietrznym, jak i naziemnym oraz odpowiednio duży udźwig i gamę uzbrojenia. Przeznaczenie myśliwców wielozadaniowych obecnie zależne jest głównie od zestawu podwieszonego uzbrojenia, ewentualnie podwieszonej specjalistycznej aparatury kierowania uzbrojeniem. Z drugiej strony, wyodrębiła się kategoria wysoce wyspecjalizowanych samolotów myśliwsko-bombowych przeznaczonych do dokonywania precyzyjnych uderzeń na obiekty na tyłach wroga (ang. interdictor), zwykle dwumiejscowych, posiadających bogate wyposażenie elektroniczne i pilotażowe oraz wysokie osiągi, jak F-15E Strike Eagle czy Tornado IDS. Niektóre myśliwco-bombowce okresu po II wojnie światowej: Su-7, Su-17 (Su-20, Su-22), MiG-23 (wersje MiG-23B/BN), MiG-27

TEXT.English: Strike Fighters have greater range than Jet Fighters, and they are better at intercepting and destroying enemy aircraft.
TEXT.French: Les Intercepteurs ont une plus grande portée que les Chasseurs à réaction, et ils sont meilleurs pour intercepter et détruire les avions ennemis.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Cazas de ataque poseen un alcance mayor que los Cazas a reacción, y son más efectivos a la hora de interceptar y destruir aeronaves enemigas.

TEXT.English: Submarine
Submerged Town Platform

Underwater habitats are underwater structures in which people can live for extended periods and carry out most of the basic human functions of a 24-hour day, such as working, resting, eating, attending to personal hygiene, and sleeping. In this context 'habitat' is generally used in a narrow sense to mean the interior and immediate exterior of the structure and its fixtures, but not its surrounding marine environment. Most early underwater habitats lacked regenerative systems for air, water, food, electricity, and other resources. However, recently some new underwater habitats allow for these resources to be delivered using pipes, or generated within the habitat, rather than manually delivered.

With this unit you can build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submerged Town[COLOR_REVERT] improvement to coast and ocean plots. Submerged Town improvement gives +1 food, +1 hammer and +1 gold from ocean and coast plots.
TEXT.French: Avec cette unité, vous pouvez construire un aménagement[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ville sous-marine[COLOR_REVERT] sur les parcelles côtières et océaniques. L'aménagement de la ville submergée donne +1 nourriture, +1 marteau et +1 or des parcelles océaniques et côtières.
TEXT.Spanish: Con esta unidad podrás construir la mejora del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Asentamiento submarino[COLOR_REVERT] en casillas de Costa y Océano. Esta mejora proporciona +1 de alimentos, +1 de producción y +1 de comercio a las casillas de Costa y Océano.
TEXT.Polish: With this unit you can build Submerged Town improvement to coast and ocean plots. Submerged Town improvement gives +1 food, +1 hammer and +1 gold from ocean and coast plots.

TEXT.English: Subotei

Subotei was the primary strategist and general of Genghis Khan (Temjin) and gedei Khan. The son of a blacksmith, he rose through the ranks and directed more than 20 campaigns during which he conquered (or overran) more territory than any other commander in history. He gained victory by means of imaginative and sophisticated strategies and routinely coordinated movements of armies that were more than 300 miles away from each other. He is most remembered for devising the battle plan that destroyed the armies of Hungary and Poland within two days of each other, by forces almost a thousand miles apart. Subotei is regarded in history as one of Genghis Khan's and the Mongol Empire's most prominent generals in terms of ability, tactics, and loyalty, helping with the military campaigns in Asia and Eastern Europe. He commanded many successful attacks and invasions during his time and was rarely defeated. Under Batu Khan, he extended Mongol rule into Kievan Rus', the Crimea, part of the Balkans and defeated the Hungarians at the Battle of Mohi. Mongols remained in control of some of the Russian territories he conquered for the next three centuries. When Batu Khan returned to Mongolia for the election of the new Great Khan in 1242, Subatai did not accompany him nor did he press home his advantage in Europe. Had he done so, European history would have taken a different direction. Before his death in 1248, he led the Mongol campaign in China. Subatai played a major role in helping to establish the largest contiguous empire in human history, which his master believed Heaven had commanded him to conquer. That empire would leave an indelible mark on world history. Several centuries of Mongol rule across the Eurasian landmassa period that some refer to as Pax Mongolicaradically altered the demography and geopolitics of these areas. As a result of Subatai's conquests, a huge territory was unified under a stable and peaceful rule and by the Yasa legal code. Across the empire, merit could earn promotion regardless of ethnicity, religious liberty was in the main upheld, trade flourished and contact along the Silk Road reminded Europeans that the East was home to a great civilization and that Europe was not at the center of all human progress and development.
TEXT.Polish: Subedej (ok. 1175-1248) jeden z dowódców armii Czyngis-chana. Urodził się ok. 1175 roku, pochodził z plemienia Urankatów. W czasie wojny z Chorezmem w latach 1218-1223, wraz z Dżebe, dowodził armią ścigającą jego władcę Muhameda. Po jego śmierci obaj wodzowie podjęli marsz na zachód, który wedle niektórych historyków miał charakter rozpoznawczy, według innych zaś już w zamyśle skierowany był przeciw Połowcom. Obaj wodzowie obeszli od południa Morze Kaspijskie, paląc po drodze kilka miast w północnym Iranie, a następnie rozbijając wojska gruzińskie, przekroczyli Kaukaz i pokonali w kilku bitwach Połowców. 31 maja 1223 roku, w Bitwie nad Kałką, rozbili zjednoczone wojska Połowców i książąt ruskich. Następnie zdobyli Sudak, kolonię genueńską na Krymie, po czym zawrócili do Mongolii. W drodze powrotnej Subedej stracił większość armii w walkach z Bułgarami Kamskimi, wtedy też stracił oko. Za rządów Ugedeja walczył z Dżurdżenami w Chinach. Był doradcą Batu-chana i prawdopodobnie faktycznym wodzem, jego wyprawy na zachód w latach 1236-1241. W roku 1242 powrócił do Mongolii, gdzie zmarł w roku 1248. Znakomitym wodzem był także jego syn Uriangchadaj, który miał znaczny udział w podboju południowych Chin za rządów Kubilaja.

TEXT.English: The Mongolian military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subotei[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the medieval era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Civil Service[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Mongole est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subotei[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à l'ère médiévale, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Administration[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar mongol es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subotai[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Edad Media, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Teniente[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Administración pública[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Mongołów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Subedej[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Porucznik[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Administracji Państwowej[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Sugar Clipper

A clipper was a very fast sailing ship of the middle third of the 19th century. They were fast, yacht like vessels, with three masts and a square rig. They were generally narrow for their length, could carry limited bulk freight, small by later 19th century standards, and had a large total sail area. Clipper ships were mostly constructed in British and American shipyards, though France, Brazil, the Netherlands and other nations also produced some. Clippers sailed all over the world, primarily on the trade routes between the United Kingdom and its colonies in the east, in trans-Atlantic trade, and the New York-to-San Francisco route round Cape Horn during the California Gold Rush. Dutch clippers were built beginning in the 1850s for the tea trade and passenger service to Java.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sugar Clipper[COLOR_REVERT] is a Guyana unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Clipper Sucrier[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Guyana unique.

TEXT.English: Vulture
Sun Bear

The sun bear (Helarctos malayanus), also known as the honey bear, is a bear found primarily in the tropical rainforest (the dense lowland forests) in Southeast Asia; North-East India, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Southern China, Peninsular Malaysia, and the islands of Sumatra and Borneo.[PARAGRAPH:2]The sun bear is 120 - 150 cm (47 - 60 in) long, making it the smallest member in the bear family (Ursidae). Males tend to be 10 - 45% larger than females; the former normally weigh between 30 and 70 kg (66 - 154 lb), and the latter between 20 and 40 kg (44 - 88 lb). The shoulder height is about 60 - 78 cm (24 - 28 in). The sun bear possesses sickle-shaped claws that are relatively light in weight. It has large paws with naked soles, probably to assist in climbing. Its inward-turned feet make the bear's walk pigeon toed, but it is an excellent climber. It has small, round ears and a stout snout. The tail is 1.2 - 2.8 inches (3 - 7 cm) long. Despite its small size, the sun bear possesses a very long, slender tongue, ranging from 8 to 10 inches (20 - 25 cm) in length. The bear uses it to extract honey from beehives.[PARAGRAPH:2]Unlike other bears, the sun bear's fur is short and sleek. This adaptation is probably due to the lowland climates it inhabits. Dark black or brown-black fur covers its body, except on the chest, where there is a pale orange-yellow marking in the shape of a horseshoe. Similar colored fur can be found around the muzzle and the eyes. These distinctive markings give the sun bear its name.
Sundiata Keita

Sundiata Keita was the founder and ruler of the Mali Empire in West Africa. Sundiata was the son of Nare Maghan, the ruler of Kangaba, a small state located on a tributary of the upper Niger River. Sundiata left Kangaba, but the reason is unknown: he may have gone into voluntary exile to avoid a jealous half brother, or he may have been exiled by Sumanguru Kante, king of the Susu, who killed Sundiata's father and took over his kingdom. Sundiata responded to the requests of his people to return to Kangaba to help them regain independence. He assembled a coalition of Mandinka (also known as Mandingo or Malinke) chiefdoms and in 1235 led them to victory in the Battle of Kirina. According to popular tradition, Sundiata triumphed because he was a stronger magician than his opponent. This victory marked the beginning of the Mali Empire. After defeating the Susu, Sundiata consolidated his authority among the Mandinka people and established a strong centralized monarchy. According to Ibn Khaldun, a 14th-century North African historian, Sundiata ruled Mali for 25 years. He expanded the state by incorporating the Ghana empire and the West African gold fields. Sundiata built his capital at Niani, which was in his home region. Mali gained economic strength by controlling the region's trade routes and gold fields. Although he was Muslim, Sundiata allowed the people to practice their own religions. When Sundiata died, his son Uli became the mansa, or king, of Mali. The Mandinka people of West Africa continue to regard Sundiata as a national hero.
TEXT.Polish: Sundiata Keita (ur. 1190, zm. 1255) był założycielem Imperium Mali. Sunjata jest również znany jako Sogolon Djata. Imię Sogolon zapożyczone jest od jego matki, kobiety bawoła (tak nazwanej z powodu jej brzydoty i garba). W szybkiej wymowie w języku mandingo, dwa imiona zostały połączone i tak powstało imię Sondjata, Sundjata, Sundiata albo Sundżata. Drugi człon Keita jest bardziej nazwą klanu niż nazwiskiem. Sundiata Keita założył stolicę w swojej rodzinnej wsi Niani w Mali, blisko dzisiejszej granicy malijskiej z Gwineą. Chociaż był muzułmaninem wykorzystał też miejscową religię, budując reputację jako człowiek potężnej magii. Sundiata nie był absolutnym monarchą, wbrew temu co sugeruje tytuł, chociaż prawdopodobnie dzierżył powszechną władzę. Imperium Mali było podobno federacją, w której każde plemię miało swojego przedstawiciela w radzie. Pierwszym plemionami były klany Mandingo: Traore, Kamara, Koroma, Konde i oczywiście Keita. Rada plemienna sprawowała nadzór nad władzą Mansa (króla królów), narzucając mu swoje dekrety i wybierając następcę (zwykle brat Mansa albo syn jego siostry). undiata Keita zmarł w roku 1255, prawdopodobnie utonął. Tradycja podtrzymuje, że umarł podczas przechodzenia rzeki Sankarini, gdzie do dzisiaj stoi relikwiarz. Miał trzech synów, którzy byli następcami tronu Imperium Mali: Mansa Wali Keita, Ouati Keita i Khalifa Keita. Sławny zachodnioafrykański władca Mansa Musa był jego wnukiem.

TEXT.English: The Malian national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sundiata Keita[COLOR_REVERT], available in the medieval era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bard[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Music[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.

Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Music[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional malí es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sundiata Keita[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Edad Media. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bardo[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Música[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Malijczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sundiata Keita[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barda[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Muzyki[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Surgeon

In medicine, a surgeon is a specialist in surgery. Surgery is a broad category of invasive medical treatment that involves the cutting of a body, whether that of a human or a other animal, for a specific reason such as the removal of diseased tissue or to repair a tear or breakage. Surgeons may be physicians, podiatrists, dentists, or veterinarians. Surgeons usually train for longer than other medical specialists.
TEXT.French: En médecine, un chirurgien est un spécialiste de la chirurgie. La chirurgie est une large catégorie de traitements médicaux invasifs qui impliquent la découpe d'un corps, que ce soit un humain ou un autre animal, pour une raison spécifique telle que l'ablation de tissus malades ou pour réparer une déchirure ou une rupture. Les chirurgiens peuvent être des médecins, des pédiatres, des dentistes ou des vétérinaires. Les chirurgiens s'entraînent généralement plus longtemps que les autres médecins spécialistes.

TEXT.English: More skilled than a medic, surgeons can heal soldiers in the battlefield better and faster.
TEXT.French: Plus expérimenté que le médecin, les Chirurgiens peuvent soigner plus rapidement les soldats sur le champ de bataille.

TEXT.English: Suriyothai

Queen Suriyothai was a legendary queen during the 16th century Ayutthaya period of Siam (now Thailand). She is famous for having given her life in defense of her king. Suriyothai was queen during the early part of the reign of King Maha Chakapa. In 1548 AD, barely six months into King Maha Chakapat's reign, the King of Burma invaded Siam with the intent of sacking the main capital, Ayutthaya. As was the custom at the time, King Maha Chakapat led his troops in the defense of the city from atop his war elephant. Even though women were not permitted to take part in battle, Queen Suriyothai was so concerned for her husband that she disguised herself as a man and rode into battle on her own elephant. During the battle with Burmese troops, King Maha Chakapat's elephant collapsed from wounds and he was in danger of being killed. Queen Suriyothai rode her elephant to protect her husband and was killed by a scythe. She is considered a great heroine and inspiration to the Thai peoples.
TEXT.Polish: Królowa Suriyothai? legendarna królowa Syjamu (obecna Tajlandia), żyjąca w XVI wieku, oddała życie w obronie swego króla i męża Maha Chakapat. Suriyothai była królową we wczesnym okresie panowania króla Maha Chakapat. W 1548 roku w ciągu pół roku od objęcia władzy przez Maha Chakapat, wojska króla Birmy najechały Syjam i przygotowywały się do zajęcia stolicy kraju Ayutthaya. Król Maha Chakapat postanowił użyć do obrony stolicy słoni bojowych. W tamtych czasach kobietom nie wolno było brać udziału w walce lecz królowa tak bała się o męża, że postanowiła złamać zwyczaj i przebrana w męski strój wzięła udział w bitwie. W czasie bitwy król Maha Chakapat spadł ze swojego słonia i groziła mu śmierć. Suriyothai tak poprowadziła swojego słonia by osłonić męża. Niestety przypłaciła to życiem. Król Maha Chakapat postawił stupę by uhonorować jej pamięć.

TEXT.English: The Siamese military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Suriyothai[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the medieval era, she starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Loyal Servant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. She can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Divine Right[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Siamois est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Suriyothai[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à l'ère médiévale, elle commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Serviteur loyal[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Elle peut être recrutée lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Droit divin[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar siamés es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Suriyothai[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Edad Media, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sirviente leal[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Derecho divino[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Tajów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Suriyothai[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wiernego Służącego[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolona wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Prawa Boskiego[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Surku

The Ainu hunted from late autumn to early summer. The reasons for this were, among others, that in late autumn, plant gathering, salmon fishing and other activities of securing food came to an end, and hunters readily found game in fields and mountains in which plants had withered. A village possessed a hunting ground of its own or several villages used a joint hunting territory (iwor). Heavy penalties were imposed on any outsiders trespassing on such hunting grounds or joint hunting territory. The Ainu hunted bear, Ezo deer (a subspecies of sika deer), rabbit, fox, raccoon dog, and other animals. Ezo deer were a particularly important food resource for the Ainu as were salmon. They also hunted sea eagles such as white-tailed sea eagles, raven and other birds. The Ainu hunted eagles to obtain their tail feathers, which they used in trade with the Japanese. The Ainu hunted with arrows and spears with poison-coated points. They obtained the poison, called surku, from the roots and stalks of aconites. The recipe for this poison was a household secret that differed from family to family.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Surku[COLOR_REVERT] an Ainu Unit. The Ainu are the natives of Hokkaido, in Japan. It has the Poison Tips promotion, which is rare.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Surku[COLOR_REVERT] disposent de la promotion Poison, très rare.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Surku[COLOR_REVERT] ottengono la promozione Punte avvelenate.
TEXT.Polish: Surku jest łucznikiewm wyposażonym w zatrute strzały.

TEXT.English: Sviatoslav I

Sviatoslav I Igorevich, Grand prince of Kiev. The son of Igor of Kiev and Olga, Sviatoslav is famous for his persistent campaigns in the east and south, which precipitated the collapse of two great powers of Eastern Europe, Khazaria and the First Bulgarian Empire. He also conquered numerous East Slavic tribes, defeated the Alans and attacked the Volga Bulgars, and at times was allied with the Pechenegs and Magyars.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sviatoslav I[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
SWAT Team
SWAT Teams are far more militant than most branches of law enforcement. They are called in to perform high-risk sting operations against the most dangerous criminals.

Use SWAT Teams to perform arrests and to minimize crime. Their presence is a strong deterrent. However, they, like Police Helicopters and the Police APC units they obsolete, are poor investigating units. For this reason, the tried and true Police Car and the visibility enhancing Police Helicopter still remain valid for use until the Police Mech combines the best of all three.
TEXT.French: Utilisez les équipes SWAT pour effectuer des arrestations et pour minimiser la criminalité. Leur présence est un puissant moyen de dissuasion. Cependant, comme les hélicoptères de police et les unités de police APC de Blindé qu'elles sont obsolètes, ce sont de pauvres unités d'enquête. Pour cette raison, le véhicule de police éprouvé et l'hélicoptère de police améliorant la visibilité restent valables jusqu'au Mech. de Police combine le meilleur des trois.

TEXT.English: Swazi Tracker

The Swazi are a Bantu Nguni-speaking people in southeastern Africa, chiefly in Swaziland and South Africa. Besides their language, Siswati, they speak Afrikaans in South Africa, English in South Africa and Swaziland. There have been more Swazi people living in South Africa than in Swaziland since the late 1800s. The Swazi people and the Kingdom of Swaziland today are named after Mswati II, who became king in 1839. Their royal lineage can be traced to a chief named Dlamini I, this is still the royal clan name. About three-quarters of the clan groups are Nguni; the remainder are Sotho and Tsonga descendants. These groups have intermarried freely. There are slight differences among Swazi groups, but Swazi identity extends to all those with allegiance to the twin monarchs Ingwenyama "the Lion" (the king) and Indlovukati "the She-Elephant" (the queen).
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swazi Tracker[COLOR_REVERT] a Swazi Unit. It fights twice as well as it's contemporary Ranger.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pisteur Swazi[COLOR_REVERT] se bat deux fois mieux que les éclaireurs.
TEXT.Italian: Il cercatore di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]tracce Swazi[COLOR_REVERT] ha il doppio della forza dell'unità che sosituisce.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiadowca Swazi jest prawie dwa razy lepszą jednostką niż zwykły Strażnik.

TEXT.English: Swiss Pikeman

Swiss mercenaries (Reisläufer) were notable for their service in foreign armies, especially the armies of the Kings of France, throughout the Early Modern period of European history, from the Later Middle Ages into the Age of the European Enlightenment. Their service as mercenaries was at its peak during the Renaissance, when their proven battlefield capabilities made them sought-after mercenary troops. There followed a period of decline, as technological and organizational advances counteracted the Swiss' advantages. Switzerland's military isolationism largely put an end to organized mercenary activity; the principal remnant of the practice is the Swiss Guard at the Vatican.
TEXT.Spanish: Piquero suizo.
TEXT.Polish: Pikinierzy - jedna z formacji wojskowych z przełomu XV i XVI wieku i pierwsza nowoczesna piechota tamtej epoki. Ich charakterystyczna broń - długa pika (początkowo długości 2,5 m a później nawet 5,5 m) siała w ich sprawnych rękach spustoszenie w szeregach przeciwnika. Uzbrojenie ochronne w postaci pancerzy, półpancerzy i hełmów posiadał jedynie pierwszy szereg i zewnętrzne szeregi boczne. Broń pikinierów stanowiły długie piki, kusze i broń palna, co w połączeniu ze schodkowym ustawieniem kolumn (batalii), składających się każda z kilku szeregów pikinierów (przeważnie tzw. trzy batalie), dawało ich formacjom dużą manewrowość i przynosiło łatwe zwycięstwa nad rycerstwem feudalnym. Natarcie prowadzono kierując w przeciwnika trzymane na wysokości głowy piki czterech pierwszych szeregów batalii, następne szeregi trzymały piki w pionie i w miarę wbijania się w szeregi wroga opuszczały je w jego kierunku. O szeregi pikinierów rozbijały się szarże konne, a ich szyków w obronie nie sposób było pokonać. Doskonałą opinię o wysokich walorach bojowych mieli pikinierzy ze Szwajcarii. Ceniły ich wszystkie dwory europejskie najmując ich na służbę, zaś Niemcy (Frundsberg), Francuzi i Hiszpanie starali się skopiować wzorce szwajcarskie i utworzyć własne narodowe formacje piechoty. Szwajcarzy często byli instruktorami. Tak powstały pikinierskie formacje lancknechtów czy tercios.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swiss Pikemans[COLOR_REVERT] are Swiss culture unit. They are like [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Pikemans[COLOR_REVERT] with astonishing bonuses when fighting in Hills and Mountains.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piquero suizo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Szwajcarski Pikinier[COLOR_REVERT] różni się od zwykłego [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikiniera[COLOR_REVERT] tym, że rozpoczyna z czterema promocjami dającymi bonusy do walki w górzystym terenie.

TEXT.English: Swordsman
Systems Analyst

It is theorized that eventually man and machine may blend into something unrecognizable as either one. The systems analysts may well be the first real step into that direction. AI and Human Brain are fused into a dynamic harmony within the body of a man that is often cybortronically enhanced in many ways to assist with mobility and utility. But the brave souls that have given themselves to the project, many not so brave as simply clones of previous successes, have done so in the effort to generate the ultimate analytical intelligence. They spend most of their time in code analysis reverie, debugging, fixing, improving, designing deeper and deeper automated intelligence.
