Włócznie spotykamy niemal we wszystkich armiach świata, od zarania dziejów, aż po czasy nowożytne.

TEXT.English: The Wood Spearman is a melee unit. It is the beginning of the anti-cavalry line, although in the era it is available it's anti-animal ability will be more useful.
TEXT.French: Le Guerrier avec Lance de bois est une unité de mêlée. C'est le début de la ligne anti-cavalerie, bien qu'à l'époque où elle est disponible, sa capacité anti-animale sera plus utile.
TEXT.Italian: Il guerriero con lancia in legno inizia la linea di unità anti-cavalleria; ottiene bonus contro le unità montate ma, soprattutto, contro gli animali selvaggi.
TEXT.Spanish: El Guerrero con lanza de madera es una unidad de combate cuerpo a cuerpo. Es la primera unidad del grupo anticaballería, aunque en la época en la que está disponible serán más útiles sus habilidades antianimales.
TEXT.Polish: Wojownik z dzidą to pierwsza dedykowana do walki z konnicą jednostka piechoty.

TEXT.English: Dog Worker

German.Text: Arbeiter mit Hund:Arbeiters mit Hund:Arbeiter mit Hund:Arbeiter mit Hund:Arbeiter mit Hunden:Arbeiter mit Hunden:Arbeitern mit Hunden:Arbeiter mit Hunden

TEXT.English: Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker doesn't have any terrain bonuses but it still has a faster work rate than the normal worker.
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Ce travailleur particulier n'a pas de bonus de terrain mais il a toujours un rythme de travail plus rapide que le travailleur normal.

TEXT.English: Workboat (Prehistoric)
Workboat (Ancient)

Classic [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workboat[COLOR_REVERT] unit with slightly better work rate and movement. Unarmed vessels that can create fishing boats, whaling boats, and (in late game) oil rigs. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Work Boats[COLOR_REVERT] cannot enter Ocean spaces.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bateaux-atelier[COLOR_REVERT] classique, avec une vitesse de travail et des mouvements légèrement meilleurs. Navires non armés qui peuvent créer des bateaux de pêche, des baleiniers et (en fin de partie) des plates-formes pétrolières. Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bateaux-atelier [COLOR_REVERT] ne peuvent pas entrer dans les cases d'océan.

TEXT.English: Workboat (Middle Ages)

Medieval [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workboat[COLOR_REVERT] unit with moderate work rate and movement. Unarmed vessels that can create fishing boats, whaling boats, and (in late game) oil rigs. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Work Boats[COLOR_REVERT] cannot enter Ocean spaces.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bateau-Atelier médiéval[COLOR_REVERT], avec un rythme de travail et un mouvement modérés. Navires non armés qui peuvent créer des bateaux de pêche, des baleiniers et (en fin de partie) des plates-formes pétrolières. Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bateaux-ateliers[COLOR_REVERT] ne peuvent pas entrer dans les espaces océaniques.

TEXT.English: Modern Workboat

Modern Workboat unit with above average work rate and movement. Unarmed vessels that can create fishing boats, whaling boats, and (in late game) oil rigs. This[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Work Boat[COLOR_REVERT] can enter Ocean spaces.
TEXT.French: Bateau-Atelier (Moderne). C'est une unité avec un taux de travail et un déplacement supérieurs à la moyenne. Ce sont des navires non armés qui peuvent créer des bateaux de pêche, des baleiniers et (en fin de partie) des plates-formes pétrolières. Ce [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] bateau ouvrier[COLOR_REVERT] peut pénétrer dans les espaces océaniques.

TEXT.English: Sea Worker

Earliest [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workboat[COLOR_REVERT] unit with slowest work rate. Unarmed vessels that can create fishing boats, whaling boats, and (in late game) oil rigs. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Work Boats[COLOR_REVERT] cannot enter Ocean spaces.
TEXT.French: Unité la plus ancienne de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bateaux-ateliers[COLOR_REVERT], avec un rythme de travail le plus lent. Ce sont des bateaux non armés, qui peuvent installer des bateaux de pêche, des baleiniers et (en fin de partie) des plates-formes pétrolières. Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bateaux-ateliers[COLOR_REVERT] ne peuvent pas entrer dans les cases d'océan.

TEXT.English: Buffalo Worker

German.Text: Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiters mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffel:Arbeiter mit Büffeln:Arbeiter mit Büffeln:Arbeitern mit Büffeln:Arbeiter mit Büffeln

TEXT.English: Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker has bonuses to work in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plains[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Cet Ouvrier particulier a des bonus lorsqu'il travaille sur des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plaines[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Camel Worker

Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker has bonuses to work on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Desert[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Cet Ouvrier particulier a des bonus lorsqu'il travaille sur des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Déserts[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Elephant Worker

Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker has bonuses to work in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Jungle[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Cet Ouvrier particulier a des bonus lorsqu'il travaille sur des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Jungles[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Worker
Android

Like [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androids[COLOR_REVERT] improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. (They are twice as fast as [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] and their movement isn't slowed down by terrain)
TEXT.French: Comme les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT], les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androïdes[COLOR_REVERT] améliorent les terres autour de vos villes et construisent des routes qui aident à établir des routes commerciales. (Ils sont deux fois plus rapides que les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] et leur déplacement n'est pas ralenti par le terrain)
TEXT.Spanish: Al igual que los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trabajadores[COLOR_REVERT], los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androides[COLOR_REVERT] mejoran el terreno que rodea a tus ciudades y construyen caminos que te ayuden a establecer rutas comerciales. (Son el doble de rápidos que los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trabajadores[COLOR_REVERT] y no sufren costes adicionales de movimiento por terreno)
TEXT.Polish: Tak jak [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Robotnicy[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androidy[COLOR_REVERT] poprawiają teren wokół miast oraz budują drogi które pomagają w założeniu szlaków handlowych. (Sa szybsze niż [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Robotników[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Industrial Era Worker
Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. Industrial worker or better worker is needed to build railroads.
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Un travailleur industriel ou un meilleur travailleur est nécessaire pour construire des chemins de fer.

TEXT.English: Modern Era Worker

The majority of people in all civilizations throughout time have been workers. Whether engaged in farming, commerce, or industry, their actions form the economic infrastructure without which no nation can succeed. Over time, the endless activity of workers has reshaped the very surface of the land by mining hills, cutting down huge stretches of forest, and irrigating hostile terrain into fertile farmland. By the late 20th century it had become apparent that excessive deforestation and pollution from heavy industry posed a threat to the world's environment.
TEXT.French: Depuis l'aube de l'humanité et dans toutes les civilisations, une grande majorité de la population appartient à la classe ouvrière. Dans l'agriculture, le commerce ou l'industrie, ce sont les ouvriers qui forment l'infrastructure économique sans laquelle une nation ne peut survivre. Au cours des siècles, le travail des ouvriers a véritablement redessiné l'environnement, notamment en créant des mines, en abattant de vastes parcelles de forêt ou en irriguant des terres stériles pour en faire des zones cultivables. Ce n'est qu'à la fin du XXe siècle que l'Homme s'est véritablement rendu compte que la déforestation excessive et la pollution générée par l'industrie constituaient une menace pour l'environnement.
TEXT.German: In den primitiven Kulturen der "Jäger und Sammler" gab es bis auf geschlechtsspezifische Aufgaben keine echte Arbeitsteilung. Spätere Zivilisationen besaßen dann eine "Arbeiterklasse", die sich mit der Warenproduktion und niederen Arbeiten beschäftigte, welche zur Erhaltung der Gesellschaft benötigt wurden. In den meisten frühen Kulturen übernahmen Sklaven und Bauern diese Rolle. Im Mittelalter organisierten sich später viele spezialisierte Arbeiter in Handwerksgilden. Die technologischen Fortschritte des industriellen Zeitalters schufen dann eine neue Klasse von Lohnarbeitern, welche meist in Fabriken und Büros beschäftigt waren. Aber auch die weitere Spezialisierung und Professionalisierung der Arbeitswelt am Ende des 20. Jahrhunderts änderte nichts an der Tatsache, dass die Zivilisation auf den Schultern derer ruht, welche die Felder bestellen und Straßen anlegen.
TEXT.Italian: Nel corso della storia, la maggior parte della popolazione delle civiltà è sempre stata impiegata come forza lavoro nell'agricoltura, nel commercio o nell'industria; grazie al loro lavoro, è stato possibile creare infrastrutture economiche in grado di far fiorire una nazione. Nel corso del tempo, l'opera continua dei lavoratori ha prodotto molte modifiche sul territorio, con gli scavi di miniere, il disboscamento di grandi zone e l'irrigazione del terreno ostile fino a renderlo coltivabile. Verso la fine del 20° secolo, è diventato chiaro che l'eccessivo disboscamento e l'inquinamento delle fabbriche potevano rappresentare un serio pericolo per l'equilibrio ambientale del pianeta.
TEXT.Spanish: A lo largo de la historia, la mayoría de los hombres de todas las civilizaciones han sido trabajadores. Ya sea en la agricultura, el comercio o la industria, su actividad conforma la infraestructura económica sin la que ninguna nación puede prosperar. Con el tiempo, la acción incansable de los trabajadores ha cambiado la mismísima faz de la tierra, al horadar colinas, talar grandes superficies forestales e irrigar el terreno yermo para convertirlo en fértiles cultivos. A finales del siglo XX se ha hecho patente que la deforestación excesiva y la contaminación debida a la industria pesada suponen una amenaza para el medio ambiente a nivel mundial.
TEXT.Polish: Większość ludzi we wszystkich cywilizacjach przez wieki była robotnikami. Niezależnie od tego czy byli rolnikami, handlowcami, pracowali w przemyśle, ich praca tworzyła infrastrukturę ekonomiczną, bez której nie przetrwałaby żadna nacja. Przez lata, aktywność robotników zmieniała oblicze lądów poprzez budowę kopalń, ścinki lasów czy nawadnianie nieurodzajnych terenów. Pod koniec XX wieku, okazało się że wielkie wycinki lasów oraz zanieczyszczenia przemysłowe stanowią zagrożenie dla środowiska naturalnego.

TEXT.English: Llama Worker

Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker has bonuses to work on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hills[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Cet Ouvrier particulier a des bonus lorsqu'il travaille sur des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]collines[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Mammoth Worker
Work Mule

Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workers[COLOR_REVERT] to improve the land around your cities and build roads that help establish trade routes. This particular worker has bonuses to work on [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]hills[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Utilisez les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] pour améliorer le terrain autour de vos villes et construire des routes qui permettent d'établir des routes commerciales. Cet Ouvrier particulier a des bonus lorsqu'il travaille sur des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]collines[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Destroyer

In naval terminology, a destroyer is a fast maneuverable long-endurance warship intended to escort larger vessels in a fleet, convoy or battle group and defend them against smaller powerful short-range attackers. They were originally developed in the late 19th century as a defense against torpedo boats, and by the time of the Russo-Japanese War in 1904, these "torpedo boat destroyers" (TBD) were "large, swift, and powerfully armed torpedo boats designed to destroy other torpedo boats." Although the term "destroyer" had been used interchangeably with "TBD" and "torpedo boat destroyer" by navies since 1892, the term "torpedo boat destroyer" had been generally shortened to simply "destroyer" by nearly all navies by the First World War.
TEXT.Polish: Klasa niszczycieli, jako okrętów przeznaczonych do zwalczania torpedowców i ochrony przed nimi zespołów floty, powstała pod koniec XIX wieku. Pierwsze przeznaczone do tych zadań jednostki powstały w połowie lat 80. XIX wieku. Za protoplastów niszczycieli uważane są brytyjskie "Swift" i "Rattlesnake", należące do klas nazywanych torpedo boat catchers (dosłownie "łapacze torpedowców") i kanonierek torpedowych.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Destroyers[COLOR_REVERT] have a small chance of intercepting enemy aircraft and also are very good at spotting and destroying enemy [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submarines[COLOR_REVERT] (which are invisible to most other units). They are often stacked with [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carriers[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transport[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Contre-torpilleurs[COLOR_REVERT] ont une petite chance d'intercepter les avions ennemis et sont également très bons pour repérer et détruire les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sous-marins[COLOR_REVERT] ennemis (qui sont invisibles pour la plupart des autres unités). Ils sont souvent empilés avec des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Porte-avions[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transport[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Battleship

The King George V-class battleships (KGV) were the penultimate battleship design completed for the Royal Navy (RN). Five ships of the class were commissioned: King George V (1940), Prince of Wales (1941), Duke of York (1941), Howe (1942), and Anson (1942). They carried one quadruple and one high "super-firing" twin turret forward and one quadruple turret aft. In this unique layout, she carried ten 14-inch guns. Her secondary armament consisted of sixteen 5.25 inch guns clustered amidships in eight double turrets.[PARAGRAPH:2]The five battleships of the King George V class were the most modern in service with the Royal Navy in WWII. All five rendered invaluable service in the two-ocean war and could in fact be credited with helping to influence policy of the war itself. The best example of their importance was their critical role in the chase and sinking of Hitler's battleship Bismarck; a loss that significantly altered German Naval policy toward increased reliance on its U-boat arm.[PARAGRAPH:2]The other significant impact in the war the Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse, which was a World War II naval engagement illustrating the effectiveness of aerial attacks against naval forces that were not protected by air cover and the resulting importance of including an aircraft carrier in any major fleet action.[PARAGRAPH:2]The action took place east of Malaya, near Kuantan, Pahang where the British battleship HMS Prince of Wales and battlecruiser HMS Repulse were attacked by Imperial Japanese Navy land-based bombers and torpedo bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two ships were the first capital ships actively defending themselves to be sunk solely by airpower while steaming on the open sea. This incident demonstrated the vulnerability of even the most modern surface ships to the potency of air attack and drove home the necessity of air cover to protect against such an incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Following the end of World War Two, the remaining battleships of the King George V Class had become obsolete and expensive to run. In 1950 the class was laid up in reserve in Gareloch. The scrapping of the class was approved in 1957.
TEXT.Polish: W 1922 po wejściu w życie traktatu waszyngtońskiego Wielka Brytania została zobowiązana do znacznego ograniczenia zbrojeń morskich. Zgodnie z postanowieniami traktatu Royal Navy otrzymała w 1927 i 1930 dwa pancerniki typu Nelson. Traktat przestawał obowiązywać w 1936 i w związku z coraz bardziej napiętą sytuacją międzynarodową przewidywano, że nie zostanie przedłużony. Przewidując taki rozwój wypadków w Wielkiej Brytanii, opracowano projekt nowych pancerników, które mogłyby wejść do produkcji natychmiast po wygaśnięciu traktatów rozbrojeniowych. Nowe okręty miały mieć artylerię główną składającą się z dział kalibru 356 mm i niespotykane na okrętach tej wielkości silne opancerzenie.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Battleships[COLOR_REVERT] are powerful warships. They can sink most other vessels they meet. Further, when attacking, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Battleships[COLOR_REVERT] cause collateral damage to other enemy naval units sharing the target's tile. They can also bombard enemy city defenses.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Croiseurs de Bataille[COLOR_REVERT] sont de puissants navires de guerre. Ils peuvent couler la plupart des autres navires qu'ils rencontrent. De plus, en attaquant, les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Croiseurs de Bataille[COLOR_REVERT] causent des dégâts collatéraux aux autres unités navales ennemies partageant la tuile de la cible. Ils peuvent également bombarder les défenses des villes ennemies.

TEXT.English: Xicotencatl II

Xicotencatl II Axayacatl, also known as Xicotencatl the Younger (died 1521), was a prince and warleader, probably with the title of Tlacochcalcatl, of the pre-Columbian state of Tlaxcallan at the time of the Spanish conquest of Mexico.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Xicotencatl II[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Xifos

The xiphos is a double-edged, one-handed Iron Age straight shortsword used by the ancient Greeks. It was a secondary battlefield weapon for the Greek armies after the dory or javelin. The classic blade was generally about 50-60 cm long, although the Spartans supposedly started to use blades as short as 30 cm around the era of the Greco-Persian Wars. The xiphos sometimes has a midrib, or is diamond or lenticular in cross-section. It was generally hung from a baldric under the left arm. The xiphos was generally used only when the spear was discarded for close combat. Very few xiphoi seem to have survived.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Xifos[COLOR_REVERT] is a Minoan unique unit. It is a VERY strong Light Swordsman.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Xifos[COLOR_REVERT] sont des combattants à l'épée redoutables.
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Xifo[COLOR_REVERT] sono unità minoiche molto forti che sostituiscono lo spadaccino leggero.
TEXT.Polish: Xifos to unikalny lekki miecznik kultury minojskiej. Silniejszy niż podstawowa wersja tej jednostki.

TEXT.English: Yaghan Hunters

The Yaghan may have been driven to this inhospitable area by enemies to the north. They were famed for their complete indifference to the bitter weather around Cape Horn. Although they had fire and small domed shelters, they routinely went about completely naked in the frigid cold and biting wind of Tierra del Fuego. Women swam in its 48-degree-south waters hunting for shellfish. They often were observed to sleep in the open, completely unsheltered and unclothed, while Europeans shivered under blankets. A Chilean researcher claimed their average body temperature was warmer than a European's by at least one degree.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yaghan Hunters[COLOR_REVERT] is a Yaghan unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chasseur Yaghan[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Yaghan unique.

TEXT.English: Yamamoto

Marshal Naval General Isoroku Yamamoto (4 April 1884 18 April 1943) was the commander-in-chief of the Combined Fleet during World War II, a graduate of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and a student of the U.S. Naval War College and of Harvard University (19191921). One of the major advocates of Japanese naval aviation, as Commander of the 1st Fleet, Yamamoto was responsible for the plan for the surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, and for the many Japanese naval successes in the opening months of the Pacific War. Ironically, he was opposed to going to war with the United States, which he knew would be a more dangerous opponent than many Japanese imagined. His statement that Japan would "...have to dictate the peace treaty from the steps of the White House!" was not the ruthless invasion plan that Allied propagandists made it seem, but, rather, a warning to his peers that Americans would not accept defeat in the kind of limited war that Japan could afford to fight. However, once the decision to go to war had been made, he supported it in spite of his doubts. His bold plans for the opening moves of the war worked far better than he had expected; but his second campaign, to finish off the U.S. Pacific Fleet, ended in disaster at Midway. Thereafter, he operated on the defensive, waiting for a chance to strike another crippling blow, but that chance never came. He was killed in 1943, when USAAF P-38 fighters intercepted the bomber carrying him on an inspection tour of forward bases.
TEXT.Polish: Isoroku Yamamoto (ur. 4 kwietnia 1884 w Nagaoce, zm. 18 kwietnia 1943 nieopodal Bougainville na Wyspach Salomona)? japoński admirał, jeden z największych dowódców marynarki japońskiej, uważany za znakomitego stratega. Urodził się 4 kwietnia 1884 w rodzinie Teikichi Takano. Po wczesnej śmierci rodziców został adoptowany przez rodzinę Yamamoto. Był katolikiem. W wieku 17 lat rozpoczął naukę w Akademii Morskiej w Etejima w Hiroszimie (1901 - 1904). Jako młody oficer (chorąży) na pokładzie krążownika "Nisshin" uczestniczył w bitwie pod Cuszimą podczas wojny rosyjsko-japońskiej. Podczas starcia stracił 2 palce u lewej dłoni. W latach 1913 - 1916 studiował w Akademii Sztabu Marynarki w Tsukiji. Od 1916 służył w sztabie generalnym japońskiej II Floty Morskiej. W 1919 wyjechał do USA, na studia na Uniwersytecie Harvarda, które ukończył w 1921. W 1925 został attachź morskim w USA (w stopniu komandora). Funkcję tę pełnił do 1928. W 1930 awansował do stopnia kontradmirała. W grudniu 1936 został wiceministrem marynarki wojennej. Rozpoczął wówczas forsowanie rozbudowy infrastruktury lotnictwa morskiego i naciskał na rozbudowę ciężkich pancerników. W 1939 awansował na stopień admirała i został głównym dowódcą japońskiej floty morskiej. W 1941 opracował, już jako admirał, plan ataku na Pearl Harbor. Yamamoto był zagorzałym zwolennikiem budowy lotniskowców jako głównej siły bojowej floty wojennej. Zginął 18 kwietnia 1943 w samolocie Mitsubishi G4M strąconym przez amerykańskie myśliwce dalekiego zasięgu P-38 Lightning, podczas walk toczących się wokół Wysp Salomona. Lightningi zostały wysłane w daleki rajd specjalnie w celu przechwycenia jego samolotu, ponieważ dzięki złamaniu japońskich szyfrów dowiedziano się, że Yamamoto będzie wizytował swoje bazy. Śmierć admirała była wielkim ciosem dla prowadzącej wojnę Japonii.

TEXT.English: The Japanese military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yamamoto[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the modern era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Industrialism[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Flight[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Japonais est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yamamoto[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à l'Ere moderne, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lieutenant[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Industrialisation[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vol[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar japonés es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Isoroku Yamamoto[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir de la Edad Contemporánea, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Teniente[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigados el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Industrialismo[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vuelo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Japończyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yamamoto[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Porucznika[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Uprzemysłowienia[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Lotu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Yaotlalli Warrior

Flower wars differed from typical wars in a number of important aspects. While engaging in a flower war, competing armies would meet on a "preset date at a preselected place." These places became sacred sites and were called cuauhtlalli or yaotlalli. Combatants signaled the start of war by burning a large "pyre of paper and incense" between the armies. Actual battle tactics also differed from typical warfare. In typical warfare, the Aztecs used atlatl darts, stones, and other ranged weapons to weaken enemy forces from afar. However, in flower wars, the Aztecs neglected to use ranged weapons and instead used weapons such as the macuahuitl that required skill and close proximity to the enemy. The use of these kinds of weapons allowed the Aztecs to display their individual combat ability, which was an important part of the flower war.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yaotlalli Warrior[COLOR_REVERT] is a Tlaxcaltec unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier Yaotlalli[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Tlaxcaltec unique.

TEXT.English: Yao Chang

Yao Chang was the founding emperor of the Chinese/Qiang state Later Qin. His father Yao Yizhong had been a powerful general and Qiang chieftain under the Later Zhao emperor Shi Hu, but after Later Zhao's collapse after Shi Hu's horses death, Yao Chang's older brother Yao Xiang tried to start an independent state but was defeated and killed by Former Qin forces. Yao Chang became a Former Qin general, but after an incident in 384 after the Former Qin emperor Fu Jian's defeat at the Battle of Fei River, Yao Chang feared that Fu Jian would kill him and therefore rebelled. He subsequently captured and killed Fu Jian, who had saved his life when Yao Xiang was defeated, causing many historians to view him as a traitor and murderer.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yao Chang[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Yawar Runa

The third earliest documented European contact with the Yagua was probably made by the Spanish explorer Francisco de Orellana in January 1542. While exploring in the area of modern day Pebas, Orellana encountered a village called Aparia, and captured two chiefs named Aparia and Dirimara, as well as some others. These names could conceivably have come from the Yagua words (j)apiirya 'red macaw clan' and rimyura 'shaman' respectively. The former could very well be a village name as well as a name applied to an individual; today clan names are still used by many Yaguas as family names. The word for shaman might also be used to refer to an individual, especially one singled out as a 'chief'. Regular European contact began in 1686 with the establishment of a Jesuit mission at San Joaquin de los Omagua, on an island in the Amazon river probably near what is now the mouth of the Ampiyacu River. Though this mission was established to serve the Cambeba people, there was undoubtedly contact with the Yaguas as well. From the 17th century to the last half of the 19th century, contact with the Yaguas was mainly through the Jesuit and Franciscan missionaries. In the early 18th century, Portuguese raiding parties attacked the Spanish missions throughout the Amazon region causing much geographic dispersion of the tribes that were in contact with the Spanish, and inflicting severe casualties.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yawar Runa[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Yeoman Archer

A yeoman was a member of a social class in late medieval to early modern England. In early recorded uses, a yeoman was an attendant in a noble household; hence titles such as Yeoman of the Chamber, Yeoman of the Crown, Yeoman Usher, King's Yeoman, Yeomen Warders, Yeomen of the Guard. The later sense of yeoman as "a commoner who cultivates his own land" is recorded from the 15th century; in military context, yeoman was the rank of the third order of fighting men, below knights and squires, but above knaves. A specialized meaning in naval terminology, "petty officer in charge of supplies", arose in the 1660s.
TEXT.Polish: Yeoman - członek warstwy społecznej stanu wolnego w Anglii XV-XVIII wieku. W średniowieczu był on członkiem świty króla lub możnego, później termin oznaczał wolnego chłopa, drobnego właściciela ziemskiego lub dzierżawcę gospodarstwa obłożonego obowiązkiem służby zbrojnej, od XVII w. już tylko dzierżawców ziemi szlacheckiej. Warstwa wzbogaciła się w epoce Tudorów dzięki wyprzedaży ziemi pokościelnej oraz w toku ogradzania, z tego powodu odgrywali oni znaczna rolę w gospodarce wiejskiej. Wspierali oni ponadto rewolucję angielską dążąc do likwidacji przywilejów stanowych szlachty rodowej, tzw. gentry, bezpośrednio pod którą stała. Yeomani mieli prawa polityczne i stanowili zaplecze armii (zob. yeomanry), skąd nazwą tą współcześnie określani są również członkowie pewnych formacji, np. przybocznej gwardii królewskiej, Yeomen of the Guard (założonej w 1485 roku), czy ochotniczej kawalerii obrony wewnętrznej (utworzonej w 1761 roku).

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yeoman Archer[COLOR_REVERT] is a Welsh unit. It is even better at archery than the already good Longbowman.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]L'Archer Yeoman[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Galloise. Elle est meilleure encore que les Archers Composites.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]L'arciere Yeoman[COLOR_REVERT] è un'unità tipica del Galles; sostituisce l'Arciere con arco lungo
TEXT.Polish: Łucznik Yeomanów to najlepsza łucznicza jednostka w grze!

TEXT.English: Yi Sun-Sin

Yi Sun-Sin was a Korean admiral and national hero whose naval victories were instrumental in repelling Japanese invasions of Korea in the 1590s. After passing the government examinations to become a military officer in 1576, Yi served at various army and navy posts. Although he was twice discharged after being falsely accused by jealous colleagues, in 1591 he was appointed commander of the naval forces in Left Cholla province, where he concentrated on training his men, stocking equipment and supplies, and developing the renowned kobukson (turtle ship). The kobukson is thought to have been the first ironclad battleship in history. Its upper deck was covered with armoured plates to protect its crew, and spikes and knives were attached to the plates to discourage enemies from boarding. The ship's bow was equipped with a dragon head through which cannon could be fired and clouds of smoke could be emitted to obscure the ship's position. Cannon and guns could also be fired from the stern and the sides of the ship. As a result of Yi's preparations, his forces, unlike most of the Korean military, were ready to fight when the Japanese invaded in 1592. Yi's victories off the southern coast effectively cut off the Japanese troops in Korea from supplies and reinforcements and prevented the Japanese from pressing their initial advantage. In 1593 Yi was given command of the entire Korean fleet, but, following peace negotiations, in 1597 he was again falsely accused of disloyalty and demoted to the rank of common soldier. The Japanese then launched a second invasion and succeeded in destroying almost all of the Korean navy. Yi was reinstated as commander of the few remaining ships and, continuing his undefeated battle record, soon restored Korea's control of the seas. He was killed by a stray bullet as he pursued the retreating Japanese forces during the final campaign of the war. Today, Admiral Yi is considered one of Korea's greatest heroes of all time. Koreans look upon Yi as a man of courage, perseverance, strength, self-sacrifice, and loyalty to his country.

The Korean military hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yi Sun-Sin[COLOR_REVERT]. Available in the renaissance era, he starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomy[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros militaire Coréen est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yi Sun-Sin[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible à la Renaissance, il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marchand[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe militar coreano es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yi Sun-sin[COLOR_REVERT]. Disponible a partir del Renacimiento, comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercader[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Educación[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomía[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Wojskowy Koreańczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yi Sun-Sin[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Handlarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Edukacji[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomii[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Yolngu Messenger

Yolu sustained good trade relations with Macassan fisherman for several hundred years. The Macassans respected the land as Yolu land; they only ever camped on the beach, and generally avoided contact with Yolu women. They made yearly visits to harvest trepang and pearls, paying Yolu in kind with goods such as knives, metal, canoes, tobacco and pipes.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yolngu Messenger[COLOR_REVERT] is a Yolngu unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Messager Yolngu[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Yolngu unique.

TEXT.English: Yumi Archer

The word "yumi" means either a long or short bow used in kyudo, the ancient Japanese art of archery. The traditional yumi stands at over 6 feet fall, often dwarfing the archer, and is made from laminated bamboo, wood, and animal hide, in a process that is still the same today as it was two thousand years ago. The yumi's unique asymmetric design, where the upper and lower curves differ, is a style that dates to around 250 BCE. It is believed the asymmetric shape was designed for use on horseback, so the bow could be switched from one side of the horse to the other with relative ease.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yumi Archer[COLOR_REVERT], a unique unit for the Yamato fights just as well in melee as at range.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer Yumi[COLOR_REVERT], une unité unique pour le Yamato qui combat aussi bien en mêlée qu'à distance.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]L'arciere Yumi[COLOR_REVERT] ha ottime capacità sia nel combattimento ravvicinato, sia a distanza.
TEXT.Polish: Łucznik Yumi to odmiana łucznika, która radzi sobie świetnie w walce wręcz i dystansowej.

TEXT.English: Yupanqui
Yupanqui Bowman

The bow and arrow appears around the transition from the Upper Paleolithic to the Mesolithic. At the site of Nataruk in Turkana, Kenya, obsidian bladelets found embedded in a skull and within the thoracic cavity of another skeleton, suggest the use of stone-tipped arrows as weapons. After the end of the last glacial period, use of the bow seems to have spread to every inhabited continent, including the New World, except for Australia.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yupanqui Bowman[COLOR_REVERT] is a Chimu unique unit.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer long Yupanqui[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Chimu unique.

TEXT.English: Lloque Yupanqui was the third Sapa Inca of the Kingdom of Cuzco (beginning around CE 1260) and a member of the Hurin dynasty. He is said to have established the public market in Cuzco and built the Acllahuasi. In the days of the Inca Empire, this institution gathered young women from across the empire; some were given by the Inca as concubines to nobles and warriors and others were dedicated to the cult of the Sun god. Sometimes they were simply servants.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yupanqui[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
Yurupari

In many of the Indian cultures these rites take a central position among other important ceremonies such as funerals and fertility rites. In the Guianas and the northwest Amazon region, the initiation of the boys is very complex. The Yurupary celebration inducts the boys into the secret society of mature men. Special rites are revealed to them; they are shown the sacred trumpets or the masks representing ancestral spirits. They are subjected to violent whippings, which they must tolerate without the least expression of pain.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yurupari[COLOR_REVERT] are Arawak culture unit. They are like [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Spearmans[COLOR_REVERT] with bonuses to combat in forests and in looting.
Yusuf ibn Tashfin

Yusuf ibn Tashfin'was an ethnic Berber and Almoravid ruler in North Africa and Al-Andalus (Moorish Iberia). After succeeding to the leadership of the reformist movement in 1060, he continued to expand his territorial base across the Maghreb, building Marrakech as his capital. In 1085, he was invited by the beleaguered Muslim emirs in Spain to assist them against the Christian Reconquista and inflicted a crushing defeat on the armies of Alfonso VI of Castile. The emirs thought he would go home after this, having completed what they had asked of him. He did go home, but while there obtained opinions from Muslim jurists supporting the emirs' overthrow as lax and corrupt. In 1090, he crossed back over to Ibera, defeated and deposed the rulers, reuniting splintered Muslim territory into a single state. Although he did not add significantly to this territory, he succeeded in pushing back the Reconquista. He did annex Valencia, which resisted his armies until 1100. He died at the age of 101, six years later. The dynasty lasted until defeated by the even stricter Almohads in 1147.
TEXT.Polish: Jusuf ibn Taszfin (ur. 1009, zm. 2 września 1106) - władca Maroka z dynastii Almorawidów. Jusuf ibn Taszfin był stryjem przywódcy Almorawidów Abu Bakra ibn Umara i otrzymał od niego władzę w Maroku w 1070 roku, gdy sam Abu Bakr wyjechał tłumić powstanie plemion na Saharze. Jusuf wykorzystał nieobecność Abu Bakra do organizacji własnej administracji w kraju i budowy wojska najemnego. Kiedy Abu Bakr wrócił do kraju w 1073 roku, zrezygnował z walki o władzę i wycofał się z powrotem na Saharę. Jusuf ibn Taszfin stał się w ten sposób założycielem dynastii Taszfinidów, przewodzących Almorawidom aż do 1147 roku. W kolejnych latach Jusuf podbił plemiona Miknasa i Magrawa, w 1075 roku zajął Fez, w 1077 Tangier, a w 1083 Ceutę. W 1081 roku panował już nad całą zachodnią Algierią aż do Algieru, jednak w 1082 roku jego marsz na wschód powstrzymali Hammadydzi przy wsparciu Banu Hilal. W 1082 roku andaluzyjscy władcy po raz pierwszy poprosili Jusufa ibn Taszfina o wsparcie przeciw chrześcijańskim królestwom na Półwyspie Iberyjskim. Dopiero jednak po ponownej prośbie ze strony Abbadytów, Aftasydów i Zyrynidów z Granady Jusuf wylądował z wojskiem w Andaluzji i 23 października 1086 rozbił wojska kastylijskiego króla Alfonsa VI w bitwie pod Sagrajas. Kiedy jednak w 1088 roku królestwa Taify odmówiły mu wsparcia, Jusuf ibn Taszfin zwrócił się przeciw nim i w 1090 roku obalił Zyrynidów z Granady i Abbadydów z Sewilli, a do 1095 roku zaanektował prawie wszystkie pozostałe królestwa. W 1102 roku Jusufowi poddała się Walencja, broniona wcześniej przez wojska Cyda, a w 1110 roku Saragossa pod wodzą Hudydów.

TEXT.English: The Berber national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yusuf ibn Tashfin[COLOR_REVERT], available in the medieval era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Messenger[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literature[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alchemy[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Berbère est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yusuf ibn Tashfin[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à l'ère médiévale. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Messager[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Littérature[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alchimie[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional bereber es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yusuf ibn Tasufin[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir de la Edad Media. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mensajero[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatura[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alquimia[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Berberów to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jusuf ibn Taszfin[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Posłańca[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Literatury[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Wynalazków[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Yu Spearman

Qiang is the Chinese term for spear. Due to its relative ease of manufacture, the spear in many variations was ubiquitous on the pre-modern Chinese battlefield. It is known as one of the four major weapons, along with the Gun (staff), Dao (sabre), and the Jian (sword), called in this group "The King of Weapons".
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yu Spearman[COLOR_REVERT] is a Xia unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lancier Yu[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Xia unique.

TEXT.English: Yu the Great

Yu the Great was a legendary ruler in ancient China famed for his introduction of flood control, inaugurating dynastic rule in China by founding the Xia Dynasty, and for his upright moral character. The dates proposed for Yu's reign precede the oldest known written records in China, the oracle bones of the late Shang dynasty, by nearly a millennium. No inscriptions on artifacts from the supposed era of Yu, nor the later oracle bones, make any mention of Yu; he does not appear in inscription until vessels dating to the Western Zhou period (c. 1045-771 BC). The lack of anything remotely close to contemporary documentary evidence has led to some controversy over the historicity of Yu. Proponents of the historicity of Yu theorise that stories about his life and reign were transmitted orally in various areas of China until they were recorded in the Zhou dynasty, while opponents believe the figure existed in legend in a different form - as a god or mythical animal - in the Xia dynasty, and morphed into a human figure by the start of the Zhou dynasty. Many of the stories about Yu were collected in Sima Qian's famous Records of the Grand Historian. Yu and other "sage-kings" of Ancient China were lauded for their virtues and morals by Confucius and other Chinese teachers.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yu the Great[COLOR_REVERT] is hero unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yu le Grand[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité héroïque.

TEXT.English: Zagon

Until the beginning of the 18th century, Crimean Tatars were known for frequent, at some periods almost annual, devastating raids into Ukraine and Russia. For a long time, until the late 18th century, the Crimean Khanate maintained a massive slave trade with the Ottoman Empire and the Middle East which was the most important basis of its economy. One of the most important trading ports and slave markets was Kefe. Slaves and freedmen formed approximately 75% of the Crimean population.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zagon[COLOR_REVERT] is a Tatars unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zagon[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Tatars unique.

TEXT.English: Zaporozki Kozak

The Zaporozhian Cossacks were Cossacks who lived beyond the rapids of the Dnieper River, the land also known under the historical term Wild Fields in today's Central Ukraine. Today much of its territory is flooded by the waters of Kakhovka Reservoir.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zaporozki Kozak[COLOR_REVERT] is a Ukrainian unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zaporozki Kozak[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Ukrainienne unique.

TEXT.English: Zbojnik

According to the legend, he robbed nobles and gave the loot to the poor, a deed often attributed to the famous Robin Hood. The legend was also known in neighbouring Silesia, the Margraviate of Moravia and later spread to the Kingdom of Bohemia. The actual robber had little to do with the modern legend, whose content partly reflects the ubiquitous folk myths of a hero taking from the rich and giving to the poor. However, the legend was also shaped in important ways by the activists and writers in the 19th century when Janosík became the key highwayman character in stories that spread in the north counties of the Kingdom of Hungary (much in present Slovakia) and among the local Gorals and Polish tourists in the Podhale region north of the Tatras (Tatra). The image of Janosík as a symbol of resistance to oppression was reinforced when poems about him became part of the Slovak and Czech middle and high school literature curriculum, and then again with the numerous films that propagated his modern legend in the 20th century. During the anti-Nazi Slovak National Uprising, one of the partisan groups bore his name.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zbojnik[COLOR_REVERT] is a Slovakian unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zbojnik[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Slovaques unique.

TEXT.English: Zenu Goldsmiths

The Zenu culture existed from about 200 BCE to about 1600 CE, constructing major water works and producing gold ornaments. The gold that was often buried with their dead lured the Spanish conquerors, who looted much of the gold. With the arrival of the Spaniards, the tribe all but died out. The 16th-century Spanish chroniclers wrote about the Zenu who were still living there, but recorded little or nothing about the history of the Zenu
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zenu Goldsmiths[COLOR_REVERT] is a Zenu unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zenu Goldsmiths[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Zenu unique.

TEXT.English: Zheng He

Zheng He, a contemporary of European explorers such as Henry the Navigator, was an admiral and diplomat who helped to extend Chinese maritime and commercial influence throughout the regions bordering the Indian Ocean. Born to a Muslim family of Yunnan province, he was made an eunuch at an early age, and gained the trust of the Emperor Yongle. Selected by the emperor to be commander in chief of the missions to the Western Oceans, he first set sail in 1405, commanding 62 ships and 27,800 men. He made a total of seven voyages in his lifetime, traveling through most of Southeast Asia, Indonesia, India, Sri Lanka, Persia, Arabia, Egypt, and East Africa. After his sixth voyage, the Yongle emperor died. In the shift of policy his successor, the Hongxi emperor, suspended naval expeditions abroad. However, he was allowed to do one last, seventh voyage, in 1433, in order to take the pilgrimage to Mecca that all good Muslims were expected to do. He died on the trip home. Zheng He was the best known of the Yongle emperor's diplomatic agents. Although some historians see no achievement in the naval expeditions other than flattering the emperor's vanity, these missions did have the effect of extending China's political sway over maritime Asia for half a century. Admittedly, they did not, like similar voyages of European merchant-adventurers, lead to the establishment of trading empires. Yet, in their wake, Chinese emigration increased, resulting in Chinese colonization in Southeast Asia and the accompanying tributary trade, which lasted to the 19th century. Though it will never be known, it is quite possible that had Zheng He's voyages not been suspended, the Chinese fleets could have possibly explored even more territories, perhaps to even discover the Americas (certainly it was logistically possibly), and thus, China's influence on the world - and modern history, undoubtedly - could have been very much different.
TEXT.Polish: Zheng He, (ur. 1371 w Kuanying, prow. Junnan zm. 1433) - chiński admirał, który w latach 1405-1433 odbył serię podróży do wielu miejsc w Azji i Afryce. Był muzułmaninem, eunuchem i zaufanym człowiekiem chińskiego cesarza Yongle z dynastii Ming. Odbył podróże do południowo-wschodniej Azji, Sumatry, Jawy, Cejlonu, Indii, Persji, Zatoki Perskiej, Arabii, Morza Czerwonego aż do Egiptu i Mozambiku. Jego wyprawy przyczyniły się do rozwoju handlu i wiedzy nawigacyjnej.

TEXT.English: The Chinese national hero is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zheng He[COLOR_REVERT], available in the renaissance era. He starts off with a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scholar[COLOR_REVERT] in his retinue. He can be built once [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optics[COLOR_REVERT] are researched.
TEXT.French: Le Héros national Chinois est [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zheng He[COLOR_REVERT], disponible à la Renaissance. Il commence avec un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erudit[COLOR_REVERT] dans sa suite. Il peut être construit lorsque [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optique[COLOR_REVERT] sont recherchés.
TEXT.Spanish: El héroe nacional chino es [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zheng He[COLOR_REVERT], disponible a partir del Renacimiento. Comienza con el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Erudito[COLOR_REVERT] en su séquito. Puede ser entrenado una vez investigadas la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Educación[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Óptica[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Bohater Narodowy Chińczyków to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zheng He[COLOR_REVERT]. Rozpoczyna w towarzystwie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Handlarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Może zostać wyszkolony wraz z odkryciem [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Edukacji[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Optyki[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Zhuge Keshik

The assassination of the leaders of rival Mongol tribes was a common occurrence thanks to the ever-shifting loyalties and conflicting interests at play within Mongol tribal politics. The father of Genghis Khan, Yesugei, for example, was unwittingly poisoned by one of his enemies. The risk was especially high at night since the ger that Mongol nomads traditionally sleep in lacked a solid wall, and so a sword or spear could easily penetrate the walls and kill the subject inside. As a result, the Mongol and Turkic monarchs in Mongolia typically had personal guards. The Kerait khan Toghoril (Wang Khan) had an imperial guard, Torguud. According to an oral tradition, their descendants could be Torghut people. After the defeat of Wang Khan in 1203, Genghis established the kheshig. The kheshig consisted mainly of sworn personal followers.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zhuge Keshik[COLOR_REVERT] is a Xiongnu unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zhuge Keshik[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Xiongnu unique.

TEXT.English: Zhuge No

Archaeological evidence of the earliest repeating crossbow from Tomb 47 at Qinjiazui, Hubei Province has been dated to the 4th century BC, during the Spring and Autumn period. However, its invention is commonly attributed to Zhuge Liang (181-234 AD), a famous military advisor of the Three Kingdoms period; Zhuge Liang improved the design of the repeating crossbow, and made a version which shot two to three bolts at once and was used in massed formations. For this reason, it was named after him. Other repeating crossbows fired as many as 10 bolts before exhausting the magazine.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zhuge No[COLOR_REVERT] is a Qin unique unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Zhuge No[COLOR_REVERT] est une unité Qin unique.

TEXT.English: Magi

Magi is a term, used since at least the 6th century BCE, to denote followers of Zoroastrianism or Zoroaster. The earliest known usage of the word Magi is in the trilingual inscription written by Darius the Great, known as the Behistun Inscription. Old Persian texts, pre-dating the Hellenistic period, refer to a Magus as a Zurvanic, and presumably Zoroastrian, priest.
TEXT.French: Le Mage est un terme utilisé depuis au moins le 6e siècle avant notre ère pour désigner les adeptes du zoroastrisme ou de Zoroastre. Le premier usage connu du mot Mage est dans l'inscription trilingue écrite par Darius le Grand, connue sous le nom de Behistun Inscription. Les vieux textes persans, antérieurs à la période hellénistique, se réfèrent à un mage comme un prêtre zurvanique et vraisemblablement zoroastrien.
